Reviews.Title: “great location but not cheap!!”
Reviews.Author: ktmc31
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because of its location, 2 blocks from Fishermans Wharf, 3 different cable cars leave from here to go to Unions Square. The hotel was clean, the staff very helpful, Brandi is just lovely! our room was a decent size but small bathroom. We paid $214 a night + all the other taxes they put on our 2 nights stay came to $495, we paid much less for the Bellagio!! I guess because it was spring break the prices go up! Would recommend a lively dinner a Bubba Gump Shrimp Co and a bike ride over the Golden Gate Bridge!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: prof2012llb
Reviews.Content: My wife and friends went to San Francisco for a valentine get away weekend in 2010. This hotel is located is a couple blocks from the wharf. Great restaurants located nearby. Brandi at the front desk was very helpful. Tours were easil accessed. Everything we wanted to see was within walking distance. I would definately stay here again. Good breakfast. Very Clean

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MittMor7
Reviews.Content: Wow, we got in and checked right in. We had a huge room with two double beds, pull out couch, sitting area and an amazing window. We were on the front corner of the building that is round so our window was huge. Large Kitchen type area, plenty of room for the five of us. The staff was very helpful and friendly. My only complaint would be the $45 parking fee.

Reviews.Title: “Best Choice”
Reviews.Author: suzysw
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. the location is perfect unless you plan to spend a lot of time in Union Square at the expensive designer stores. This hotel is very close to everything you need and a great location especially if you plan to do bus tours. Most of those pick up and drop back to the Wharf area. Cable Car stops are also close by. Hotel rooms were quiet, and very clean. Very nice breakfast, free internet in rooms. Staff very helpful and friendly. Highly recommend and I will certainly stay here again whenever I return to San Fran...

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: AgustinaB
Reviews.Content: I sayed at this hotel for 5 nights. The Breakfast is outstanding and the best part is if you are too late for dinner, there's a Denny's just around the corner. Its close to all the turist spots and within walking distance from the Fisherman's Wharf and the Girardhelli Ice Cream Shop. Also, you can walk down to Pier 37 for some more fun! The service at the hotel is great, clean, neat and the staff are very friendly. The only think I could find as a negative is that the maids are not very quiet even when you put your do not disturb sign. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect choice!”
Reviews.Author: natskee
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the beach apartment block which was a shotr walk from the main hotel and was large, clean and comfy. This was the first stop on our honeymoon roadtrip and we couldn't have been happier with the location. Fishermans' Wharf is lovely! The hotel is across the road from all the piers where most things happen and the tram stops are right there too. Great base for exploring. We had a perfect view of Alcatraz from our room which was really exciting for us being first time visitors to SF! Front desk where lovely and upgraded us which was a nice touch. Don't hesitate to book if you want a good value, well located base for exploring the city.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel in Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: sweetesteye
Reviews.Content: The room was spacious enough with the basic amenities. Overall it was clean, but I was still wary of walking barefoot on the carpet. With a good selection of channels on TV and lots of closet space, in addition to a reasonably unobstructed view, the room met my very basic standards. A major drawback was the absence of free in-room wireless internet, although a wired connection was available. In an age of e-readers and ubiquitous wireless devices, I find this ridiculous. The free breakfast buffet was more than adequate. In addition to the usual cereal, muffins, etc. there was a pancake machine that produced perfectly edible fare. Check-in and check-out were pleasant if not particularly friendly. The platinum amenity is a joke. When I returned home there were two strange charges on my credit card that disappeared within a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a Great location!”
Reviews.Author: scotsman2011
Reviews.Content: Currently on a West Coast USA tour and spent the 1st four nights here in the Holiday Inn Express Fishermans Wharf. I have booked 4 hotels from this chain so I was really happy with my 1st choice!! On arrival at the hotel after a near 24 hour trip to get there, we were warmly welcomed at the check-in desk and the check-in process was very quick which was a welcome! We were in a Junior suite which was spotlessly clean & spacious with comfortable beds! Delighted with the room and served us well for the four nights. Breakfast was great, a good mixture of hot & cold items and was a good start to the day. Ideal location with various forms or transport basically on the doorstep. Theres a Dennys round the corner with an Ihop just along the road. Thoroughly enjoyed our stay here and would recommend this hotel to visitors in San Francisco!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean, comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: MalaysianAged28
Reviews.Content: 4 of us travelled together and this hotel provided us with two queen sized beds. FACILITIES Two (2) Queen Sized Bed One (1) TV Hair Dryer Fridge (but it was not cold â€“ we found out later when our ice cream melted) Coffee Maker (which can be used to boil water) Microwave In-room safe No bedroom slippers TV Standard TV channels. AIR COND / HEATER One air cond / heater was provided. STAFF Very friendly and helpful. If you donâ€™t know what to do next, just drop by the front desk for ideas. BATHROOM Soap, shampoo. If required you can request for a tooth brush, shaver, shaving cream, comb, etc which is provided free of charge. Clean bathroom. Good water pressure with hot and cold water. BREAKFAST Breakfast was provided. This is the standard Holiday Inn Express breakfast. The spread was sufficient with burger / bacon, eggs, muffin, bread, bagel, pancake, yogurt, cinnamon roll, juice, coffee & tea. Although a good variety, you can easily get tired of it as we stayed in Holiday Inn Express in Vancouver, San Francisco, Grand Canyon, and LA and it was ALWAYS the same breakfast. OTHER COMMENTS There was no additional hidden charges such as â€œresort feesâ€� which is charged by most hotels. I paid about $150 a night for a three-night stay on Wed - Friday which I think was affordable when sharing among 4 people. No Free Parking â€“ but we didnâ€™t drive so it was not a problem. Parking in SanFran is very expensive. Near the wharf it is $2 per half hour. There was free Wifi but the signal was not strong enough in the room. We had to go down to the lobby to use the Wifi. If you plan to get work done in your hotel room and require Wifi, then you will be dissapointed. LOCATION Five minute walk away from the main eating and shopping area at the wharf. A convenience store, Walgreens was also nearby. We could easily catch the cable car or tramp to Union Square or the Lombard Street, the worldâ€™s most crookedest street. SURPRISES The town closes quite early. We went out for dinner at 8pm and most shops were already closed. OVERALL I paid US$150 per night and stayed on the 7th â€“ 10th Mar 2012. A satisfactory experience as this is a family hotel and nothing too fancy. It was quiet and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location for exploring!”
Reviews.Author: 2onatrip
Reviews.Content: We selected Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites specifically for the location, as we love to walk the wonderful streets of San Francisco, and this Fisherman's Wharf location is an excellent starting point. The rooms are good sized, and very clean. Freebies include a breakfast just off the lobby and free internet in the lobby area. One of the greatest things about Holiday Inn Express is that the very reasonable rate also included parking! this is a VERY GOOD THING if you've ever tried to park in town. We drove to town, parked our car and never used it again until we left. It was all safe in the garage and the valet brought it up when we were ready to leave. Very nice! Breakfast is buffet style, very basic but good and it gets you out the door and on your adventure. The location is less than 5 minutes walk to Fisherman's Wharf, and Pier 39. The famous Lombard street zigs & zags, and the ferry to Alcatraz is about a 20 minute walk.. There is a TON of San Francisco sights and sounds at Fisherman's Wharf, and you're also within walking distance of Ghirardelli Square, Maritime Park, Fort Mason Green -and that's just in one direction. Walk the other way and follow the Embarcaderro all the way around to Rincon Park! and good luck choosing a place to eat, there are just TOO MANY to pick just one. Better plan on having lunch AND dinner, just so you don't miss out! I always recommend Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites and I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “! The Perfect Location For Staying at Fisherman's Wharf !”
Reviews.Author: chynna
Reviews.Content: We chose the Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites as we had less than 48 hours in which to experience San Francisco, and this offered the most flexibility for all the activities we wanted to do. The rooms are reasonably spacious, and clean. There is also free internet in the lobby, which was great for confirming our next flights etc. Breakfast is buffet style, but basic. However, we were impressed with what was on offer - and had also chosen this accommodation because of our limited time in San Francisco and we didn't need the hassle of trying to find a breakfast place before beginning our exploration of the city. The location is less than 5 minutes walk to Fisherman's Wharf, and Pier 39. The crooked part of Lombard is about 10 minutes walk, and the ferry to Alcatraz is about 15-20 minutes flat walk away from here. There is also a range of San Francisco sightseeing options at Fisherman's Wharf, and we found it easy to catch a double decker bus which took us over the Golden Gate Bridge and back. I've since recommended the Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites to others, and I would definitely stay there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for 1st time visitors”
Reviews.Author: finallyavacation29
Reviews.Content: I live 3 hrs from SF and the first couple of times we always stayed here. Nice location, great continental breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: De A
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the Holiday Inn Fishermans Wharf. The outside of the hotel is not the nicest but the room itself was very comfortable. The bathroom was also very nice and clean. I was in the room by myself so I really got to enjoy what it had to offer. Although i did like the location of the hotel I feel the Fishermans Wharf is to touristy for me and I will try to stay somewhere else whenever i return to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort, location an a great price.”
Reviews.Author: travlin_menkos
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 5 days and found that it is a constant in terms of great service, food and all round atmosphere. Never lacking in any way, the staff was very accommodating and helpful. The housekeeping was very professional and reliable to get things done at the best time for us and the complementary breakfast was always hot and delicious. Location was phenomenal...about a 3 minute walk to the main piers and so close to all forms of transit. A great trip all around. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Fraudulent business”
Reviews.Author: Christina G
Reviews.Content: This hotel charges your credit card for the full amount when you make a reservation and will not refund the amount if you cancel the reservation. DO NOT BOOK A ROOM HERE! THEY STEAL YOUR MONEY!

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: NemoNik
Reviews.Content: This hotel is adequate for a stay in the SFO area, be it for business or pleasure. The rooms are clean and well furnished with free wired internet. The internet connectivity speed is good. The CRT television seems a bit outdated now a days. (even Comfort Inns have LCD TVs, if not HDTVs these days); but it does not matter unless you plan on actually watching TV. Sometimes you do hear noises from adjoining rooms but that is normally the case with most hotels. The breakfast service isn't as good as I have had at other places but since it was complimentary and there were a large number of people, you can't harp too much on it. All in all, I would say its a good place to crash at night at a reasonable rate. It is close to the wharves, Pier-39 and Ghirardelli square and on the F-train route if you need to go downtown. However, if you are looking for something more elegant than an "adequately" furnished restaurants, there are other hotels in the immediate vicinity albeit at a higher price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice comfortable rooms near EVERYTHING!”
Reviews.Author: Seahawksman
Reviews.Content: I am writing my review from the hotel so it's fresh in my mind. I've stayed here for a week now and have slept like a baby. The beds are new and the linens are clean. The wallpaper, TV, and curtains do need some updating, but it was acceptable for an HIE. The staff was very friendly and helpful! The breakfast was probably the best I've ever had in a hotel! tons of variety and plenty of it! There are several hotels around this very same block, but I'd book here first!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CastinCutie
Reviews.Content: We made a last minute decision to had to SF for the 49ers VS Saints game. The hotel was very accomadating. The room was nice. Could have used tome more comfy pillows. If you aren't planning on staying in your room much then it is a great hotel. A few blocks from the water and in a very safe neighborhood. Only draw back was the breakfast buffet was $21 a person! Had we known that ahead of time we would have gone to the Denny's around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: Rob2159
Reviews.Content: Great price and location at time or our visit. Since I think Holiday Inn has increased the prices but great location. Property bigger than most "express" locations more like full hotel. Good larger rooms with windows able to open and get some bay air. Nice views, great large free breakfest buffett, nice garage parking.

Reviews.Title: “rojo”
Reviews.Author: travellerMooroolbark
Reviews.Content: we loved the proximity to everything. we also had no view, so would ask for view next time. front desk staff were friendly and very helpful. thought it was value for money. would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Average room but a great location - great view of Alcatraz!!”
Reviews.Author: Ffi0n
Reviews.Content: Room was average, and cleanliness was average, walls were pritty thin could hear people in the neighbouring rooms clearly; BUT the high point of the room was we had an amazing view of Alcatraz. Location was excellent, only a 2 minute walk to Pier 39 with all of the attractions. Had a wicked Philly Burger in Denny's Diner within the hotel and reasonably priced. The good points outweigh the bad points. We didn't spend much time in our room thou we had so much stuff to see in San Fran!! Brilliant place!!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and location”
Reviews.Author: jrodx2
Reviews.Content: We just got back from staying at this hotel for three nights. For the price, we thought the rooms would be a little bigger with better views (the windows look out onto other windows) but the location could not be beat for us. We were within a few blocks of the cable cars, the MUNI bus, Ghiradelli square and Fisherman's Warf. Due to this, we had no problems getting around and seeing everything we wanted to during our stay. The rooms are clean but pretty basic but we didn't plan on being in them much so we didn't care. They do offer free breakfast which is nice if you are looking to save some money on meals. I brought my own oatmeal to eat for breakfast but learned there was no microwave. However, the staff behind the front desk had no problem letting me into the back office to use theirs. They were also really helpful in suggesting places to go and answering any questions. We would definatly stay at this hotel if visiting again!

Reviews.Title: “Makes it easy to stay a night for work or pleasure”
Reviews.Author: PBandJ01
Reviews.Content: This is a great location to stay for a couples' night in San Francisco followed by a 3-night business trip. It's easy to walk around to the sights and activities along Fisherman's Wharf and the Embarcadero. For dining we could choose from everything from Denny's to exceptional seafood. The cable car was just a block away. Hotel was solid for business too with everything needed for the next 3 days of conference. Friendly hotel staff. Parking at $45 was offered, but found $20 per night parking at Anchor Center 2 blocks away with in and out privileges after talking with the attendant. I'll be more eager to go to the city for a night in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and service”
Reviews.Author: kacijo204
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights with family of 4. Unbeatable location, removed from the tourist area yet close enough to walk to the Wharf, North Beach and Telegraph Hill, as well as all mass transit options. Convenient and very cost effective breakfast. Nearby Trader Joe's is very healthy and affordable, offering many prepared salads and wraps for under $5.00. Front desk friendly and helpful. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Strange happenings...”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie A
Reviews.Content: My two sons and I stayed here for spring break of 2011, I think about our stay often, and wonder if I should write a review. The hotel as a whole was a perfect fit for us, it's close to everything you could want to see in San Fransisco. The hotel is clean, my kids loved the breakfasts in the morning. The one experience I personally had was of a paranormal nature, can't say that I used to actually believe in ghosts, but I do now. Our room was on the 3rd floor, the room was always hot during the day, I called maintenance for this issue, at night it was like a freezer in the room. My bed was closest to the window, along the opposite wall is the double mirrored closets, while laying in bed you have a clear view of the bathroom. The second night of our stay, I awoke at 2:30 am to see who I thought was my son, head bent sitting on the commode looking at his phone. the room is totally dark and when the i phones light is on, it kind of glows like a flashlight . I at first didn't think anything of it, 17 yr old teens use their phones at all hours. I went back to sleep, and at 3:00 woke up again, only this time I called his name, asking what was he still doing on his phone, the person that looked up at me wasn't my son. I slammed on the light next to my bed, only to find my two sons asleep in the bed next to me. I was struck numb and speechless, with the nightstand light on, I could tell that the person wasn't solid. I always thought that it would be fun to see a spirit, after my experience, I think a bit differently. I was so scared I couldn't leave my bed at all that night. We all had weird things happening with our phones, the lights in the room, after that 2nd night we slept with the door closed. We wanted to change rooms and used the air conditioning as an excuse, the hotel was fully booked. I then called the manager from my cell, to ask if there was any experiences like this on the 3rd floor. I was embarrassed and a bit freaked out. they said no but asked for me to please tell them what room I was in, I caved and told them our experience. They were very sympathetic and said that I was the first person that this happened to, they explained to me that the hotel is fairly new, and they didn't know of any deaths in room 315. I really struggled with the idea of sharing our experience, I know that I would've liked to know if someone else had these weird experiences. Even after everything...we would stay in the hotel again, just not in 315.

Reviews.Title: “Seems to be used by a lot of tour companies”
Reviews.Author: dandjo
Reviews.Content: We were independant travellers and were quite suprised when we arrived at this hotel to find the reception packed with people either waiting to check in or out or waiting for coaches to take them somewhere.We tried the complimentary breakfast on the first day but chose to eat elsewhere afterwards. It is well placed for Fishermans Wharf. Get a MUNI pass. A tourist map that is free will give you enough info to be able to work the bus and cable car routes out

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: kiwipaul_8
Reviews.Content: booked this hotel about 3 months in advance.got a great rate.check in was very easy,great girl on front desk was very pleasent and gave a good welcome.room was ready despite me being early.room and bathroom was very nice and spotlessy clean.bed very nice and comfy.hotel is in a great location.about 1 block to fishermans wharf and about 5m walk to pier 39.heaps of places to eat and very nice food it is to. breakfast was pretty good and no shortage of choices,and heaps of tables..pancake machine very cool. would stay here again.recommend!! don't forget to go see the sea lions at pier 39.very funny and don't forget camera.

Reviews.Title: “Quality Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: drjandthemissus
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked 7 nights at the Holiday Inn Express Fishermanâ€™s Wharf on a recent trip to San Francisco to see friends and tour the city. The room rate for a king bed averaged $160 per night (weeknights were slightly more, weekend nights were slightly less). A full breakfast was included (bacon, sausage, eggs, biscuits and gravy, hot cinnamon rolls, as well as pastries, fruit, coffee, tea, and juices). Quality of the food was consistently good. Wireless internet is available in the lobby free of charge; wired connections are available in-room free of charge. The room was clean, of reasonable size, and with new furnishings. The bathroom was not large, but was of adequate size and was spotless. Common areas are similarly clean, modern, and with new furniture. I would guess that the hotel has been built or renovated within the past two years. Staff were friendly and professional. One of the best features of the hotel, however, is simply its location. The hotel is located less than 10 minutesâ€™ walk from Fishermanâ€™s Wharf, Pier 39, the Alcatraz Ferry, Ghirardelli Square, both cablecar lines, and numerous tram and bus lines. The Golden Gate Bridge is viewable from several of these locations. This is a great location if youâ€™re touring the city. In summary, this hotel provides unspectacular but consistent quality â€“ itâ€™s what you would expect at a nice, new Holiday Inn Express. Furthermore, the hotel charges a reasonable rate (in a very expensive city) and it has a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Hankaren
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week in this hotel last September. It was so convenient to everything. And a full breakfast was included in the rate. We had no complaints

Reviews.Title: “Good location in San Francisco for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: Cowbridgelady
Reviews.Content: Good basic hotel in perfect sightseeing location in San Francisco. Spent 7 days there in a standard, but spacious double room on the front looking towards the Hyatt Hotel. Used the hopon-hopoff city sightseeing buses recommended by the Virgin rep (one block away and around the corner) so handy for doing the many sights of San Francisco. Highlights of our trip were definitely the night tour of Alcatraz (book online in advance with the official site for the inside tour otherwise you will just sail around it), walking the Golden Gate Bridge, exploring Golden Gate Park, lunching in Scomas in Sausalito outside in the sun (where Otis Redding apparently wrote 'Sitting on the Dock of the Bay' on a houseboat), exploring the tall ship/boats/submarine at Fishermans's Wharf, riding the cable cars and seeing crooked Lombard Street, exploring Chinatown, eating Clam Chowder in the Blue Mermaid, drinks in Jacks Bar, Irish coffee in Buena Vista and dining in the many restaurants in Little Italy - about 15 mins walk up Columbus. For us, we preferred to dine in Little Italy as we found the Wharf too big, brash, touristy and tacky (with a sprinkling of homeless and drunks wandering around) restaurant-wise it's probably great with kids, but as we were a couple we preferred the smaller more intimate restaurants up on Columbus. However, we did eat dinner in Knuckles (The Hyatt's restaurant opposite) and Pompei's Grotto on the Wharf (where we had the cheapest bottle of house wine in all the restaurants we visited) when we were tired and didn't want to walk far after sightseeing. We did find house wine very expensive with our meals, much more expensive than at home, and don't really understand why when all the Californian vineyards are only an hour or so away up the coast. Another night, when we were too tired, we just got a take-away pizza (recommended by reception) and a bottle of wine from the local supermarket and stayed in our spacious and comfortable room watching TV. The Holiday Inn Express itself was busy with friendly helpful reception staff but no bar or restaurant in-house. The breakfasts, just off the lobby, were hectic and plentiful, but not the healthiest - mainly consisting of burgers, burnt bacon, rubbery eggs, bread, pancakes, scones, very sweet pastries, tea, coffee, juice and some cereals including one rainbow coloured cereal (dread to think how many colourings and sugar in that one!!). The only healthy thing on the buffet was a banana and even the yoghurts were like the little kiddie ones once again full of colouring and sugar. Needlesstosay, I wasn't overly impressed with breakfast and even worse it's all on paper plates with plastic, knives and forks. But then, you could argue that breakfast was included in the room rate so it was cheaper than eating out every morning. There are two internet terminals, to the right as you come into reception, which were handy if they weren't busy and also useful for printing out info and our boarding passes. Overall, we were glad we booked the Holiday Inn Express and on our last day we enjoyed sitting by the pool of its sister hotel, the Holiday Inn, nextdoor so we could savour a little bit of Californian sunshine even in November. A nice suntrap, but disappointing you couldn't order a drink or food by the pool during the day (maybe it's different in the summer).

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel within walking distance of most attractions”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel25_11
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay in San Fran. This hotel was great mostly due to its great location. The hotel was beautiful and offered a great complimentary Breakfast. Walking distance to fisherman's wharf, shopping, Ghiradelli square, Hyde street pier (where you can catch the trolley up Hyde street) The line can get really long to make sure you plan ahead if you want to ride the street trolley up Hyde street. We also walked to Lombard st and over to Pioneer Park to see Coit Tower (This was a pretty long walk up and down lots of hills but it was beautiful and a great way to see the city) It is also fairly close to the fairy terminal for Alcatraz tours. Hotel is great if you want to stay at a nice hotel for a decent price with in walking distance to all of these things. We felt safe at this hotel, but a few blocks over it was a bit sketchy. Make sure you look into that before booking your hotel. I was surprised to find that a very well known brand hotel was located in an area I would never stay in. Hard to tell the location when booking everything online.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and convenient”
Reviews.Author: travelguy537
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night during a technical conference in San Francisco. This hotel was within 2 blocks of both cable car lines to Fisherman's Warf, and about the same distance to the Warf itself. Got great advice from the front desk for local muni buses and trolleys to get around the city without a car. Overnight parking at the hotel would have run $45. Breakfast was okay - eggs, bacon, sausage patties, pancakes, yogurt, cereal, breads, etc. Tube TV had problems with the remote. As others have noted, flat panels are cheap these days. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “The Breakfast was great”
Reviews.Author: krbsmile
Reviews.Content: I was invited to go on this 5 day/4 night weekend to San Francisco with my boyfriend and his family. We had one suite and two rooms. There were 8 of us total. I had read some reviews on here and was not really sure how it was going to be. It did not really matter since I was not the one booking/planning. However, I was very impressed with the staff, location, complimentary breakfast and the room. It is a typical Holiday Inn Express with a very accommodating staff. If you want to be close to the Wharf I highly suggest this location. I did not have any noise issues.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond the Holiday Inn "Express" Brand that you know of ...”
Reviews.Author: 1192011n
Reviews.Content: Excellent value for money compared to the other hotels around which are "supposedly" to be of a higher standard to the Express. Honestly I didn't find much of a diff between this hotel and the other "higher" hotel just down the street and I'm saving at least $50 in comparison to the next hotel with the same room. The room is very well maintained with very clean bathrooms and all; good selection of FOC b'fast for the price paid. Won't hesitate to come back here again! 3 thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, clean, good value, good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: JennyPeter
Reviews.Content: Almost every year a group of us go to Sonoma to stay for 3 nights at the Cottage Inn B&B but on our way into town we stop in San Fran at the Holiday Inn Express for 2 nights to do things in the city. We have been doing this for years and find the hotel consistently good in all aspects. We talk a shuttle from the airport what drops us at the door, we can walk to just about everything from the hotel, great restaurants, attractions, super continental breakfast in the morning and the price is a good value for the city. We keep going back. They have corporate rates so check to see if your company has special rates there too.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Hiker114
Reviews.Content: Spent New Year's Eve here. We had enough points for a weekend stay. The front desk clerk gave us a little goodie bag, thanked us for being rewards members, then said she was giving us one of the best rooms. It think it was. We were on the third floor and outside of our window we had Alcatraz! We heard the fireworks, but couldn't see them. The room was a nice size as was the bathroom. We never had the hotel breakfast, but went down and saw they had the usual. By the Way...my husband swears that Holiday Inns have the worst coffee! Our room did have the Tube TV, which did not seem right. I've gotten used to the flat screens now, it just seems wierd to still see a tube TV. That's the only knock I have...if it's even a knock. A couple of other things I woudl like to mention. This was only the 2nd time I have ever been in San Fran. My first experience, while memorable, was not fun. This was much better. We flew into Oakland, and took the Bart to San Fran, then caught the rail/bus thing within a block of the hotel. We walked to the warf and ate IVARs Chowder (awesome) and walked over and ate chocolate at Ghirardelli. I know...I'm bragging. We caught the bus to ATT park, which is why were were there, to watch Illinois vs. UCLA. We ate dinner at the Fishermans' Grotto one night. The food was okay, but the view made it all the better. Clear night. We ate breakfast one morning at the Hollywood cafe, which next door to the hotel. That food was tasty! Oh, and I had my first ever In and Out Double Double burger. Just for the sake of saying that I've had a "double double".

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean hotel, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Blake311
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after I was displeased with another hotel I was staying at on the wharf. This hotel is down the street from the regular holiday inn, and was extremely nice. The hotel is newer and very, very clean inside. I found the staff to be very helpful with directions, requests, etc. The breakfast was just OK, but definitely had enough options for me to enjoy. The location of this hotel is absolutely fantastic and I would recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: Bigmike3
Reviews.Content: Staff was wonderful, gave us a very nice quiet room, room was very nice, clean, nice bed with choice of pillows, Hotel was in excellent condition, Concierge arranged a tour for us very easily. Internet access was great in room, even though it is not Wi-Fi, they provide the cable. We stayed for three nights and overall was a wonderful stay. Only complaint would be the breakfast that is included, alot of the hot items were lukewarm. Would return though as located at the Wharf within easy walking distance of everything at the Wharf.

Reviews.Title: “Great place @ the wharf”
Reviews.Author: Stua76
Reviews.Content: We love this place. Breakfast is decent and included in the cost. Staff were awesome with cleaning and the concierge let us park in the drive way for 20 mins until we could return the car. $30 for overnight parking is steep but thanks to other reviews on here we knew to not use the valet services. Walgreens is close and there is free wifi in the lobby free wired Internet in the rooms. As well as computers in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “It was OK, but probably wouldn't stay again..”
Reviews.Author: Glamgran56
Reviews.Content: The accommodation itself was perfectly fine, standard Holiday Inn. I was first given a dark room at the back, my request for another room was given without fuss. So my room was big, two beds, great shower and view of the SF skyline. BUT as with other reviews the breakfast was horrible, greasy and carby. Horrible looking burgers, horrible bacon, horrible eggs and some horrible looking goo that turned out to be gravy. GRAVY? A pile of bananas, and very sweet cereals. More fresh fruit is surely not too much to ask in a city where you can get any kind of cuisine. On the up side staff were very helpful, and free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: mellytexas
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was excellent. The room was rather small and it would have been nice if the sink was outside the toilet/shower area. One of the elevators wasn't working the weekend we were there so we used the stairs the majority of the time which sucked dragging luggage down them. We enjoyed the breakfast and it is funny someone commented on weak coffee because we thought it was awfully strong. The free internet was a plus.

Reviews.Title: “It does what it says on the tin”
Reviews.Author: Olive1920
Reviews.Content: Room clean and comfortable and a good size. Staff helpful. Breakfast disappointing given other comments made but was sufficient - the coffee was very weak though which for The States is very unusual. Location is central for the piers, cable cars and tours. Getting around is easy though as transport is good and anyway if you are up for a walk it's the best way to see the City. This was our final stop on a round the world jaunt and the first time we had received free internet access - this was a big plus. All in all we knew what we were booking and the standards met our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice price”
Reviews.Author: jernesto55
Reviews.Content: We were at Fisherman's Wharf, the last december and stayed at the Holiday In Express. The experience was very good. The rooms were comfortables, the hotel staff was very nice, especially the counter girl named Brandy, who made us feel at home since the very first minute of our arriving. The breakfast (complementary) was very good. The complementary internet and the use of the lobby computers..OK. The MUNI transportation services were walking distance fron the hotel. I suggest the highest rooms, more quiets. Need more dust cleaning in the rooms. Walking distance from everything. I should return.

Reviews.Title: “just fair - "free breakfast" is an endless choice of processed fats & carbs”
Reviews.Author: WBM
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very close to Fishermans Wharf and is therefore all tourists and families. That area is tacky tourists galore - so be prepared. The room was decent - and I got a great rate that included a free breakfast. Breakfast is on paper plates - in an area that was not well serviced. Witnessed a staff member open the carton of half-n-half by putting his bare fingers in the pour spout and pulling it open that way. The food is unhealthy, fatty, cheap and very processed - green/unripe bananas were the only fruit. Even the yogurt was a cheap, kid brand (full of sugar and artificial flavors and colors.) We skipped on all that and ate elsewhere. If you're on a budget and/or with family and want to stay in this area - I would reco. Otherwise stay over near Market Street / Union Square area -- it's a much better location with higher quality hotels. After two nights here, we moved to another (albiet more expensive) hotel in that area.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: lesley h
Reviews.Content: We are staying at this hotel at the moment Exceptionally good value , the room ( and hotel ) is much better then I thought it would be , considering the price we paid ( around $99 /night ) We have a large room , the furniture is a good standard and looks new as does the rest of the hotel . The breakfast is more then adequate , but suggest you get down there early as it can get very busy . The location is good , in easy walking distance of many places / cable car stations or even the street cars which run along Fishermans Wharf then down Market Street to Castro ( you can get off along the route and walk to Union Square ) Fishermans Wharf is very 'touristy ' in places especially at night The hotel also provides free internet , its WiFi in the main areas and cabled in the room ( cable provided ) I would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: John W
Reviews.Content: Clean comfotable rooms with a fantastic price for location in San Francisco. Nice Free Cont breakfast also. Near the wharf, easy walk to most places to enjoy. Nice lobby and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: CraftingChris
Reviews.Content: Good location close to main Wharf area. Staff friendly and efficient. The room was spacious, well maintained and clea. The bed was really comfortable. There was some noise from people in the corridor on an evening. the complementary breakfase was good but the restaurant was very busy. This hotel is used by tour groups and there is a tendancy for large groups of pople coming down for breakfast together. Only disappointment was the free wifi is only available in the reception area.

Reviews.Title: “ideally placed for Fishermans Wharf, the f Line and the cable cars to get to the downtown area”
Reviews.Author: Davetheaddick
Reviews.Content: We booked this based on location and price as we were only stopping in San Francisco en route to Portland and the room was only intended as a place to sleep. The room was clean and of a standard Holiday Inn layout, the hotel is ideally placed for Fishermans Wharf, the f Line and the cable cars to get to the downtown area. We normally stay in the Holiday Inn along the road but have stayed in other Fisherman Wharf hotels and if you are planning on making the most of the San Francisco nightlife and only want somewhere to stay that is clean then this is worth considering.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Leyongt
Reviews.Content: I always believe location is the key of any hotel. This hotel as well, it is quite near the famous fisherman whalf. The room is clean, and there are some gift and grocery store around. Overall very good!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, great for families & well priced”
Reviews.Author: mixip
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a night with a large travelling party and it's a perfectly good, well sited hotel at Fisherman's wharf. Check in was very pleasant with a wonderfully friendly and chatty receptionist. The rooms are ok - this hotel probably needs a bit of a refresh in 2012 as things are starting to look a bit out of date and worn but that said, everything was clean and the bed was comfortable. This is a really great hotel for families as it has a great buffet breakfast and good amenities. Fisherman's wharf itself in November isn't the best place to be in San Francisco and I noticed far more homeless and begging going on around the streets than my last visit here 4 years ago - sign of the times I guess. Ultimately the very thing I love about San Fran is it's "realness" in relation to other cities but I can understand why some reviewers would comment on that. We visited Alcatraz for the evening tour which was just brilliant and the walk from hotel to Alcatraz pier is about 15 mins or so. Ultimately for a good price this is a great place to stay - one thing I would thing about if I was IHG was investing a bit of money in this hotel in 2012 if you want to keep people coming...

Reviews.Title: “HIE's are good value for Biz Travelers who like a little extra”
Reviews.Author: K B
Reviews.Content: As I make way up California I've discovered that Holiday Inn Express is a good value for Biz. The included Internet Access, Breakfasts and upgraded rooms make for those little extras that make long stretches from Home a little more pleasant. InterContinental Hotel Group seems to hold their Peeps to a high standard in a manner that is successful...... Thanks Again !

Reviews.Title: “We stayed six nights in Dec 2011”
Reviews.Author: Charles H
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in a room with a king size bed on the second floor. The room was clean and quiet. The free breakfast each morning was very good. There was a good selection of items to choose from and the eggs, bacon and sausage were better cooked than I have seen at some other hotels. The room was a little on the small size. However, the reasonable price that we paid for the room and the great location of the hotel more than made up for the small size. The hotel is located near Fisherman's Wharf, near various tour and boat rides, near many restaurants, and near two cable car routes to downtown. When we come back to San Francisco, we plan to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal base - but nothing more”
Reviews.Author: j3tsetter
Reviews.Content: - Carpark cost $45 per night... Plus tax/tip = $120 for our 2 night stay. The receptionist was unable to do us any deals on this and disputed the fact my friend had got a deal when she was there earlier in the year. - Breakfast's only healthy item was banana, the rest was pre-made junk food- burgers, omlete, cinnamon buns still in their boxes straight from the freezer. All the drinks were sugar based & syrupy. Never seen anything like it in my life. I'm a 42 year old qualified chef. - The view was the windows of an adjoining concrete block, we could see something of a view, but as we'd specifically requested a high level room with a view, this was a disappointment. - The room was clean and the hotel is in a good location for fishermans wharf, that's what you're paying for here and that's all you get.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Awesome place - very nice staff”
Reviews.Author: jaymedee0208
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice property to stay at! Very close to the wharf, and the front desk staff was very helpful. Everything in the rooms were nice and clean. Would definately stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Works just fine”
Reviews.Author: Nrhfamily
Reviews.Content: Nothing special, nothing fancy. However, this place was just what we needed. Affordable, comfortable and reasonable accommodations. Breakfast was lame but there is a wonderful little breakfast cafe next door. Hotel is close to everything (just about) too.

Reviews.Title: “Good basic hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: Courtcase
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay here, the last time being 7 years ago. Nothing has changed but I have no complaints at all. The staff are friendly and very helpful and efficient, the location is fantastic, two blocks from Pier 39' two blocks from Safeway and other shops and a block from the bus into town. Getting around SF is so easy. The rooms are averaged sized but very clean. We are early risers so found no problem with getting a table for brekky, although we did comment how busy it was after 8am. Breakfast is not the Ritz but it offers cereal, toast, bananas, yoghurt, pancakes, bacon or sausage and yes, powdered scrambled eggs. However, if you are staying for a week as we did, we appreciated the saving on having to buy brekky each day. Overall there's very little to find fault with. Beds are extremely comfortable...a pleasant change from our stay in Thailand last year! My only complaint is the lack of wireless Internet in the rooms. There is an Ethernet connection but this is no good for using an iPad which a lot of travelers do now. There is wireless connection in the lobby but after a long day sightseeing we didn't really want to sit down in the lobby to use the Internet. The room TVs haven't yet been updated to flat screens. Overall though, its a reasonably priced, friendly and good hotel for the price, considering the excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “We expected more”
Reviews.Author: BelgiumItalialover
Reviews.Content: Plus : (1) Location is perfect if you are in SF as a tourist, (2) Room was kept very clean Minus : (1) Public hotel space as well as room were very worn out and urgently in need of an update, (2) Breakfast was very poor quality in a chaotic environment, and tables where not cleaned due to lack of staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to worry about staying at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: holidaytimeusa
Reviews.Content: I had read mixed reviews before I stayed at HIE Fishermans Wharf, and was a little worried. The check in staff were all very helpful. The lobby was welcoming and you had free internet and printing access. The room was a little smaller than I had expected but was clean and in good condition. There was no view out of the window, but the hotel location was good close to the pier and the cable car turnaround. The free breakfast was a bonus, having read a few reviews I did not expect fine dining. We went early as our body clocks had not really adjusted from UK time +8hours and never had a problems finding a table. Overall the hotel was fine, it did everything we needed it too. I have not stayed in any other hotels in San Francisco so I can not compare it in terms of value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location... skip the breakfast”
Reviews.Author: bbcampbell
Reviews.Content: Really nice and clean. Good sized room. Missed having a fridge. A little bit out dated and needs modernizing but still very nice. Perfect location situated at the end of the tram line and walking distance to everything especially Pier 39 and Fisherman's wharf. Our booking included buffet breakfast. US buffet breakfast is very different to a breakfast buffet in Australia. Basically it was powdered scrambled eggs, sausage patty & scone/biscuit, yoghurt & banana's. Not what we expected. It was also really busy and so by the time you lined up and got some food it was being closed up. You had to fight to find a table and because of the mass amount of people there it wasn't the cleanest and obviously hard for the two staff we could see to maintain it. Again, fantastic location so perfect to stay at a very reasonable price for location and if you're not too interested in spending much time at your hotel. Make sure you go to the Holiday Inn Express not the holiday Inn.. They are two different hotels but for laundry we were sent to the other Holiday Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable hotel”
Reviews.Author: pazzags
Reviews.Content: Three nights in San Francisco at the Holiday Inn Exprees. Comfy beds, Freindly staff and an all you can eat breakfast from 6-30 till 9-30. Well located in the fishermans wharf region. Two minute walk to the world famous cable cars and a 15 min walk to Pier39 the happening place. Would be happy to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Crowded”
Reviews.Author: romagerry
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in October. Location is ok if you are ok at walking,if you struggle you will need a cab . The rooms are small and in need of updating. Breakfast times are very busy and you need to wait around for somewhere to sit before you get your food and that takes a lot of time as you will have to wait for each person in front of you to toast there bagals! . Overall its convenient but dont expect the usual standards of the' Holiday Inn' name.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in Good Location”
Reviews.Author: TinoCornwall
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn, Fisherman's Wharf in San Francisco in September 2011. The hotel is seperated into 2 seperate buildings, the main building and the other site across the street. The hotel is located about 2 minutes walk from Fisherman's Wharf and about a 10 minute walk to Pier 39. In the main building there was a Cafe/Coffee Shop which served breakfast although we never ate there and our building contained a Denny's Restaurant. The rooms were spacious and contained everythin we needed (nice bathroom, iron, ironing board, TV, kettle, tea & coffee). They were cleaned daily and were very nice. The hotel pool was located in the main building and although it is not very large (and the water was cold), it was nice to sit in the pool area and relax after a long day sight seeing. As I said, the hotel is centrally located in the tourist area and the cable cars and the sight seeing buses are only a couple of minutes walk away.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: prash123
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a standard HI Express but it has a lot of annoying things to put people off. The air conditioning is noisy - so is the bathroom exhaust. The TV looked old in the age of flat screen televisions. No wireless internet in the room - just a wired one. You are out of luck with an iPad. But there is wireless in the lobby and a couple of free computers in the lobby. There is a touchscreen information facility near the computers but the touchscreen is dodgy. The room safe is key operated which is weird. No room fridge or minibar. The room did not have a view - you get a window facing other rooms. Breakfast is loaded with sugar. No healthy choices like oatmeal - brown bread was good quality though. Most hotels in California had oatmeal but this one did not. It can get very busy at breakfast - go early for a seat. Hotel is very clean and they are keen on composting everything. I found it strange as the breakfast was served in paper plates and cutlery was plastic. We booked a taxi the night before only to be told that there is no record of this when we had to go to the airport. Luckily it was early morning and there were taxis lining up outside the hotel. The Amtrak bus drop off point is close by and you can walk to hotel - looked safe at night. Just don't disturb the homeless on the streets. It gets a bit quiet at night. Anyway the charm of San Francisco made up for the hotel shortcmings. It is a beautiful city. We only had two full days but we saw so much of the city on foot. Don't miss the following whilst you are there: 1. Come to San Francisco by Amtrak - Amtrak train comes to oakland and their thruway bus (must be booked with the ticket) goes on the Oakland Bay bridge into San Francisco. The views from the bay bridge cannot be matched esp. at night. They will drop you at Fisherman's wharf where you can walk to the hotel. 2. Ghirardelli Square: You get great views of Golden Gate and Alcatraz from here. Very charming and a must walk from the hotel. 3. Fisherman's wharf: Not much to do here unless you like seafood. Walgreens is very close by for grocery, souvenirs etc (come out of hotel, turn right and then a right again). There is a McDonalds, Burger king, Chipotle etc. I'm a vegetarian - so ate at Gino's pizza and Chipotle. Boudin bakery is a must see for their wonderfully shaped breads. 4. Walk along the piers all the way to Ferry Building: A great walk and lively in the evenings. You'll find many people jogging and the views are fantastic. The night time view of financial district and bay bridge from Pier 14 is superb. 1 hour walk from the hotel at a slow pace. 5. Muir Woods, Sausalito & Golden Gate: Get a tour company to take you there from the hotel. Wonderful redwood and a charming town in Sausalito. They normally give you an hour at each place. Muir woods is always damp - take an umbrella and warm clothes. If you get motion sickness, sit in the front seat. The road is windy. 6. Alcatraz : We did not get time to do this but it is worth visiting. 7. Walk on Lombard Street all the way to crookedest street: It is a hilly walk - so wear good shoes. You also get great views of the city from Coit tower and Telegraph hill. 8: Ferry building: very nice charming place with views of the bridge. The shops sell some really good gourmet stuff. Yerba Buena garden was also very nice. The hotel receptionist will give you a map and I would say - just walk. You'll love the city and the views. Tip: Stay away from Tenderloin i.e don't wander off Geary and Market street (esp. at night).

Reviews.Title: “Great location and price”
Reviews.Author: Michel1030
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights while visiting our daughter and were very happy. Great "walk to everything" location-- Fisherman's Wharf, Ghirardelli Sqaure. We asked for an inside room, which was very quiet. Expanded free breakfast buffet includes scrambled and hard boiled eggs, waffles, chipped beef, cold cereals, wide selection of breads and pastries, fresh orange juice, apples. Free computer use in lobby. Very small exercise room and no pool but guests may use the pool at the Holiday Inn next door. (But you will get plenty of exercise walking all over the city!) My husband thought the bed (we had a king) was more comfortable than the one we have at home.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingFool59
Reviews.Content: Beautifully appointed hotel, with upgraded rooms, furnishings, bathrooms. The hallways and port windows make you feel like you are on a cruise ship! Huge breakfast room for the complimentary buffet: well attended and restocked frequently, lots of seating. Close enough to the waterfront to walk to all attractions at Fisherman's Wharf: consider taking a taxi after dark. Free internet service with printers in the lobby. "Knuckles" Pub and restaurant across the street was good value and great service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sask79
Reviews.Content: We had a suite and it was very nice. The free breakfast was good except that the staff did not always refill the selections efficiently ie 2 trays of sausage then later on refill with just bacon instead of having one bacon and one sausage. The hotel across from us had very noisy people. It was fleet week so not much can do about that. That was the only noise that was irratating. Staff very helpful at front desk.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel close to the Wharf.”
Reviews.Author: bluebonzoid
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights. The hotel was very conveniently located within walking distance from the Wharf and any public transportation. The hotel itself was clean and comfortable. I wasn't a big fan of keeping the coffee maker in the bathroom, but that's where it was. I didn't use it, and it cramped the room a little. Breakfast downstairs was very complete and good.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Travels6
Reviews.Content: Locale, locale, locale - this hotel was in the perfect location. We stayed for seven days in October and had our little infant with us. The hotel staff was wonderful. They put us in a quiet location and promptly changed out our mini-fridge when it was not working in order for us to keep our baby food cool. The breakfast spread was great but there are so many wonderful restaurants near the hotel within walking distance as well as a Safeway and a Trader Joe's grocery store. You can get anything you need within just a couple of blocks out of your hotel. There were things that the hotel did not have such as a pool or laundry facilities. But, it's an Express hotel - you shouldn't expect too much from one. Those amenities are located at the Holiday Inn if one really needs them. The two issues that we had with the hotel was the wifi was only located in the lobby and the hotel room doors were quite heavy and loud when allowed to shut on their own. Other than that, it is definitely a place to consider when traveling to Fisherman's Wharf!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Ruth035
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights in San Francisco in October. Holiday Inn Express at Fisherman's Wharf is a good location. Easy walk to Cable Car Stop and all Restaurants on the Whart. Rooms were clean and tidy and also added bonus of Coffee Machine in Room. This hotel also provides Breakfast which like most these days is self service. I thought it was one of the better ones and it had a Pancake Making Machine too. Nothing nicer than fresh Pancakes in the morning. Lots of other choices too. Certainly worth trying this place out, not the most expensive but certainly if you are looking for a good location down at the Wharf I would give it a go.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: thomfre
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel mainly because of it's location; walking distance to Fishermans Wharf, Pier 30, Alcatraz Landing and both Powell-Mason and Powell-Hyde cable car turnarounds. We booked a room with mini-fridge and microwave and got a big, nice and clean room. The breakfast had a good selection, but keep in mind that the hotel is big and there are plenty of other hungry guests! The rooms did not have WiFi, but free cabled Internet, good for my computer, but not too good for my iPad! The staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: PattyBlank
Reviews.Content: My first impression of the hotel was that it was showing some wear in the rooms. The wallpaper was starting to peel off the walls and the glue was showing through. Our first room had a hole punched in the wall through the paper. Having said that, upon closer inspection, I saw that the room and bathroom were clean, as well as the rest of hotel. Upon entering our room, Joseph called from the front desk to see how we liked the room. When I mentioned the hole in the wall and the peeling wallpaper, he immediately offered another room. As I was leaving to go downstairs for the key to the other room, I was met by a pleasant woman with a clipboard who asked to see what the problem was with the room. We moved into the next room and enjoyed the comfortable beds, clean rooms and towels, and friendly staff. The only complaint I have is the $45.00 fee to park the car overnight. While the valets were friendly and always offered directional help, I feel the price was steep--especially when you add it on to the cost of the room. All in all, I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Simple and clean”
Reviews.Author: TheWinFin
Reviews.Content: Pros: Clean Quick and easy Great location Not too expensive Cons: Not luxury hotel isn't perfect and shows some age in hallways, etc... Bottom line: It's clean and simple. For the money you'll spend you'll get a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Cabman50
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a Great location from which to explore San Francisco. Â Close to the wharf and public transport.Â  The accommodation is modern, clean, and well kept with helpful and friendly staff. Our room was fairly basic but nice and had a large double bed. Free wi-fi was included for use in the lobby area.Â  The only real downside is the typical express breakfast, which at best is pretty poor. Finding a table to eat at can also be a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: godfather24601
Reviews.Content: Excellent location near all wharf activities. Breakfast buffet selection far better than most HIE. Only negative is the smaller room size.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Anconvet
Reviews.Content: Property was clean and conveniently located in Fisherman's Wharf. Employees were always friendly, courteous and helpful. Only negatives were that the Free Breakfast wasn's always good and the in-room internet requires a wired connection. The only WiFi available in the hotel is in the Lobby area

Reviews.Title: “Best bang for the buck”
Reviews.Author: Retired8110
Reviews.Content: This Holiday Inn Express was above and beyond what I expected. The location couldn't have been better. We were within walking distance of pier attractions, pubic transportation, shopping and best of all the wonderful wharf restaurants. Everyone was very friendly and helpful. Even the complimentary breakfast was far better than most.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Trojans9
Reviews.Content: We stayed from 10/19 -10/25. it was a very good place to lay our heads down. Freindly staff, great room. Always clean and neat when we returned. A bargain when you get complimentary breakfast. As breakfast is not cheap in this area. Just a few blocks from Fisherman's Wharf. They were great in setting up all our tours for us. Would be my first choice when returning to the Bay area

Reviews.Title: “Right Choice”
Reviews.Author: Wilburdogs
Reviews.Content: Had a lot of thought between staying at Fishermans's Wharf or Union Square but I think I made the right choice, Had a great stay at this Hotel with my family of four - We had a view of the bay from our room which was a nice bonus, Breakfast was good but you know what you are going to get at Holiday Inn - Reception staff were very helpfull. Enjoyed this area of course it is very touristy used the hop on hop off bus which was very good, easy walk to the wharf to visit Alcatraz.Found Fisherman's wharf and the Holiday inn a very good place to stay with the family felt safe all the time.

Reviews.Title: “good location & friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: aussiecocky
Reviews.Content: Great location, friendly and helpful staff. Room a good size, clean and comfortable but we had no view. Even provided tea bags, a rare sight in US hotels we stayed in during our stay. Appreciated the hand rail in the bath/shower. Breakfast was good - we were a bit concerned after reading some of the reviews. Bananas, and plenty of them - they are a luxury item in Australia for the past 6 months. As our flight left in the evening, we appreciated the late check out and then they stored our luggage until the shuttle bus came late afternoon. We had an excellent experience at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and customer service”
Reviews.Author: GeorgiaMcFly
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights and I highly recommend this hotel! I struggled with whether to give 5 stars or just 4 only because I feel the breakfast buffet could offer a more varied fresh fruit selection. Having said that, the hot food selection was very good for the number of people that I saw being fed each morning. We received a room upgrade that was totally unexpected. Our room had a good view and was large, clean and the beds and bathroom were comfy. But I really was impressed with the customer service - just outstanding! We had quite a few questions and requests for favors and they met them all. Oh and you can't beat the location. The hotel is close to Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39, cable car stops, etc. I've traveled to San Francisco many times and have stayed at different hotels. This is definitely one of the best that I've experienced.

Reviews.Title: “A nice stay in San Fran”
Reviews.Author: MAT1234
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights on our California honeymoon road trip. Check-in was quick and easy. Our room was small but clean and cozy. Lovely king bed was very comfortable. Overall hotel decor is modern and up to date. Location was fantastic, really close to the Wharf, Alcatraz, streetcar stops, Ghirardelli square, and lots of great restaurants at all price points. Hotel is attached to an amazing bike rental place where you can get an electric bike for less than $50 for the whole day. Completely worth it as these bikes let you traverse the hills of San Francisco with minimal effort. Definitely agree with reviews regarding breakfast - the food was absolutely abysmal and inedible. It was also insanely busy! Thought it would be a perk of staying here, but we should have believed the reviews. In terms of value, this hotel is pretty pricey for what you get, but that seems to be how all hotels are in San Francisco. Overall we'd stay here again or recommend it to a friend with the caveat to not expect much at breakfast time.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but expensive”
Reviews.Author: HereandthereBradford
Reviews.Content: You are right in the middle of everything here but you pay for it.Close to the piers and good location to walk to the shopping and GGB. Brilliant restaurants close by. Good sized rooms and clean but need a little TLC.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the action”
Reviews.Author: yupster
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 stayed for 4 nights in two rooms. Double beds only. Originally the kids were in a room at the other end of the floor to us. They moved them closer on the 2nd night by holding a room for us during the day. Good service. We thought breakfast was fine with good variety. Perhaps some fresh fruit beyond banana's would be good. Scambled eggs were always dried out. Everything else was good and even if it was crowded, we never had any problems getting a table. Not sure why they use disposable paper bowls/cups and plastic cutlery? Close to Fishermans wharf (but not too close), Alcatraz cruises, cable car, bike hire, Pier 39 etc... We went up the street to the other Holiday Inn so the kids could have a swim. My wife and I went down to the common area on the 1st floor a few nights to let the younger child go to sleep. Read and use the laptop, always nice and quite down there. Overall a good hotel with attentive, competent staff. Looks like it's been renovated recently. Would recommend. Other Holiday Inn might be better for children only because of the pool. Had a great meal at a restaurant called "Pier Market" on Pier 39. Food, service and view were very good. Make sure you ask for a window seat.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: SP1979
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed here for three nights in early October. Great location at Fisherman's Wharf. Room was clean, and we actually had a view of the Bay, including Alcatraz. Most rooms will not have a view, however, as many are interior rooms facing eachother. Free breakfast each morning was great, and only once was there a line (we were down there by 7am each day). Many choices for breakfast: eggs, pancakes, sausage, bagels, toast, english muffins, cereal, yogurt, and more. No restaurant on site, but the Hollywood Cafe next door offers take out for breakfast/lunch. This hotel is an excellent value and worked perfect for our family. Will definitely stay here on any return trips to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Room but not great services”
Reviews.Author: Zilzi
Reviews.Content: The location of the Holiday Inn Express, SFO was fantastic. Easy five minute walk to Fishermans Wharf, easy access to tours and to the cable car and public transport. The room was large and room and clean. There was a coffee maker (which was located in the bathroom next to the toilet - yuck!) Moved this to the main room away from bathroom, great to have but a shame there was no fridge for milk or other supplies. Breakfast compliementary - but very lacking. Scrambled eggs must have been powdered, as they were lumpy and tasteless, and the rest of the breakfast left a lot to be desired. No other meals or facilities for meals or snacks provided in the hotel. No laundry facilities available - unless you walked up the road to the Holiday Inn on the corner. They appeared to have much more in the way of facilities when I went there to do laundry. A pool, restuarant, small shop etc. That on hindsight would have been my preference.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel central location”
Reviews.Author: Chelmsfordtraveller
Reviews.Content: Hotel was smart and clean. We had booked a double room however the room we were first allocated had two very small double beds. As we were on our honeymoon we queried if it was a twin room which apparently it was not however they were very good and moved us to another room same size but with a king size bed. Daily room cleaning service. Hotel offers breakfast however this was not very good as it was a 'free for all' style setting with cardboard plates and bowls and plastic cutlery. We went to the little cafe next to the hotel which was affordable and had a good breakfast menu.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - but offers less than most holiday inn express'”
Reviews.Author: applestrudel
Reviews.Content: I have mixed feelings about this hotel. Great location, with easy access to the bay, fishermans whalf and all the aminities of the city. The negatives are it offered so much less than other holiday inn express hotels. There was no coffee available throughout the day, no onsite laundry and the rooms were just so tiny. Just big enough to hold the kingside bed and little else. The bed was so hard and could not manage to get a good night sleep at all. Breakfast was ok, but lines far to long no matter what time of the morning you arrive. I think it was down to poor placement of the pancake maker and toaster. It held everyone up, would be far better if these were placed in a different location. Expect to pay $45 Per day for parking, cheaper parking lots available near by. Overall good clean hotel, put lacking the little extras.

Reviews.Title: “Do not expect much”
Reviews.Author: gavandgracey
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights in this hotel for our honeymoon. I really wished we had not. It is definitly not a hotel I would recommend to honeymoon couples. We checked in and were told to leave the hotel walk around the corner and our room would be at the other part of the hotel. I was shocked, we were not offered help with luggage and the directions we were given were certainly not clear. I returned to the receptionist and explained I did not want to have to walk that far to get to the main desk and also we were on honeymoon. She did move our room. Rooms are fine, clean and comfortable. We ate breakfast one morning. It was far too expensive over $21 per person. Definitly not worth it and the desk staff at the restaurant are loud and not very pleasant. Location is fine, you are in walking distance of Fishermans Wharf, but I would rather stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location at Fishermans Wharf”
Reviews.Author: Christy31069
Reviews.Content: Very impressed with spacious rooms and had a great view of Alcatraz, when the fog cleared, from our window. Stayed for four nights from 21 September. Breakfast is free but poorly organised with crowds of people wandering aimlessly trying to get their breakfast and find a vacant seat. Pancake machine was great and enjoyed my pancake breakfast each morning. Fisherman's Wharf is the perfect place to be located and is close to the various tourist attractions. Only worry about Fisherman's Wharf is the amount of homeless people which was a bit distressing for me. Holiday Inn spoiled our stay at the end by charging us $800 for four nights parking instead of $200 (yes $50.00 a night for your car to sit in the car park is a bit steep). It took us hours to get a refund which delayed our drive to San Diego but a big thanks for the girls at the front desk who assisted us in fixing their manager's mistake.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff for the price”
Reviews.Author: caspervr
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here for a long weekend in September and we had a great time. We arrived 5 hours before check-in, and the front-desk employee happily stored our bags and gave us recommendations on things to do for the afternoon. Very friendly! Our room was on the 3rd floor, over ooking an alley, but it was very quiet. Our only complaint was that the bathroom could have been a bit cleaner, but otherwise the room was nice. The AC worked well. One tip would be to get to the breakfast room early, because if you wait until 8 or so, it is packed with people. There was plenty of food, but the line for the waffles/eggs/biscuits was over 15 minutes long if you wait too late. We found it to be a good value though. Overall, the staff was very friendly and the location was perfect. We would recommend this hotel to any family travelling to San Fran for fun/tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Mini Vacation”
Reviews.Author: cooperr61
Reviews.Content: We arrived around 1pm and had three days in the city. Check-in was a pleasure and I was in my room in 10 minutes. As itâ€™s an â€œExpressâ€� there is no room service or pool but there is a full service Holiday Inn next door. Fishermanâ€™s Wharf is down the street and most attractions are within walking distance. The hotel arranged a mini-fridge to keep the beers cold and thereâ€™s a Safeway supermarket just two blocks away. Itâ€™s a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: Lvisco
Reviews.Content: This hotel has one thing going for it -- the location, that is, if you want to be near the wharf. The staff were disinterested, the elevators were not in working order and the only way up and down was via steps -- that took you through the kitchen/prep area. No signs, no help from the staff. The breakfast area was messy and understaffed every morning. We've stayed at many of these express hotels and they are usually much better run than this one -- find another property to stay if your destination is the Fisherman's Wharf -- there are many, many to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: steve t
Reviews.Content: my wife and i stayed for 4 nights in sept, we were there the 1st - the 5th the hotel an staff were excellent the staff went out of their way to make your stay comfortable an enjoyable. the staff was very pleasant, always smiling and very helpful. they were able to tell us the easiest ways to get around the area. it just seemed like they took pride in helping us. the room was always spotless as was the rest of the hotel. the breakfast was way better than expected, lots of choices, all fresh foods, and plenty of food. it was a true breakfast buffet. they even had free internet access via PC's in the lobby i can not say enough about how professional, pleasant an helpful the staff was we will always stay here when we go to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a fisherman's walk”
Reviews.Author: uri_fi
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my mother in Dec. 2010. We booked quite early and got very good rates for the location. Regarding the location it is smack in the middle of everything. Close to walk to all attractions in and around Fisherman's wharf. A min walk from trolly F which takes you to the rest of the interesting places SF has to offer. A good location to go for a hike from asa well. The rooms are comfy and ready for a good night sleep. Clean and accomodating. The room has a safe which was also convenient. The hotel provided a light breakfast which was just what we needed. It was simple and identical to those of many other Holiday Inn hotels. If you wish to visit these areas of SF I would warmly suggest this area. If you wish to see the more lively, night life rich places check out accomodation closer to market street and the BART hub.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Roddlez
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn Express, not to be confused with the nearby Holiday Inn is a good, basic, clean hotel in a great location only about 4 minutes walk to Fisherman's Wharf and great places to eat, as well as the F MUNI line. In particular: 1. Friendly service at check-in. 2. Rooms are clean. 3. Bed is comfortable. I suffer from a sore back so I should know. 4. Breakfast is provided for free. It is basic, consisting of various cereals, fruit, coffee and tea, juices, pastries, eggs and bacon and other meats, bread, toast and spreads. Served between 6.30 and 8.30, get there early or you'll find it hard to get a table. 5. Free wifi is provided in the lobby. This had download and upload speeds of about 7mb/s. It dropped out sometimes on my iPad. Rooms also have cable Internet. 6. My room didn't have a fridge, but you are provided with an ice bucket and there is a free ice-vending machine. 7. Shower pressure is not high but it heats up quickly. All in all, a nice experience. I was there from 21-25 September, 2011.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel.”
Reviews.Author: KeithfromPattaya
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 15th to 22nd September. This is a very good 'hotel' which should be looked upon as more of a bed and breakfast establishment. There is no bar or evening entertainment. The location in right in the middle of everything you could want. There are lots of places within a five minute walk where you can eat or listen to music etc. I had a room on the 4th floor in the middle of the hotel which was spacious, clean and quiet. I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel if you want good value for money. Excellent staff. The plug sockets in the room are 2 flat and one round pin but two flat pins work OK

Reviews.Title: “Good location but ......”
Reviews.Author: Stephen B
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 6 nights in September. Good location alongside other major hotel chains; in close proximity to the Wharf and public transport. Reception staff were helpful and friendly. Breakfast is an issue: not the greatest of choices; no seating available if you arrive at a 'normal' hour; and they close the doors at 9.30 prompt! Lack a little personal touch too. Gave staff advance notice of this being our 30th wedding anniversary. Would have been nice to have received an acknowledgement, even if it was just on the tv screen.So maybe it isn't a hotel to choose for a special occasion?

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: mstravel2011
Reviews.Content: Couldn't be a better location from which to explore the city! Plus, a fabulous room and a yummy breakfast. Hope to come back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property with great location”
Reviews.Author: Anthony G
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at this hotel when going to Giants games. It's just a block from the 30 Stockton bus which takes you to AT&T Park. There's a Safeway, Walgreens, Trader Joe's nearby as well as many places to eat. The rooms are clean and the staff is very friendly. Have never had their breakfast buffet as i prefer to go out for breakfast. I'll continue to stay there as i know the service will always be outstanding!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good value choice”
Reviews.Author: Tigger103
