Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights - our first stop of a 18 day fly drive holiday. We were very pleased with this hotel which is perfectly situated at Fishermans Wharf. As other reviewers have said breakfast can get quite hectic - but we found going early helped miss the crowds - no problem for a newly arrived tourist from the UK adjusting to the time difference! Don't expect china crockery or metal cutlery though, its paper and plastic instead. Our room was probably one of the smallest we had throughout the holiday and the view was pretty poor but that didn't concern us as we wanted to make the most of seeing San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast buffet in need of some decent management”
Reviews.Author: Ally CB
Reviews.Content: The location is great - within a short walking distance to the main attractions of Fisherman's Wharf. The hotel itself is modern, clean and comfortable. My main gripe is with the breakfast: it was absolute chaos. All the food, both hot and cold, is together and entails a long queue to get to it. This is ridiculous! Cold food should be on one side and the queue just for the hot food. The fact that everyone needs to queue for the toaster, also points to the fact that other sorts of bread should be available such as rolls. The whole breakfast needs putting into shape. It really isn't that hard to provide a decent one, even if it is "free".

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Sarita00
Reviews.Content: I was really surprised with the value for money in this hotel, we stayed 2 nights across the street and the Hyatt and this hotel was so much better!!. Very nice rooms, free internet, breakfast inlcuded, although breakfast room a bit too noisy and crowded. Friendly and efficient staff. Pinters available to print boarding passes. I recommended it to some friends who stayed there in August and had same opinion as me. Great Location too!

Reviews.Title: “clean room but NO internet in room”
Reviews.Author: DeborahCambridge
Reviews.Content: Room was clean and spacious but the lack of internet in the room I think in this day and age is appalling. Having just stayed in other Holiday Inn Express in Boston and NY where there was internet it came as more of a shock. Speed of internet even in foyer was poor. Breakfast was included in price but was quantity over quality. I will not stay here again as it is impossible to function on business trip if you have to dress to go downstairs to send an email!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable beds, good location”
Reviews.Author: AW54AbuDhabi
Reviews.Content: The hotel rooms are excellent, very comfortable beds, quiet and spotlessly clean. Lack of Wifi in the rooms was annoying The breakfast buffet was hit and miss, badly laid out so a long wait to get food. The bacon and sausage were awful. Only other complaint was the lifts which took forever, couldn't find the stairs!!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special, no wireless in the rooms, decent breakfast”
Reviews.Author: mccafjohn
Reviews.Content: Decent hotel, remodeled, small rooms and no wirless connection on the room. We use iPads, therefore we had to go to the loby for the wireless signal or tether the 3g from our phones. The 3g Verizon signal was also slow. Good decent breakfast with lots of choices to get you started. Eggs like mentioned but very edible. Centrally located, get a transit pass. Close to cable cars, street cars, ferrys, buses, Ghiradelli's and can walk to pier 33 ferry landig for Alcatraz. Only 3 stars due to no wireless in rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and location”
Reviews.Author: pgranados
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well priced and is in an excellent location, just walking distance from some of the best places to visit in San Francisco bay area. Excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Location great, a few minor complaints”
Reviews.Author: pigsmilk
Reviews.Content: Just finishing our stay here (with 3 yr old). Booked based on location and reviews. Overall, it was a good stay. The location is great and the staff were very friendly and helpful. We were pretty much able to walk to all the places we wanted to go, but it was far enough off the main area of Fisherman's Wharf to keep us clear of constant noise and foot traffic. My two complaints:that the walls allowed noise to come through that I felt should have been prevented..number two was breakfast..the free hot breakfast was one of the selling points for me due to traveling with a small child, and it was definitely sub-par. I fully understand that it is a mass produced buffet, so I was not expecting the Ritz. However, it seemed like most of the items were lacking of flavor and rather bland. I also thought the choice of dishes were lacking. It really wasn't very good. I would stay here again based on my overall experience, but I would first look at other places in the area that include breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: NancyMinooka_IL
Reviews.Content: Great location within walking distance of many attractions including the cable cars. Clean and comfortable with friendly, helpful staff. Complimentary breakfast is better than average and helps reduce cost of daily meals.

Reviews.Title: “cancellation and extra charges”
Reviews.Author: rich396
Reviews.Content: When we made our reservations in June of this year we had no reason to think we would not be able to keep our vacation plans for San Fransisco and northern California. I had a medical problem that would keep us from our reservations so I phoned in July to cancel our reservation and was informed that the cancellation policy is the full price of the room for both nights, over $500! Horrible cancellation policy! Then there is the extra charge for a small refrigerator that might hold a bottle of wine and a couple of bottled waters that costs $5 a day and the maintenance man brings the fridge to your room. Lastly, it took 10 minutes to check in and we were first in line behind two other couples checking in, I would not recommend this hotel and we will not be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but noisy”
Reviews.Author: cadsden
Reviews.Content: Very good location for Fisherman's Wharf and Pier 39. Pretty much what you'd expect for a Holiday Inn Express. Our room was on the ground floor and it was noisy from traffic late into the evening / early morning so try and get a room on a higher floor. One of the 'selling points' was that breakfast was incuded but it really wasn't that great. The Holiday Inn next door looked a lot smarter and was the same price at the time but didn't include breakfast. On balance I'd go for that one as there are loads of places to eat nearby. One other thing...the towels! There were 4 of us but we were only ever given 3 towels and had to ask for a 4th towel every day.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: HoagyCo
Reviews.Content: This was our first time to San Francisco and were glad we stayed at this place. It is conveniently located a 5 minute walk to Fisherman's Wharf and the F-line light rail to the city. The room was clean, spacious and well appointed. The free wi-fi throughout the hotel was appreciated. The staff were extremely courteous and helpful. Complimentary breakfast in the lobby area is provided but it pays to get there early as there are limited tables. Try Knuckles across the street for a reasonably priced meal, and Boudin's Bakery on the wharf (especially upstairs for happy hour). Would definitely return here next time we're in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but nothing more”
Reviews.Author: Suzy044
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Express hotel. It's fine, but nothing more. There are no facilities within the hotel itself - an outdoor pool is at the Suites part and maybe other things but we didn't bother. And to be fair, in a town like San Francisco, you're not there to spend time in the hotel so it doesn't really matter. But, the hotel is a bit soulless and I guess that's what you get from something like a Holiday Inn Express. We chose it because it had ok reviews and offered breakfast and as we are a family of five thought it a good option - but - the breakfast is awful. It's a mad scrum for the dreadful food (rubbery eggs regardless of whether they were scrambled or as an omelette), and hordes of people shoving to pile it all up (and quite a few seemed to be packing it into their bags too) and not enough tables. It was so bad in fact that we ate at the Hollywood cafe next door on our last day. On a good point, the rooms are kept clean and the reception staff are friendly and helpful (especially Brandy/Randy - sorry, can't remember your name as suffering from jet lag but she was just superb from helping us storing our cases during the day as we had a night flight to offering advice on buses!). So to summarise, it's fine as a base and the location is great, but if you think you're going to spend some time in the hotel choose somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was close to Fisherman's Wharf and very clean.”
Reviews.Author: 11brenda
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Holiday Inn Express in Fisherman's Wharf for 3 days. The hotel was very clean, the staff was always willing the help with any questions we had. The continental breakfast was very good.

Reviews.Title: “We would stay again.....”
Reviews.Author: Cyndy K
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights here and it was perfectly located for us to be able to walk to the wharf and restaurants. Nothing fancy but very clean, had a parking garage and we didn't need the car for anything anyway. Small fee for parking but is worth it. Checking in and out was very easy and the staff was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: JAM1London
Reviews.Content: We were alocated a room above the reception area and I thought that noise would be an issue. Although we heard the engines of the coache's parked outside it really wasn't too bad - I've experienced worse in other hotels! Our mini suite was spotless and comfortable enough for 2 nights. The location was fabulous. We could walk within 5 minutes to Fisherman's Wharf. We were also about a 5 minute walk to the cable car. We arrived there about 9am, and there was no queue. However, when we walked by later on in the day the queue was really long. We caught the cable car to Union Square, which is great for shopping. However most of the large shops do not open until 10am. Breakfast at the hotel was good considering it was included in the price. We always managed to get a table. The receptionists were very friendly and helpful - thank you.

Reviews.Title: “It was just ok.”
Reviews.Author: cdcmgc
Reviews.Content: The hotel had a comfortable room. The breakfast was fine. However, in spite of the fact that we required a handicapped room as my husband is ill with cancer, there was NO One to help with the luggage. When we asked they said, "This is a limited service hotel." We have stayed at multiple Holiday Inn Express hotels all over the country. We have never had this happen before. In addition, the icemaker did not work and no one could help us with that.

Reviews.Title: “Won't be back”
Reviews.Author: ststephens97
Reviews.Content: Experience tainted by poor breakfast arrangements and poor attitude of staff, paying $400, yes $400 for a nights' stay one would expect a decent breakfast at least- not at all, i was yelled at by an angry mexican looking man when i tried to prop open the main door into the breakfast area- he yelled, "Mister close that door!!! was shocked at being spoken to like this from someone representing a major chain like Holiday Inn, this man then began hurriedly removing breakfast items when i was already in line. i was one of several people at the reception desk complaining about breakfast-at least I got the $50 parking fee waived. DONT STAY HERE, THEY DO NOT VALUE YOUR CUSTOM, BREAKFAST IS RUBBISH AND YOU PAY THROUGH THE NOSE TO PARK!! STAY SOMEWHERE ELSE!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay !!”
Reviews.Author: Nemercio
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed there for 5 nights in our vacations and we had a great time! Clean apartment and good breakfast (included) were the highest points together with the fastcheck in/out. Staff was great!! I'd only make a remark about parking prices that I think are WAY too expensive, but I guess this is kind of a normal behavior in SF...

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Kay S
Reviews.Content: Good hotel for the money. The location was an ideal central location and very easy access to the trolley, muni and city buses. The hotel was clean and the breakfast was good but sometimes a little crowed during peak hours of the morning. The front desk staff could be a little more knowledgable on the restaurants and on general questions about the area. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice pick”
Reviews.Author: Koko99
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 night in the start of our 2 weeks california road trip. I booked it through hotwire for a really good price and it was one of the best hotels of the trip. Location is central, we did almost everything by foot, if not we rented bikes. Tip : just don't go to fisherman's warf, it is way too crowded and there is not that much to see. Do: hike up Russian hill, see lumbar street while you're there and grab a bite at Za pizza, it was a magnificent way to finish the day. We also rented bikes for one day, went to tour the city, passing in the golden gate park, coming back by the shore and crossing the golden gate bridge to finish with ice cream in sausalito before taking back the ferry to fisherman's wharf. Perfect day for people who are already in shape because you do have a lot of hills to go. Back to the hotel, the room was clean and modern, it was perfect for us. As for the breakfast, i read other reviews complaining about that and don't understand. It is a free breakfast, so don't expect caviar on your toast. For our part we found it really good, with everything you need to start your day : coffee, toast, cereals, eggs, yogurt, etc.. And if you want a quiet breakfast, go early. We ate there 3 days and never had to wait for anything. Tip: go early! You are in San Francisco by the way, there is no time to sleep in, so much to see :) Would definitely come back or recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: texas100
Reviews.Content: Close to the Wharf. Good location. Staff friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Don't get excited about the 'full American breakfast'”
Reviews.Author: bhmathome
Reviews.Content: Hotel is ok and fair value. Close to Fisherman's Wharf, full of tourists. Very, very full, to the extent that you can't move. Top tip - you may wish to skip breakfast and pay elsewhere. The queue is very long and when you get to the front ... well ... the egg must be made from recycled tyres. It can't be egg. And by the time you've found a table anything that was warm will be cold. It just doesn't work. That said, the rest of the hotel is fine. Odd thing in our room was the coffee maker in the bathroom - ugh. DO - go to Alcatraz (just brilliant, made by the audio tour; book ahead); buy a transit ticket ($27 for 7 days' use of buses, cable cars, metro, street cars); go up Coit tower for great views; take some warm clothes (pretty chilly in the fog, even in August) DON'T - eat at Fisherman's Wharf (in our experience it's poor value for money - walk a few blocks to get much better food for less - try cafe Maria which is great); spend much time in Fisherman's Wharf (unless you just love full-on tourism); bother with a car - use public transport (see above) - good vfm from buses etc (and the hills are SO scary to drive); expect to see Monk (invisible in our stay)

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, poor breakfast facility”
Reviews.Author: tony7
Reviews.Content: stayed here on monday for 2 nights right on the wharf, really nice clean, efficient, only downfall was the breakfast, standing in line for 20 mins is not my idea of customer service, we stood for 35 mins on the day off our departure, as the was a convention in and the just brushed passed everyone as if invisible!! my first reaction was of disbelief, then anger, i paid good money to stay here and these people come in and walk past as if were nothing!!!i shouted that there was a line here, and was ignored, at checkout, i was asked if i enjoyed my stay, i replied yes, apart from the breakfast line to which the reply was yeah i know, its bad... incredible!!! knowing its bad and doing nothing is lacklustre service to me, so will stay somewhere else next time.....

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice room, breakfast line incredibly long!”
Reviews.Author: nancyk4
Reviews.Content: Stayed right in the heart of tourist area, blocks from Fisherman's Wharf, the waterfront area. Room was very nice, hotel staff very friendly. My only complaint was waiting in line for 30 minutes for breakfast. With the number of people in this hotel there was only one line for breakfast. I can't believe that someone hasn't looked at this problem and addressed it with multiple lines/stations for breakfast. This is why I wouldn't come back here. What a waste of a morning waiting for food. My husband and I thought the beds were also very hard.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Whitzs
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location and is a great value. I took my parents to San Francisco as their Christmas present and this was a great place to stay. It is steps from fishermanâ€™s wharf, Ghirardelli square and easy access to the cable cars. This hotel is very well maintained, clean and the staff was very easy to work with. A great advantage to booking this hotel is the ease and convenience of the continental breakfast, which could be especially valuable for a family. The only downside was parking at the hotel was $45 per night, however, all parking at the hotels in the area was comparable. We would defiantly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great deal”
Reviews.Author: Smbelle
Reviews.Content: Staying in San Fran is pricy but this hotel is the best deal in town. Newly remodeled rooms, beautiful lobby, friendly staff, full hot breakfast included, walking distance to mnay attractions including the peir. highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for San Fran stay”
Reviews.Author: TheGirls17
Reviews.Content: My partner and i stayed here while on our wedding/honey moon from Australia. We had a really good look at all areas in san fran of where to stay and thought union square of fishermans wharf. After reading other reviews we went with fisherman's wharf and i was glad we did . Union square is great and there is lots of shopping and if thats what your holidays is about then def stay there . But we wanted to experience San Fran and take it all in. We visited Union square and the shopping of course, but fishermans wharf was great lots of funky little places to look and eat at .. We had been upgrading our rooms when we arrived at all of our hotels but found there was little to upgrade to with the holiday inn hotels , except to a family room , which unfortunately wasnt available. We were on a 7 week trip and i think this was prob our least lavish and least expensive hotel so didnt expect much but it was pretty good. We did ask for a non smoking room , went up to the room to find out it had been smoked in and smelt heavily , we went down to reception and they organised a non smoking room 2nd time round was all good . Ok room was small , and no view at all except... for other hotel rooms , but wasnt a big deal. There is no wireless in the bedrooms but the pay of is its free in the foyer... Breakfast was included in the room rate , and was yummy lots to choose from and a great place to fill up before a day of tourist attractions. We ended up hiring a car for a day just so we could drive around a little and we had tickets to go to a football game and didnt want to get public transport out there , it was cheap and would highley recommend it , although driving up those hills where kinda scary lol The holiday inn hotels dont pretend to be anything there not , its a basic hotel with basic rates and facilities. I always think when i write these reviews , would i stay here again. Yes i def would , loved the location , was clean and nice and didnt cost the earth ! Thumbs up ! Just wish they had wirless internet in the rooms !! its a must these days ...

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: StephWolf
Reviews.Content: Overall my family and I had a wonderful stay at the Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites San Francisco at Fisherman's Wharf. The hotel rooms were neat and clean. The free breakfast in the morning was decent, enough to get us started in the morning. The front desk was also very accomodating to us when we found out that our travel agent had accidentally booked one of the guests in our party at the Holiday Inn next door! They immediately resolved the situation and had the reservation transferred. The location was also within walking distance of Fisherman's Wharf which was nice. My only complaint would be the outrageous parking fees which with taxes came to around $50 a day!

Reviews.Title: “We loved the city, one of the best in the world.”
Reviews.Author: RitaGurgaon
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a convenient walk from the fisherman's wharf, one of the happening places in the city. You can stroll down to Pier 39 or 41 and take your city sight seeing tours and the cruise. It is also very close to the tram station. The break fast is sumptous but the hotel could do with some variety rather than serving the same stuff daily. There is an Indian restaurant close by.

Reviews.Title: “Good value & location”
Reviews.Author: garyyeoman
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location. We had a 3rd floor room overlooking North Point ..... no traffic noise. The family room was large enough for 2a & 2c and very clean. Although the breakfast was included the quality was poor. The coffee was great but the use of plastic cutlery & paper plates was not the best. Often large lines between 7.30 & 8.30.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: juliemj
Reviews.Content: Perfect home base for our vacation in San Francisco. We walked to Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39, the Ferry Building down the Embarcadaro, Chinatown, Little Italy and Coit Tower. please note: we love to walk and are in pretty good shape. Others might find public transportaion easier on the feet. The hotel was great and staff very well informed. Wasn't crazy about the breakfast, though. If you didn't get there early there were long lines and all the hot food was stone cold. Stayed for four nights, would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for Fisherman's Wharf”
Reviews.Author: PerthFrequent_Flyer
Reviews.Content: I think that the hotel was very pricey for what was offered but it is very convenient for Fisherman's Wharf and the cable car turn-around. The hotel was average and the rooms were OK.

Reviews.Title: “small room, wonderful staff excellent location”
Reviews.Author: PNK123
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed for 3 days. The room was small with no space for clothes. However, the location is perfect. The staff is lovely. There is a complimentary breakfast each morning. Eggs, pancakes, sausage, fresh fruit, yogurt, muffins and bagels.. juice, coffee. Our son was not feeling well one night and the hotel went out of there way to help us get him to a doctor. We would return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in a well situated, if slightly tacky location”
Reviews.Author: Finch23
Reviews.Content: Our hotel room was spacious, comfy and clean. Fisherman's Wharf is a good location for exploring San Fran, but the neighborhood itself lacks charm and good eating/drinking options. Still, you're not far from other neighborhoods that do have these things.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints”
Reviews.Author: pkbspencer
Reviews.Content: Great location - 2 minute walk to Fishermans Wharf. Good value breakfast and foc internet. Large rooms...no complaints

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT STAFF, EXCELLENT LOCATION, EXCELLENT HOTEL.”
Reviews.Author: Jarne
Reviews.Content: When I usually book a hotel, I do one of those online bids and keep my fingers crossed that the hotel given is halfway decent. I didn't bid this time, instead selecting the Holiday Inn Express Fisherman'sWharf and I am glad I did. Even though the place was packed, our room was very quiet and our bed very comfortable. The breakfast was great and the free internet was a plus. We were so close to everything yet far enough to avoid hearing all the outdoor noises. The staff at the front desk and phone staff were very respectful. My advice to prospective tourists and on line bidders is to refrain from the bargain bidding web sites and choose this hotel outright. The comfortable setting, free breakfast, internet and fine staff makes the Holiday Inn Express Fisherman's Wharf a wise and cost efficient selection.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: mustangguy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the perfect location for Fishermans wharf, the cable cars, among other things. It is about a 15 minute walk to the Alcatraz tour boats but that is nothing. Pier 29 is about 8-10 minutes away. The front desk staff is amazing and the breakfast is pretty good considering it is includes. A few negatives at this hotel are that the regular rooms have no microwave or fridge which we found out after we booked and the hotel was full. So a styrofoam cooler and the ice machine became our friend. There is no wireless in the rooms just the lobby area. The positives: The bed was comfortable and the room very quiet. There is a Safeway 5 minutes away to buy snacks and deli food if you want a change from restaurant meals. We had no car and took the pay shuttle from the airport and back. Parking is $45 per night so that could add up quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: LovesAWine
Reviews.Content: We cto pay for 5 breakfasts down the road would be at least another %40hose the HI Express partially on the basis of location, and the fact you know what you are getting - and we were not dissappointed. The family room we booked was terrific - spacious and had plenty of room for 2 adults and 3 kids - including a little kitchenette room with sink microwave and fridge. Brekafast is included but is a bit of feeding frenzzy with a limited range - however- we ate there every morning as to pay for another 5 breakfasts down the road would be another $50. Overall staff were very helpfull and cheery - the WiFi was a little slow and often only worked in the lobby. Overall a very comfortable stay and would recommend - you know wheat you will get and they deliver well.

Reviews.Title: “Super Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: islandjule
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at the HIE Fisherman's Wharf. When I made the reservation, I had one reward (free) night, and had to pay for the 2nd night ($259). Upon arrival, I looked at my confirmation from HI and discovered that the second night was actually booked at the HI property a couple of blocks away. Since this was 4th July week-end and the reception lines were long, I was worried about getting this sorted out (I did not want to have to move our fam of 5 to another hotel the next day). Although the staff was busy, they were all very pleasant and told us not to worry that the general manager would figure out something for us. We went up to our room, and finding that it did not meet our specifications (we needed sofa bed or roll-away), we called down to reception - again, worried about the response. Again, the staff was so pleasant - told us to come down and get a new key. All our interactions with the staff (whether reception or housekeeping) - everyone had a smile and "can do" attitude. Made for a very pleasant stay. The new room fit our needs perfectly. Basic amenities. Clean. Great location for exploring the city. Basic (free) breakfast had something for everyone in my family (fruit, yogurt, cereal, sausage or bacon, toast, cereal, eggs, cinnamon buns). My only grip is that this is obviously a high-traffic area and although newer hotel, the carpet should be replaced soon, as it is showing wear. However, all things considered, I would recommend to travelers looking for hotel to easily explore SF.

Reviews.Title: “Another winner selected from Tripadvisor reviews”
Reviews.Author: mattin54
Reviews.Content: I booked this room in March and got a good deal. We stayed the week of June 19th for 6 nights. It was a good choice. It is relatively new with very nice furnishings, etc. The beds were comfortable and the room was always nicely cleaned. The room is not huge but it is comfortable and we never felt cramped. It is an easy walk to The Wharf, public transportation, and many places to eat. My daughter and I rented a car for the week and if you park at the hotel it currently is $45 per day. I went online and found parking around the corner at The Anchorage Garage for $25 per day. There is more than enough room for the breakfast crowd and the food selection was good. Have a great trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for a San Francisco hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: PK_Maryland
Reviews.Content: First just to be clear, because it can be a bit confusing, we are reviewing the Holiday Inn Express at 550 North Point. There is a Holiday Inn right next door (with the same address) which does not offer the same amenities. The HI Express delivered as advertised (free breakfast, free internet in the room) and we had a junior suite which includes a microwave and mini-frig (a must have for us), The hotel seems relatively new; the rooms are very clean and comfortable. The location is about a 2 block walk to the Wharf, close enough to be convenient but far enough that it's quiet here. The hotel breakfast was OK but it's free so you can't complain. It's crowded at breakfast but they have plenty of tables and we were always able to get a table with no problem. There are two very close restaurants right near the hotel we'd recommend (Hollywood Cafe for lunch and Cafe Pescatore for lunch or dinner). Compared to the cost of other SF hotels and what you get at the HIE, we'd recommend this hotel for your stay in SF.

Reviews.Title: “Front Desk and housekeeping are the best!”
Reviews.Author: localvegan
Reviews.Content: I will definitely want to stay here again. Front desk staff are very helpful day and night and the housekeeping did a great job. Not only that, the hotel is also on great location, close from everything. I didn't rent a car but it was a great decision because I never had problem on going places, everything is close by. My only concern is the internet. It was very slow but it's no big deal because it's free anyway. Overall, this hotel is the best place to stay. I promise you wont regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: FussyTraveler67
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very clean and nice. We had a regular room, not a suite, and it did not have a microwave or refrigerator. They had a very good breakfast with both hot and cold food until 9:30 a.m. The internet was hooked into with a cable and it worked very efficiently. They also had free computers and printers in the lobby. The staff was friendly and helpful. The location was perfect. I don't like to walk really far but it was a lovely, short walk to Pier 39. The office where we caught out tour to Muir Woods, Sausalito and Alcatraz was on the same block. There were tons of eating choices within walking distance and the cable cars and bus stops were nearby. We stayed here one night before our cruise and 4 nights after and we could walk to the pier where our cruise embarked and disembarked from. We didn't have a car so we really appreicated the location. It isn't cheap but is a good deal for San Francisco since it is a very expensive city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: BryRee
Reviews.Content: I am a single mom and took my two teenagers here for Spring Break. It was in a great location, just a few blocks from Fisherman's Wharf and even bike rental places nearby. There was also a tour excursion company on the corner which was very convenient. The room was nice and the breakfast was good. I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, a bit expensive for a holiday inn express”
Reviews.Author: illini_knight
Reviews.Content: For a hotel in the heart of fisherman's wharf, you cannot really beat the value and the short walking distance to the big sites. I found it to be a bit expensive (compared to other big cities), but I guess that is normal for san fran. Service was fine, breakfast was normal holiday inn express breakfast (who doesn't like the cinnamon buns?), and the room was normal holiday clean.

Reviews.Title: “This Place has Problems”
Reviews.Author: traveler3007
Reviews.Content: Reading other's good reviews in here we decided to take a chance at this "tourist cattle-call" type hotel. The prices were HIGH - two rooms, two nights for almost $1,000.00! As our trip unfolded we encountered the following: 1) Their "gym" was no gym, only a room with three treadmills! 2) Taking showers, our feet would be in 2 inches of water - it had a drainage problem 3) Bathroom wallpaper in our room was peeling near the shower 4) We needed a bathroom light to stay on at night but the fan was always on with it, no way to turn the noisy thing off. 5) Breakfast - egg-type omelettes were rubbery and tasteless, blueberry muffins were cheap Hostess-like air and high sugar, bacon tasted horrible like the microwave bacon one finds at a fast-food place. Fruit was good. 6) Hotel parking is valet and $45/day! 7) Wall-paper thin. A door closing normally down the hall would shake our room too. We will never stay there again. Our next trip in July we will find a nice boutique hotel that doesn't have these problems.

Reviews.Title: “City life $$$”
Reviews.Author: tmrad70
Reviews.Content: Positives : great location to all the sites in the city. Excellent lobby and breakfast area. Negatives : being in the city means crazy prices, nothing is cheap or even reasonably priced including here. Very small rooms, but clean. Old tube TVs with only fair reception. Expect more for the $. Also $44 just for 1 nights parking, alternative is to park 3 blocks away and pay $20. I went with the $44 for the convienence. I guess that's just the way everything is in the big city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ThreeLegsIsleofMan
Reviews.Content: Clean and comfortable hotel - staff very helpful. Breakfast rather basic with plastic everything!

Reviews.Title: “This was the worst hotel experience of my life, and as a former SF resident, I can honestly say, any other hotel is better.”
Reviews.Author: Birdietravels
Reviews.Content: 1) arrived and the room we reserved was "dirty" so were downgraded for the night to a FILTHY room in the older building. 2) we booked this location, though more expensive then the Hilton across the street, for the refrigerator (needed for medication), which wasnt in the room. A very rude gentleman reluctantly brought one to our room after a lengthy phone conversation. 3) D "just the initial" refused to call a cab for us, was very rude, and told us to go "find the bellman," who was no where to be found. 4) When we complained to the manager, Robert, about how unimpressed we were with our experience, he stated, "well, I'm not impressed either," gesturing to my sister. In short, rude staff, FILTHY accomidations, no customer service standards, and false advertising on amenities. Hundreds of hotels in the city, pick any other.

Reviews.Title: “This is an Excellent Hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: johnbarr_11
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in this Hotel for 4 nights whilst on holiday from N.Ireland. The Hotel is a perfect location for the tour buses, cable car and trolleys. It is convenient to all the main attractions in San Francisco such as Pier 39, wonderful restaurants, and Union Square. The hotel itself is very clean and bedrooms spacious, staff were very helpful and courteous, The breakfast was of an excellent standard with plenty of choice and good seating area. Highly recommended, we would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place...Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: RitzMary
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the perfect place to stay while visiting the Fisherman's Wharf area. It's quiet, clean, the staff is friendly and there's a free breakfast in the morning. It's only a few blocks from the cable cars and Pier 39. There's also a Safeway Market and Trader Joes within walking distance. We loved the location!!!! The only negative comment I can make is that the room was on the smaller side. I would stay here again without hesitation!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Very Nice for the Price”
Reviews.Author: KTO_Wisconsin
Reviews.Content: You couldn't ask for a better location. We could walk to anything we wanted or needed to. Rooms were equivalent to most higher-priced hotels I've stayed at recently--don't waste your money on a more expensive hotel. Breakfast buffet in the mornings perfect. Would definitely stay here again and recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Tones11
Reviews.Content: Great location, clean rooms, good buffet breakfast, can't go wrong staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: cjwhols
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights here and it was a perfect base for exploring San Francisco. The cable car to downtown goes from the next block, it's $5 for the trip. We also walked to downtown along Columbus and it didn't take too long. It's a good idea to take the open top bus tour at the start of your vacation so that you can get your bearings. Westfield Mall is good for shopping and the variety of food in the food court is amazing! We ate at a Japanese place and it was full of locals...always a good sign. Our room at the hotel was a very good size and we had a king size bed. The complimentary breakfast was very popular. It may be fairly basic but it will keep you going until lunchtime. You can always go to I-hop which is a couple of blocks away. We'd be happy to recommend this hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Bellas_adventures
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights and just needed a base to explore the city. The hotel location could not be better if you are a tourist as it is close to everything you need. Another plus is the free internet in the lobby. Are small but clean and have everything you need. The only downsides with this hotel was the breakfast and the noise levels. Breakfast was included, which was great, but you had to be there really early otherwise everything ran out and they had some kind of strange fake microwave omelette which tasted very bad. I can recommend the sticky buns and the coffee though. This hotel was also always very noisy very early in the morning. People going past in the corridor sreaming at six or seven in the morning every morning is not a good thing. It seems as though this was mainly due to the several school kids staying there at the same time and the teachers would shout at them in the corridors. All in all though I would still recommend this hotel as it has that good location and staff are polite and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “There is cheaper parking nearby”
Reviews.Author: rod002
Reviews.Content: The hotel was fine - excellent location - clean and tidy with helpful and pleasant staff. The hotel parking was $44 a day which we thought was expensive and we did want to keep our hire car. Next to Walgreens store only a minute or twos walk from the hotel is a secure multistorey for $20 - $25 a day no trestrictions - speak to the gate man or security guy.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice en friendly employees”
Reviews.Author: Philippemouse
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay and the people working in the hotel are very friendly Situation is perfect to discover the wharf and Frisco We come surely back Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice rooms, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: honeybee313
Reviews.Content: This hotel has an excellent location on the Wharf. The room was very comfortable and a decent size. We had a room on the first floor that was probably the closest one to the breakfast area, and even then it was not loud at all. Breakfast was outstanding with a great selection of hot food, pastries, cereals, yogurt, juices. Overall great location and value, especially considering that breakfast is provided.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for families.”
Reviews.Author: MrStrange
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 10 nights arriving on a Saturday evening. Check in was easy & pleasant and because we were staying 10 nights we got a free upgrade to a mini suite with fridge and microwave on the 4th floor. Room was pleasant, 2 double beds( not the expected kingsize), possibly a little dated, clean and fairly quiet with very little traffic noise and only one Saturday night did we hear any noise near midnight from outside or inside. Room had wired internet access and heating/ A/C, and free breakfast although it was really busy so after using it once we opted for a long lie most mornings. Exiting SFO we easily were directed to the taxi rank and got a cab straight to the hotel for about $45 plus tip. Taxi's are available outside the hotel across the road at the Hyatt, and we also used 'knuckles' at the Hyatt for meals when we had a long day sight seeing. A few points are to pre book your Alcatraz trip from the UK to guarantee a place on your preferred day, and we also bought a CityPass online and exchanged the printed voucher at the Pier 39 Aquarium. This gives you 7 days travel on the cable cars, buses, trolley cars that run down Embarcadero from Fisherman's Wharf to Market Street ( near Union Sq). Plus admission to 5 attractions. We also got the open top double decker bus which gives you 2 days of hop on, hop off, around SF and worked out at $88 (Â£56) for 2 adults and a child although most tourist brochures/guides usually have money off vouchers to reduce the cost. There a quite a lot of homeless people in SF and the Wharf but never had any trouble. Also watch out for the Bush Man.

Reviews.Title: “Can not fault this hotels location”
Reviews.Author: mike424u
Reviews.Content: Great location just off the wharf, close to all local shops and restaurants. Good size rooms, clean and tidy makes an ideal base from which to site see all of sanfransico. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. Free Wifi, Breakfeast was good. Real value for money, no frills hotel. Very friendly and helpfull staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in perfect location with easy access to local attractions”
Reviews.Author: A-team04
Reviews.Content: What more could you ask for when travelling with a teenage family! The hotel met all our needs and expectations. (Bytheway the taxi ride from San Francisco airport to the hotel was ~44USD, ALWAYS USE STATE TAXI'S ONLY!). It included complimentary breakfast with some hot breakfast options which the kids enjoyed ( scrambled egg or cheesy ommelette, pancakes, bacon or meat options for non-vegetarians & also cereals, yogurts, juices, fruit and alot more) and the free internet access was great so that we could keep in touch with our friends and all loved ones. This was better value than some of the 5 star hotels we stayed in on this holiday to California ( including Palm Desert, Grand Canyon, Las Vegas & LA ), It was a 2 min walk to the cable cars (5 USD/person one way to Union Square -main shopping area), which was just across the street from the hotel. It was also local to the Piers - about a 15 min walk to Pier 33 (pier to Alcatraz ferry) and Pier 39 (where we ate at the fantastic Bubba Gump restaurant, which is not cheap - a meal for 4 = 80USD). We hired a taxi to The Golden Gate Bridge from outside the hotel (~24USD including 6USD that he wanted to get back as we were only travelling one way!!!!!! I've now come to learn that there seems to be hidden costs everywhere in the US) to travel one way over to the end of the bridge to the other side & then we walked back one way over the bridge, which was a 2 mile walk over the bridge and in total ~ 5 miles back to the hotel inc. the bridge walk, admiring the views along the bridge (which was amazing and highly recommended). The hotel check in & check out was smooth and the staff were friendly, helpful & approachable. I would definitely recommend this hotel to all & will most certainly return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: lht28
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night before boarding our cruise. It was an easy walk to the port with our luggage on wheels Walgreens, World Market, Trader Joe's & restaurants within easy walking distance The room was clean & quiet , free internet They stored our luggage after check out while we explored the area we could not check in for the cruise until after 2pm so that worked fine We had lunch at Denny's in the Holiday next door The only negative were the scrambled eggs at the breakfast , they were horrible. I would stay here again for the location

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable valuey for money”
Reviews.Author: Jem711
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. Located near the wharf it is a short walk from all the tourist attractions near the bay. Lots of restaurants only a few blocks away and a Walgreens (large convenience store) a few doors down open until midnight came in very handy. The room was clean and spacious, the only complaint would be that we stayed on the ground floor so could hear a lot of street noise at night, but otherwise a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for solo travellers”
Reviews.Author: kpnutsni
Reviews.Content: Quite often solo travellers get poor value for money and a lower quality of service when it comes to hotels and restaurants. You often get stuck in an uncomfortable table in the corner or in a tiny room overlooking a brick wall! However, on my arrival at the Holiday Inn Express, I was overjoyed to find myself in a large, well appointed room. The room, with its large bay window overlooking the main street, contained 2 double beds, a large sofa and a small kitchen with fridge and microwave. The bed was probably the most comfortable I have ever slept in and I felt at home right away. During my week long stay the staff were always helpful and very friendly. The hotel is well situated, with Fisherman's Wharf only a few minutes walk away with excellent choices for food, such as Boudin's, just around the corner. I know a few travel guides would say that the Wharf is a tourist trap and should be avoided but the fact is I am a tourist, and I loved it! Perhaps the only disappointment was the hotel's complimentary breakfast. It really is poor. The choice of food is limited to a few very high calorie/sugar items which have to be eaten off cardboard plates with plastic spoons. However, an excellent little place around the corner (Beach street grill) soon sorted out my breakfast problem! All in all this is an excellent hotel and would very happily recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Minutes walk from fisherman's wharf”
Reviews.Author: evabreee
Reviews.Content: best place to stay if u want to go down to the wharf, good breakfast and very clean and modern rooms

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, close to everything”
Reviews.Author: PamT1154
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights at this hotel. Room very nice, updated. Front desk staff always helpful for our many questions. Walking distance to the Wharf , Piers, Ghiredelli Square, and Historic cable cars. Recommend taking cable car to Union Square, fun ride and quicker than the bus service. You can hop off at Lombard Street and walk down. The only problem was the breakfast. They could not keep up at the busy morning rush time and one day neither water/juice machines were working. The weekend was slower and everything was good.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location for Touring San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: birdieIndianapolis
Reviews.Content: My sixteen year old daughter and I recently visited San Francisco during her Spring Break. The location of the hotel worked well in touring the city for the first time. It was convenient to everything at or near the Wharf area. We toured Alcatraz, rode cable cars, trolleys, city buses, toured with CitySightseeing, went to Muir Woods, the wax museum, Golden Gate Park, SFMOMA, Chinatown, rode the Ducks, toured de Young, Sausalito, the Academy of Sciences Museum, Pier 39 and the Aquarium of the Bay, and enjoyed a tour of the Bay with Blue and Gold Bay Fleet tours. Using the San Francisco CityPass and CitySightseeing San Francisco's Freestyle options we covered the city in our 5 day stay. Highlights having done so were an evening tour of Alcatraz, Sausalito, our tour of Chinatown with Linda Lee tours, and the Duck tour with Captain Van.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent overall. Recommend highly”
Reviews.Author: paganini15
Reviews.Content: Overall I had a great experience at this hotel. The hotel was clean, affordable and very comfortable. They had a free breakfast every morning and free internet in the room, how do you beat that! The staff was also very courteous and helpful. All in all the hotel is in a great location. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Dad2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five days on a spring break trip with the kids. It was o.k.--clean, etc. but far too overcrowded. Breakfast time was awful; there aren't half enough tables available, the breakfast items were often depleted (and we ate at different times, different days, with the same story) and no one seemed to be watching over anything. People were pushing and shoving, and very rude in their stampede to get at the breakfast. Where do these literally hundreds of people come from? The hotel cannot possible have as many rooms as people at breakfast. Likewise, the "business center," two computer terminals, is a joke--don't bother trying, you'll never get a turn... If you want to feel like a number in a crowd, this is the place for you. The prices were higher than I've ever paid at a Holiday Inn Express, yet I felt like I received a lot less....

Reviews.Title: “Would Definitely Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: ianwyj
Reviews.Content: I decided to spend 2 days in San Francisco at the end of a conference trip and arrived after 9 pm. First impressions of the location was not so good, probably because most of the shops and restaurants were closed. However, the staff on duty were very helpful and understanding - special mention to Joseph at reception who was excellent with his friendliness and recommendations. During the day, I found it the hotel a very convenient base for most of SF's North Beach attractions. In fact, early morning at Fisherman's Bay, before the arrival of the tourists, provided an interesting contrast to the hustle and bustle of mid-day. I was pleasantly impressed by the decor of the club room floor, especially the corridors which had sort of an art decor look. My room was extremely comfortable and quiet although I was a little surprised that the in-room safe utilised a key lock rather than electronic lock. Breakfast was usually a crowded and somewhat noisy affair with plenty of tour group participants and independent travellers. Nevertheless, a very reasonable option compared to the other hotel chains in the vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “Highly reccommend”
Reviews.Author: sf6984
Reviews.Content: This was the 1st stop of many for us in America and found the staff to be some of the friendliest. Check in/out was was efficient and at all times the front desk staff happily went out of their way to find answers to our questions. We did use the concierge at the holiday inn (across the road) once and found her to be rude and unhelpful, so we continued to utilize the front desk staff where possible. The inclusion of the buffet breakfast (plenty of choice and no shortage of supply or places to sit) was really convenient (and tasty). Beds were big and comfy, bathroom clean and had an in-room safe. Location was perfect for us, spending most of our time connecting with activites on Fisherman's Wharf, and just a stroll round the corner to the hop on/off buses. Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good price, good location!”
Reviews.Author: brocncheese
Reviews.Content: I recommend this hotel for anyone traveling to San Francisco. The hotel is located right at the heart of Fisherman's Wharf, which is convenient for tourists who want to take advantage of bus tours and sightseeing. My friend and I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. Check in is at 3pm but we arrived at 12:30pm. We were told to return at 3pm and our reservation was confirmed. We came back at 3:10pm and were advised that our room had been given away to a large group of young students that were here as a group. They offered us a king size bed and a free movie to compensate. After a bit of haggling, we got upgraded to a mini suite for the duration of our stay, which was just a slightly larger room with 2 beds, a pullout couch, a microwave and mini fridge. I can only imagine how small the regular rooms must be. Despite the mixup, the staff was extremely helpful and friendly and quickly got us settled. For those travelers that don't like being in a touristy area then this hotel is not for you. For those that don't mind, the location is perfect. It is a very short walk to Ghiardelli Square, the crookedest street, and the Alcatraz ferry pickup. Also, there is free hotel pickup for the bus tours that we selected. If you don't know where to eat, you can walk along the pier and decide from a range of different places to eat. Most of the restaurants have a seafood theme so be prepared for crab and clam chowder on most of the menus. The buses, street cars, and cable cars are also a short distance from the hotel so you can explore the rest of the city quite easily. The only negative thing I would say about the location is the large amount of homeless people that appeared to be mentally ill. Walking back to the hotel at night was a bit worrisome for two young women as the homeless people sleep on the sidewalk on the walk back to the hotel. One man even approached us on the pier, rambling about something. We ignored them and were fine but it is a bit unsettling. The negative thing about the hotel would be the slow internet connection. There is a business centre with two computers and we had to wait in line most of the time that we wanted to check our e-mails. once you get a computer, you will be waiting for a few minutes for each page to load which can get frustrating. I suggest bringing a laptop or device that can access the computers and check the internet from the comfort of your room. And the people who were complaining about the breakfast are obviously too picky. There was a pretty good spread of FREE food ranging from cinnamon rolls, cereal, eggs, bacon, sausage, bagels, breads, english muffins, biscuits, oatmeal, bananas, yogurt, milk, coffee, and juice. The eggs were a bit rubbery but the rest was good. You can't ask for more at a free breakfast. All in all, I would recommend this hotel. It's clean, the staff are friendly and helpful, and the location is perfect if you are a tourist.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: HOLIDAY2002
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for first 2 nights of our trip to California. Good value overall.... Took a taxi from the airport and it was just $40. The room was clean and tidy. The staff were very friendly. The location is ideal for all the attractions at Fishermans Wharf. The breakfast wasn't up to much but it's there if you want it... Failing that you will pay $10 - $15 each somewhere else. Ate out at 'Knuckles' which was just across the road and part of the Hyatt Hotel complex - Very good and convenient...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value in prime location with incredible hotel staff”
Reviews.Author: NYExotic_Traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a layover on our way home from Australia to New York. There was no need to rent a car, we took the BART train from the airport and the trolley bus to within 2 blocks of the hotel. We were able to walk from here across the Golden Gate bridge all the way to Sausalito and took the ferry from there back to Pier 39. The 8 mile walk took 3 hours, and the staff was accommodating in extending our check out time to 3:00PM before we headed back to the airport on the shuttle van .

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable hote. Beware of the breakfasts!”
Reviews.Author: Petjen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Express Hotel for 5 nights in February 2011. Everything in the room was great- very comfortable beds and very clean bathrooms. The staff were also very cheerful and went out of their way to improve your stay. The only thing that spoiled our stay was the breakfast- it was awful. You eat off paper plates and mismatched plastic cutlery which cannot cut through the bacon, eggs or toast! As a result we ate our cooked breakfast with our fingers- honestly! Just be prepared- if you are able to put up with the breakfast it is a very good hotel in a very central location... but we would not return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Adrew13
Reviews.Content: Close to downtown, street cars, wharf area. Great stay. Needs to be updated.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: arnieTsv
Reviews.Content: Lovely staff, great location (only a short walk to the trams and bus stop at the door) and a comfortable and quiet place to stay. Simple nice breakfast included and free internet. No complaints whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: “Family stay at...”
Reviews.Author: aheinemann
Reviews.Content: Excellent location! Room was nice and clean. No great views, we faced an empty concrete courtyard, and the bed was too hard for my taste, but the price and local along with the free breakfast which included eggs and bacon, made it well worth it for a family with a small child. My daughter is 3 years old. I would stay here again and would recommend to friends. You can walk anywhere from here and it was just a block away from the wharf. Check in and check out is the only time I really had contact with the staff, but they were friendly. Parking was alot per night, as to be expected in the city, but we did not have a car. If you want to get out of the city to sight see such as Muir Woods, I highly recommend Dylan's Tours!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value, look no further.”
Reviews.Author: TallmanWPB
Reviews.Content: Overall, great hotel and very close to everything. We stayed here 2 seperate nights as we began our trip and ended so we were closer to airport after traveling to Monterey. This hotel is walking distance to everything. Very close to Wharf and restaurants, seals, etc.....Hotel was clean and staff very nice. Free breakfast in the morning with hot items like eggs and bagels, etc... Can't beat the value these days at most Holiday Inn Expresses. I would stay again for sure. Expensive parking so we parked on the street for free right out in front of the hotel. Just read the sign so you know which side to park on. Very happy with our stay. Only shortcoming was the older tube TV.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: HS300
Reviews.Content: This hotel is actually an annex to the larger Holiday Inn next door - but it was BIG on service, friendliness and location. We stayed in a family room with two double beds - and found we needed to get a fold away bed, because the double beds were just too small to share with teenage children. The location is great and walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf and Ghirarelli Square. Lots of restaurants nearby and a great mix of cuisines and price ranges. One very minor point: If you choose to use the laundy facilities, they are located in the main hotel next door. Be prepared to STAY there and do not leave your property unattended. The staff in this hotel are OUTSTANDING and made for a very enjoyable and comfortable visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and a great value”
Reviews.Author: adgillispie
Reviews.Content: This trip to San Francisco was actually part business and part leasure. This hotel is in a perfect location - just blocks from the wharf and near lots of good restaurants. The rooms were clean and the service was exceptional. After we checked out, I realized that they had accidentally double-billed me for a portion of my stay (I was being difficult anyway in requesting that part of the stay be billed on a corporate card and the other on a personal card). But they corrected the error immediately. I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in San Fran for any reason.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: tajan_1
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, gave good walking directions and restraunt recommendations for both Chinatown and little italy. Close to everything! We were able to walk to Little Italy, Chinatown, Fisherman's Warf, Lombard Street. We took a bus tour to Golden Gate Bridge.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy digs at a good price”
Reviews.Author: TKColeman
Reviews.Content: Picking this location to stay was extremely last minute as there was a medical emergency that caused us to travel to San Francisco, CA from Spokane, WA. My sister-in-law actually booked the room for us as we were in a frenzy attempting to make flight arrangements and pack. She called several locations, but picked this one, because of its location, but most of all, because of the friendly and helpful service she received over the phone. When we got there they had a door man help us with our luggage, the people at the front desk were extremely professional and helpful to two "out of towners". Advising us of all the places to eat (around the neighborhood, in house or delivery) since we didn't have a vehicle. When we got to our room, it was smaller, but had everything we needed! The bed was so comfortable, I had a great night's sleep our first night. The room was VERY clean and everything worked as it should. For the rate we paid (under $100) per night, I was absolutely blown away! They also had room service until late at night as well as a restaurant and bar on the 1st floor. Though the food was priced a bit high, I was thankful to have something we could get without having to go outside our four walls. The area in which the hotel is located is not the nicest neighbor and a little scary at night... It is situated next to the subway which was a nice perk when you don't have a car in a big town you don't know. The hotel staff was more than willing to help us figure out our route to get around. It's a cheap/fast way to maneuver through the city. All in all, I would recommend this hotel to anyone! The only thing that was bothersome was the sirens that woke you up at night. Guess that goes with the location of the hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: waterwaysGY
Reviews.Content: This hotel had all the basics you would need to a high standard. The location was good as it is in the fisherman's wharf area, so it was close to pier 39. The rooms was clean and tidy with a very large comfortable bed. The hotel staff was friendly and we enjoyed 4 quiet nights sleeps and woke up to a complementary breakfast, which was good as it felt like a free breakfast due to the cheap rates this hotel offers. I would highly recommend this hotel if your looking for a base to stay to explore San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for a Family of 4”
Reviews.Author: Disney2007
Reviews.Content: We (2 adults & children 8 & 13) stayed at this hotel in Dec-10 for 4 nights. For the rate of $108 per night we were pleasantly surprised by this hotel. The room was a good size, the beds were comfortable, the breakfast was good with different food selections being offered every morning and the front desk was always helpful. There was also free wi-fi and a business centre which was very useful during our stay. The location was great with the hotel being only one block away from Fishermans Wharf where there was several restaurants and train, trolley and bus transport as well. The only downside of this hotel is that there is no laundry facilities on site and you have to walk across the road to the Holiday Inn to use their facilities. Overall this hotel offers excellent value for money and we would definately stay at the HI Express again!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, average room, but need some improvements”
Reviews.Author: 30_Countries
Reviews.Content: It was my second time in San Francisco, first time for leisure. I went with my wife and choosed this hotel due to its location. The location is fine, the room has a good size, very clean with a good price.... BUT.... BUT I got there at 11h00 a.m. coming from the airport. As we were coming from Vegas and were in vacation for a long time we had 4 pieces of luggage and there werenÂ´t anyone capable of helping us in taking the luggage to the room. The bellman just looked at us and didnÂ´t even offered help. No one in check in asked for someone to take or help us with our luggage. I thought it was some king of bad luck, but during my stay there I saw lots of other guests having the same problems. Another important point if you intend to stay there is the huge noise made by the warmer/air conditioner... It makes intermitent loud noises during all night, we had a really bad sleep quality.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Suite.”
Reviews.Author: jess140710
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our suite in this hotel. One was an open concept suite that slept six people. It was centrally located to many sightseeing opportunities. We toured alcatraz one day, then took the 30 bus to the exploratorium the next day. It was wonderful. Check out Boudin on the way to the wharf.. Sooooo yummy. Great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location with very accomodating Front Desk!”
Reviews.Author: evabree
Reviews.Content: Stayed from 27th to 29th Dec 2010 for 3 nights. Minutes away from Pier 39 and the criuse round golden gate. Good breakfast and very clean room with excellent view facing the pier. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for a 1st time visit”
Reviews.Author: oconnorn
Reviews.Content: Picked this hotel for a return trip to San Fran (previous visit,stayed at the very nice Hotel Rex, a short stroll to the Westfield Mall). This visit we chose to stay at the opposite end down by the Wharf. The hotel was in a very good location for all the sightseeing and bike rental companies.Laundry facilities were in the next door HI. Internet access is 2 computers in the lobby, busy at times especially the morning. We asked for a room with a view.Not quite what we imagined...the cable car runs right outside the window until about midnight and then the tattoo shop across the street starts up with its music blasting its way across into the room. For some strange reason they have the speakers pointing right across to the hotel rooms and the windows open. Extremely annoying to have to listen to this for 5 nights. Was happy to leave the HI Express.The Fishermans Wharf area is quite tacky...stalls line the streets and souvenir shops are everywhere. I much prefer the Union Square end of San Fran.

Reviews.Title: “Great friendly service and modern rooms”
Reviews.Author: brandozo
Reviews.Content: Much better than expected. While not a 'hotel snob', I usually stay at Hilton properties but opted for the Holiday Inn Express Fisherman's Wharf on my latest trip to San Francisco. I was very pleasantly surprised with the modern style of the hotel (very nice decor). Hotel was very clean and every employee I interacted with went out of their way to be polite and friendly. Most of the negative reviews about this hotel seem to be about the high cost of parking and the quality of the free breakfast. To these people...it is Fisherman's Wharf area and if you feel the need to rent a car, be prepared to pay the same parking fees at any hotel in the area. We didn't have a car for three days and were able to get everywhere fine by walking, cab, or public transit. The breakfast? Eggs were not the best but it is a free breakfast...what more can I say? If someone wants gourmet, I'm sure they can pay for a gourmet breakfast at many places within walking distance. Overall, great stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as expected...but OK.”
Reviews.Author: jammex88
Reviews.Content: Considering this place had higher ratings than places like hyatt regency, I thought this would be a good option. Several problems. 1) INTERNET. It was included which was good, but it is not WIFI, you have to plug in a cable from the wall. The cable they had was very short so you had to sit at the desk to use the internet..no surfing from the bed, for example. Also the speed at times was not up to par for "high speed". 2) HOUSEKEEPING was marginal at best. Didn't replace plastic liners for the ice bucket. Didn't refill the shampoo. Knocked on the door in early morning...8am. 3) VALUE. For the price I could have stayed at a 4 star hotel like hyatt regency which is FAR superior, but that is only because at the time of year I was there (mid December), the business hotels tend to be empty so you can get good deals. Location is good, but overall I'd probably stay somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn Express”
Reviews.Author: kittruesmith
Reviews.Content: We took a quick vacation to SF just before the holidays and was very happy with our stay at the Express. We didn't have reservations but we were able to get a room. A quick and efficient check in. The room was large for a hotel in a major city. Excellent amenities. Nice restaurants walking distance. We will be here again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Central, Clean, No Frills hotel in the Fishermans Wharf Area”
Reviews.Author: 1birdie23
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights at the end of December with my mum and sisters. Standard rooms with two double beds. No interconnecting rooms at this hotel but we were able to get two rooms next to each other. Beds very comfortable. Hot buffet breakfast included which was adequate. We stayed in the off season so were always able to get a table for breakfast - would imagine though during summer the breakfast area would be very busy. Disappointed when we got there to find that the free wifi was not available in the guest rooms - only in the hotel lobby area which was a bit of a pain. No reason these days for free wifi to not be available throughout hotels. Usual small bathrooms - seems to be standard for American hotels. Room was clean. No sitting area in the room - small table with two chairs. No external view from our 4th floor room - Not sure if any of the rooms at this hotel would have a view. Fantastic location for walking the fishermans wharf area and only a small walk to the tour buses and cable car stops. Recommend this hotel as a reasonably priced, no frills option for sightseeing in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Location & Value = 10 out of 10”
Reviews.Author: crystart
Reviews.Content: Ok, I'll keep this short and simple. Location is fantastic. 1 block from Cable Car and 2 blocks off Fisherman's Wharf main area. Room was average, they are renovating hallways on 4th floor but we experienced no inconvenience with workers or noise. No view, others picture of rooms with no view are accurate. Safe in room with key. Bathroom clean and average. Don't let some pics on trip advisor for this hotel fool you - the HI Express is more modern than the HI beside it but seems that the "older" looking pics on here are of the HI not the Express. Breakfast was ok, eggs left something to be desired. Wireless in lobby only, rooms are wired. Staff said they'll be getting wireless on the floors eventually. Parking is retarded at $40+/day.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: amymck1
Reviews.Content: We had a great time staying here, it was clean and the rooms were a good size,the breakfast was very good and even better that it was included, we were very close to fishermans wharf pier 39 and most shops. we would deff stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: BridgetandNeil
Reviews.Content: Our friends, mu husband and I stayed here for 3 nights. It is in an absolutely great location, the rooms are spacious and clean. Free breakfast in the morning is an added bonus and the reception staff could not do enough for you. We would definately stay here again and tell our friends about it too.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay with kids”
Reviews.Author: senoraflowers
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location. It's clean. It features a breakfast buffet that includes items like eggs, bacon, muffins, cereal, etc. It's about a block away from a Walgreens (families traveling with children will understand the importance of having a store like this close). My only complaint would be the cost of parking, which was $43 plus tax per day at the time that we stayed. We were, however, able to get around that by parking on the street for free at night and in the lot behind the hotel during the day. That lot was only $7.75 per day. So, other than the parking fee, it's a perfect place to stay with kids, and I would stay there again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Skaw
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this lovely hotel which is in walking distance to Fishermans Wharf, Pier 39 , 2 tram treminus and a variety of great restaurants. The rooms were very clean and quiet with the bed being extremely comfortable and the breakfast really set us up for sightseeing, a good choice of hot and cold and plenty of it as it was constantly replenished. A bar would of been good for a late night drink but the other Holiday Inn is just up the road so we went there. It also helped that we had fabulous weather and could see the bridge really clearly. We went on the open top bus to get ourselves orientated to the city and the stop is just around the corner, also went to Alcatraz which was amazing. Would recommend this hotel for its location alone Tip : searched the net for offers and found a friends & family site, which was a way for Holiday Inn to get their employees to recommend the chain to F & F in a cost effective way. This is meant for anyone to enjoy, you just print off a voucher and put in one of the names found even if you dont know them. It took me two tries with different names on the on-line booking form but it did accept it and it saved me about $400 for two rooms for 3 nights so well worth the effort. I had no problems with this at the hotel but they do want to see the completed form

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Fishermans Wharf location”
Reviews.Author: JackieRaymond
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Holiday Inn Express, Fishermans Wharf in Sept 2010. Excellent location, very near to Fishermans Wharf and walking distance to lots of shops, restaurants etc. Clean and comfortable rooms. Great hot and cold breakfast with excellent choice of food , included in price of room. No swimming pool but guests can use pool at Holiday Inn next door. Friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT POSITION.”
Reviews.Author: Alidah
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay here. Rooms very comfortable and clean. Great positio, close to the Wharf and Markets. Denny's just around the corner. Would come back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: kchacksfield
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nts mid-Oct. Room is large and very clean. Location is excellent and literally 2 mins walk from Fishermans Wharf. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Breakfast is OK, better than I had expected after reading the reviews. Suggest going early when its quieter (this wasn't a problem for us as we were suffering from jet lag). San Francisco is a wonderful city and we had a great time. Our children are 4 and 9 and we did expect them to be a bit bored until we reached La but they also loved it. The Alcatraz Tour is a must, which we combined with thehop on/hop off city bus tour which you can use for 2 days and is a great way of getting around the city. The people are very friendly and we would definitely like to go back. PS There's a fabulous Ugg Flagship Store in Sutter Street nr Union Square. The parking is extortionate but you definitely do not need a car. We decided to pick the car up at the end of the San Francisco trip, ready to drive to LA.

Reviews.Title: “impressed”
Reviews.Author: pairofbigmonsters
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights after a few nights stay in Las Vegas. Check in was quick and staff were friendly and approachable. Our room on the 4th floor was very clean and comfortable, if a little outdated. The daily maid service was efficient and friendly. The location of the hotel was great as it was so close to amenities and attractions. Breakfast was plentiful however be prepared for the long queues and some what tepid food. Although as breakfast was included in the price of the room, you cant really fault it too much. Check out again was speedy and reception staff even helped arrange a transfer to the airport for our flight home. Overall a good hotel with friendly staff and would quite happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location to explore San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: JulieIles
Reviews.Content: Great value for money. The price included breakfast which was very good and more than we could eat! A good choice of cereals, bread, bagels, muffins, scrambled eggs, yoghurt, fruit juices, tea, coffee, etc. Staff were friendly and helpful. Room was spotlessly clean and very quiet at night so we slept very well! Great location for the Wharf, cable cars and Golden Gate Bridge- all very accessible! We could even print off our boarding passes in the hotel lobby! We weren't out very late at night but we felt very safe in this neighbourhood. Having read many other reviews before choosing where to stay this was a brilliant choice and we would thoroughly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but outdated room”
Reviews.Author: Calgarysputnik
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our 2 year old daughter in October. The room is not very practical, lot's of empty space but nowhere to hang your stuff. The Bathroom was very basic and overall the room needs a modern look. The + side however is that we had a fridge and microwave. The breakfast was pretty good, considering that it's included in the room price. Staff were helpfull and friendly. Location is perfect, close to the Wharf, Tram and Safeway. I would recommend the hotel for the budget traveller and first time visitor to San Francisco but if your looking for a nice modern room, don't stay here. On a side note to potential visitors to San Francisco, take a taxi from the hotel unless your on your own, as those shuttle buses are a rip off. Also stay away from Luigi's Pizzeria at pier 39 what a dive.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: jen_h_scotland
Reviews.Content: Fabulous hotel, great location, front desk staff excellent. Housekeeping staff so friendly and made sure that we had everything that we needed. We had a room on the 3rd floor which had a view of the TransAmerica Pyramid and Coit Tower - after reading the reviews I was sure that we would be looking into another room. I block from the cable car turnaround making access into the Downtown area easy and stress free. Room was excellent with 2 king beds - I had only booked a queen room so it was an added bonus to have plenty of space. Breakfast was ok - the muffins were excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Easy access from airport”
Reviews.Author: MarcoPolo032
