Reviews.Content: Getting to this hotel is a piece of cake once you know how. From the airport, take the skytrain to the Bart Station. Then get on the Bart train to the Embarcadero station. Walk down the street to the Embarcadero and get on an "F" street car to Jones and Taylor which is the end of the line. The hotel is just up the street. My wife and I are going to do it again. It may seem like a lot of train changing but it wasn' a hasell. when retuning to airport make sure you get on the SFO Bart train

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location - expensive parking!”
Reviews.Author: Duffnutt09
Reviews.Content: Fabulous location for all main attractions, room clean and well decorated although the TV had seen better days. Breakfast was a bit of a bunfight though best to get down early. Only real complaint is the high cost of parking at the hotel $43 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel and Great, though touristy Area”
Reviews.Author: morphius909
Reviews.Content: Just got back from San Fran. This is a fairly good hotel. I booked with the Friends and Family Rate and so I saved a bundle. Got the 4th floor. The front lobby area and common hallways/areas are actually very nice and modern.I found the front desk clerk quite friendly. The rooms looked average though, with old box style TVs, No Wireless Internet (had wired though) and furniture that is a bit worn. The rooms and hotel in general were kept quite clean and organized. Breakfast was chaotic. It would open at 6:30am and would be packed. It was standard HIE breakfast and suited myself and my family just fine. Watch out for parking. 43/night! If I visit San Fran again, I'd probably stay again thanks to consistent service, standards and location.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here again and recommend to others!”
Reviews.Author: CherylAnnRD
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked our 25th wedding anniversary through Orbitz choosing this hotel because it was close to Fisherman's Wharf! It was a wonderful hotel with knowledgeable, friendly staff always willing to help you get to that special attraction, how to get there and make your stay memorable. This hotel was in walking distance of the Bay attractions, public trasportations including trolleys, the world famous cable cars, Gharadelli Square and maps were readily available along with staff that could get you anywhere in the city! Our room was kept immaculate, well stocked daily and we tipped our appreciation daily! Joseph, the front desk, was wonderful as were his colleagues. No question was left unanswered! They changed money, wrote out bus directions and gave advice as requested. The daily continental breakfast was well managed, fully stocked and clean. We tipped them too because they did a great job! The hotel has a computer set-up to print out airline tickets and that departing the city so much easier! Right across the street was Knuckles bar which was crowded but it was game day and we had Eagles-49ers tickets! Great food and drink put you in the mood for football! Thinking about it we were hardly in our room because of touring. Our view was a wall but the sleep comfort was the priority! Stay here and you won't regret it. You want Bay views okay but how much are you really in your room? Looking to plan another visit and we will be staying here! A+, HI Express and thank you for making this anniversary more special! Job well done!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but can be noisy”
Reviews.Author: bp0450
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location right across from the Pier. Easy access to lots of areas. Rooms were decent. But the street car is right out the front door...so easy access, but gets very noisy! Our room was a few floors up and the street car noise was loud! Luckily it doesn't run all night long, but during the day it was loud. Just 2 blocks farther from the Pier there are some great hotels and aren't on the street car line.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: ccookwood
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel while in S.F for a family vacation. The location was excellent, close to the wharf. We were able to walk to Lambardi St (up hill) fairly easy from the hotel. We also rode bike across the bridge from here with no problem (take the fairy back!) The continental breakfast was good and plentiful. The staff was fabulous, always willing to help with directions, ideas pretty much anything you asked for!

Reviews.Title: “Good location and spacious rooms.”
Reviews.Author: JoetteJ
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights October 2010. The room was spacious and clean. The location was perfect for everything we wanted to do and close to public transit. My daughter enjoyed the complimentary internet in our room and we both liked the design of the lobby and hallways. Breakfast was included but was not very good. In -room coffee was terrible, coffee in the lobby was average- lucky Starbucks was close-by. Denny's 24 hr restaurant a block away, handy for late night munchies.

Reviews.Title: “Parking is Outrageously Expensive”
Reviews.Author: kmaster
Reviews.Content: The location and hotel are fine. But BEWARE if you have a car. Overnight parking is $43 per night (and then you have to tip the valet as well). Why don't they just riase the price of the hotel room and include the parking - this makes you feel like they are gouging. We found a nearby parking garage that was only $30/night (still a lot). Hotels are becoming like airlines - they try to attract you with competitive rates and then gouge you with "extras" you need Just be honest about your charges up front folks.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location for a girls' trip!”
Reviews.Author: cbornste
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel for a "girls weekend" with seven other women. We arrived to the hotel at 10:30 a.m. - and they cheerfully allowed us to check-in at that time. (They also cheerfully accommodated our request for a 1:00 p.m. check-out the next morning.) The hotel is close to Fisherman's Wharf, a bicycle rental shop, and lots of great shops and restaurants. Supershuttle runs from there, so getting to the Oakland airport was quite easy. Rooms were clean and surprisingly spacious. They were also elegantly appointed, and included extras like toothpaste, in addition to the shampoo, shower cap, etc. Breakfast got a bit crowded - had to wait in line - but it was quite good, with healthy, and tasty (but not so healthy) options! :) Would definitely stay here again and recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location to everything!”
Reviews.Author: nissismusic
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to San Francisco to celebrate our Anniversary. We loved the location of the hotel to the wharf because it was an easy walking distance. The F Line was right around the corner which took us down the the Ferry Building and the Bart line. We never had to rent a car with the easy access from the hotel to everything. The hotel had an incredible free breakfast buffet, rooms were clean and staff very helpful and friendly. The Wine Country Tour was a lot of fun with a shuttle from the Ferry Building and then a ferry back. A full day of history of SF and areas to the first stop to wonderful knowledge of wine making. V'Lattui a must! We had an amazing trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay and perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: GemsofSeduction
Reviews.Content: I stay here when I travel home to visit my family. I usually fly into SFO then stay here one night and drive up north where my family lives. The hotel and staff are just great. The layout is beautiful and the location is perfect. The second time I reserved the hotel I accidentally went one block down to the Holiday Inn at Fisherman's Wharf. That hotel was nice as well but I prefer the Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites much more.

Reviews.Title: “A convenient base to see the sights.”
Reviews.Author: TwoTripsters
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a convenient location for most amenities, close to Fisherman's Wharf. The service was friendly and efficient. Breakfast was good with plenty to eat, though a pity about the paper plates and plastic cutlery. The rooms were large with comfortable beds. The only downside for us was expensive parking within the hotel: in excess of 40 dollars per night. There is a very good place to eat opposite the hotel entrance. Otherwise no complaints and would recommend for reasonably priced hotel.

Reviews.Title: “3 beds, too many!”
Reviews.Author: AliDUk
Reviews.Content: I would agree with everything that has been said about the location of this hotel, superb. However after a 11 hour flight from the UK we were not pleased to find out that our 2 double bedded room couldn't have a rollerway as requested. Why? SFO fire regulations! As we are 3 ladies all requiring a separate bed this was a problem. There was no solution the first night, but for the remaining 3 nights a room with a sofa was found. Management weren't very helpful the first evening but by the second, probably having looked at my priority club status, were better.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: sheerah69
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this Hotel is the location. You are less then 2 blocks to Fisherman's Wharf, sidewalk performers, sidewalk shopping, and many great seafood restaurants. To catch various bus lines, trolleys, and cable cars.....they are right out your door or 1/2 - 1 block away. There is a Safeway about 1 1/2 blocks away and a Starbucks on every corner. I have to say it was absolutely fabulous and #1 in my book for location. The hotel it self is excellent. Very clean, great beds and pillows, and extremely quiet. I am a very light sleeper and I never heard anyone in the halls, rooms next to us or above. I did hear some traffic but that doesn't bother me. Room was a great size with a large bathroom. The staff were very accomodating. We arrived there at 9:30 am and they allowed us to check in. We then asked for a fridge and they gave us one. It was supposed to be $5 a day, but the front desk lady said "You need it for medication, right?" Wink, wink, nudge, nudge, and they never charged us for it. We didn't leave until late the day of our check out and they locked our bags up with the bellboy and it was terrific. They weather was not very nice when we were there, but my son still enjoyed the pool. Very nice, clean, heated pool, that he enjoyed very much. I would highly recommend this hotel if you are going to be using the muni transport at all.

Reviews.Title: “Ideally located in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Fulham1978
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in August 2010. The hotel is located two blocks away from the main Fisherman's Wharf area so is convenient for shops, eating and entertainment. The hotel itself is modern and well furnished. The rooms are comfortable with a good quality bathroom. Breakfast is provided inclusive in the price. This consists of cereals, bacon, eggs, muffins and pastries. One small note of caution. The earlier you get down for breakfast the better. Whilst the staff work hard to keep things stocked up the crowds from 8:45 to 9:30 mean that supplies temporarily run short and that queues build up and that it is difficult to find a seat. Try getting there earlier.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SoniaE3
Reviews.Content: Very happy with this hotel and price. The location was excellent for our first time visiting San Francisco. Easy to fill up on their breakfast too, which was a money saver.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: joanieJoliet_IL
Reviews.Content: I loved staying at this hotel. The staff was very nice. Love, Brenda!!!!!!!!!! She was very sweet. If we needed ideas where to eat they we're very helpful. The only thing I did care for was the way they had the breakfast set up. It had long lines.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, comfy hotel”
Reviews.Author: traveller77_10
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my stay here, was handy for getting to place. Staff friendly, very clean and good bedrooms. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - A Canadian Opinion”
Reviews.Author: Denishe
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to San Francisco and at time of booking we were unsure as to where to stay - Union Square or Wharf. We where happy we chose the Wharf. This was an excellent location, it is located in the centre of the Wharf area and close (easy walk) to the Wharf, Pier 39, Cable cars, Ghiridelli Square, Lombard Street, Little Italy and so much more. The Hotel was clean, comfortable, quiet and staff where friendly. The free breakfast was an added bonus. The cinnamon buns are yummy!

Reviews.Title: “Adequate, could be better”
Reviews.Author: KJC348
Reviews.Content: Nice location, if you want to be near Fisherman's Wharf. FW is "ground zero" for everything touristy, better or worse. Disappointed by no refrig/microwave in the room. Room was smallish by American standards, although adequate. Bathroom very nice, bed comfortable, enough drawer/closet space. Breakfast was free but designated eating area ,off lobby, was crowded. Eggs & omelets (poor), cereal, fruit, juices (watery), coffee(watery), etc. If you can't afford breakfast out, it's OK but much better can be had in a block or 2 walking distance, especially "Pescatore" up the street @ Best Western Tuscan. Short walk to FW, Powell-Mason cable car, Cannery/Ghirardelli Square, etc. Property is close enough to FW but far enough away to be quiet, and is clean and well maintained. All in all, one could do better, but decent value. Also, parking very expensive, $45/nite in attached garage, so if you can avoid bringing or renting a car do so.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: The_Family_M
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights recently and found the hotel to be very comfortable. It is only 2 blocks from Fishermans Wharf and an easy walk to cable cars and the F train. Our room was good, a generous size and well appointed although we had to request a fridge. Also this hotel doesn't have a laundry and we were told (politely) we could walk 2 blocks to the other Holiday Inn. Breakfast was a disappointment, too many people - very chaotic and not very good quality at the end of it. Parking is also expensive but these are minor things. Hot tip for dinner is 'Knuckles' restaurant across the road which is great for families - we were only annoyed we didn't try it until the last night.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location and great breakfast included”
Reviews.Author: VA_travel_hokies
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for three nights with our two teenage sons. It's just two blocks from Fisherman's Wharf, and was within easy walking distance of tourist spots, shopping restaurants, Pier 39, tour bus stops, etc. The room was very clean and the beds were extremely comfortable. The breakfast (included) was excellent - the best I've had at a hotel with "free" breakfast. They even had mini omelets and cinnamon rolls. The staff was very helpful. Downside: It cost $50 per day to park our rental car, but that's probably a typical price for San Francisco hotels. Free wi-fi only available in the lobby, not in the rooms. I highly recommend this hotel, and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly medicore”
Reviews.Author: MarkOliverCanada
Reviews.Content: Staff fantasticly friendly. Room just like any of 1000s of other chain hotels and motels. Clean. Breakfast was not good. Greasy bacon and sausage and runny cold scrambled eggs. Only fruit was bananas. Watery juice. Big problem: only one working elevator. Sign on the other one was out of service and someone kept changing the numbers of days it's been down. It was up to seven when we arrived and still counting (14 now). Great location near the wharf. If you just want a regular room to sleep and shower no problem. Nothing special though.

Reviews.Title: “Matresses has bugs”
Reviews.Author: moesul23
Reviews.Content: during my stay I was bitten 4 times by mattress bugs and my husband was bitten 3 times. The hotel denied the existence of any bugs. Stay away from it

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: shals27
Reviews.Content: Our travel broker selected this hotel as part of a flight package stop over to Canada. The only healthy option for breakfast was the fruit, everything else was very sugary including the bread. Front desk friendly. This hotel is the perfect location near the pier and there is a tram close by to take you to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, clean, good breakfast included, good value”
Reviews.Author: dhoag123
Reviews.Content: Terrific location - 2 blocks from Fisherman's Wharf. We stayed 3 nights. Buffet breakfast included eggs, sausage, bananas, bagels, toast, delicious cinnamon rolls, coffee, tea, juice, some other stuff. There's lots of hotels in this class and price range - what makes the difference (for us) is the staff. The staff at this hotel is super-friendly and anxious to help. My son sprained his ankle and one of the front desk personnel found him a cold chemical-compress. Ady at the front desk was awesome. Free internet!

Reviews.Title: “Noisiest Room Ever”
Reviews.Author: Neridajane
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Express for two nights and thank goodness it was only two nights. We were given a room on the ground floor. You could hear every single noise going on outside the room as the room was almost in the foyer. People walking past talking with no regard to people sleeping in these ground floor rooms. Twice we were woken by house keeping at 9.00am. To park you car cost $45 US dollars. What a joke. The FREE breakfast is just revolting, worse than school camp food. Definitely will not be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Midyear Holiday”
Reviews.Author: aussiedean
Reviews.Content: Would just like to pass on my feedback on this Hotel. Stayed for 5 nights and must say I was very impressed. The Staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was very clean, bathroom was excellent. Would be back in a flash if I come back to San Francisco. Oh yes the breakfast was also an added bonus. Good variety of food available. And finally a great location ......tram is close by for travel to Union square. Easy walk to the water front for the trip to Alcatraz. As Nike said ....... Just do it !!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location... good value”
Reviews.Author: TravelerBama
Reviews.Content: Don't get the Holiday Inn and the Holiday Inn Express mixed up. They are right next to each other. The Express is much newer, looks nicer, and I know that the express includes breakfast, while the regular H.I. does not. This is a good location if you want to walk & take public transportation to see the tourist sections of the city. The valet parking area has enough room so that you can pull over and not be rushed when you pick up & drop off. (Valet parking is the only parking option.) Our room was a little on the small side, but comfortable for a couple without children. It was located directly behind the elevator shaft, so we could hear the motor running and occasionally people talking, but we were so tired that it didn't matter. The room had no view at all, but that was OK. There is a pretty good buffet breakfast included in the price of the room, and the staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Reviews were so right”
Reviews.Author: TheHappyTravellers06
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in May 2010 for 4 nights after being recommended by a friend. We also read lots of reviews on Tripadvisor for this hotel and it was a good move to book the hotel. Very quiet considering how many people stay here, good complimentary breakfast but the breakfast room gets VERY busy. Very helpful staff on reception and lovely clean rooms with a very comfortable bed which is much needed after a busy day sightseeing in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: macavity22
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel! We travelled from England to stay for a week. This hotel provided a good price from the outset. We checked in really easily on a Memorial Day weekend Saturday. On booking in I asked if we had a twin room as I was with my Mum. We were booked into a double. Despite the busy day the receptionist could not have been nicer! She initially told us that they were full and that we could have a roll away bed. Then she commented that we were there for a week and should be better looked after and found us a twin room. The hotel is just a couple of minutes walk from Fishermans Wharf in one direction and the cable car turning table in another. The Market Street trolley goes from a block away taking you right up to the vicinity of Union Square. And that costs just $2 each. The room was fantastic. Immaculately clean, in good condition and with good facilities. Mum was pleased to get a good quality coffee from the machine in the bathroom. The shower was good and the beds extremely comfortable. Breakfast is part of the cost. Obviously not amazing and more of a buffet style. There is a hot breakfast with scrambled eggs and bacon. I personally found these rather hideous but everyone else seemed to eat them. Their cinnamon rolls were to die for though and there was plenty of choice for breakfast cereal. I was a little surprised that there was no Wifi in the rooms although this was available in the lobby. There is internet access in the rooms but via a cable so you would need a lap top. Fortunately I had brought along my laptop. So despite the internet I thought the hotel was fantastic and I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service, great price!”
Reviews.Author: mjkearns10999
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Express for three nights at the beginning of our California coast trip and one night at the end of our trip and we really enjoyed our stay. The hotel seemed to have been recently updated and the rooms were nicely appointed, very clean and quiet location (rooms were not overly large in size but what you would expect to find in a big city, I've stayed in much smaller rooms in NYC for three times the price). The staff was always very helpful with any questions we had. The complimentary breakfast buffet was a nice perk and there was plenty of food to get us started on our days of touring the city (we usually ate breakfast around 7am so it may get crowded later in the morning). The parking was $43 per day plus tax and I could see how other travelers would think this was high but having paid $50-$75 in NYC for hotel parking, I did not feel this was unfair, plus you can take your car in and out as many times during the day as you like. The location of the hotel was just two blocks away from Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39, and the public trolleys. It was a great hotel for a great price and we'll definitely be back on our next trip to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay here after some reservation issues”
Reviews.Author: EA93
Reviews.Content: I had a really good stay with the Holiday Inn Express. The room was great. Clean, quiet and in a perfect location for sight seeing. The only problem that came up was when we made the reservation by calling the 1800 number. Friends had already made a reservation for themselves. When we called, we asked to be in the same hotel as them, in rooms nearby. Well, our reservation was made for the Holiday Inn (not 'Express') across the road. The manager there was very argumentative and would not accept that fact that there had been a mistake and we were placed in a totally different hotel than our friends. He did not want us to leave and he was not going to honor the rate we had booked... he kept making excuses... like they might not have rooms for us, and if they did, the rooms at the Express would be smaller or they didn't have the number of beds we requested. (he was mad because he said the hotels had different ownership/management-- understandable by really not our problem when we requested to be in the other hotel) Finally after 10 uncomfortable minutes explaining the situation and making our point very clear that the reservations line made the mistake, he called The Holiday Inn EXPRESS to see if they room for us. They did, of course. Once we arrived there, the front desk employees were extremely friendly and accommodating and even happy to see us. We had a great stay, I just don't know what happened when we made the reservation.....

Reviews.Title: “Great Location at Fisherman's Wharf”
Reviews.Author: LovetoTravel154933
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights - great location for many of the attractions in San Francisco - walking distance to many with the cable cars very close by as well. Clean, comfortable rooms. Breakfast was very busy each day - line ups - but the food was fine. I would stay there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Good HI Express Property...beware the car park fee”
Reviews.Author: 0362Paul
Reviews.Content: As with all HI express hotels in the USA that I have ever used no real complaints about this one. Great location, good size room and perfect for a family with young kids. Breakfast was free though it was badly organised and there were huge queues each of the two mornings we were there. None the less perferctly ok. Watch out for the car park. 2 nights costs us as much as room.....my fault..should have etaken the hire car back but worth noting.

Reviews.Title: “Great Position - Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Peach14
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights with a teenage daughter and son. This hotel was in a great position with easy access to all of the tourist sights and transport. The hotel was far enough away from the seedier parts of Fishermans Wharf to feel safe but there are a lot of homeless on the streets. The rooms were clean and roomy and the front desk staff were very helpful. It is a busy hotel and the breakfast is a little uninspired. The access to the internet in the business centre is limited to the over 18 year olds which drove my kids mad. Some amenities (pool) are not located at this hotel but next door at the Holiday Inn so best to check if the amenities you require are on site. This wasn't an issue for us as it was cool when we were there,

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly placed for food, attractions, tours and supplies”
Reviews.Author: Delight57
Reviews.Content: On arrival we were welcomed warmly by both valet and reception desk staff. Rooms were clean and reasonably spacious in terms of facilities. The in room safe came in handy for stowing stuff while we were out. Wide choice for breakfast. Best of all this hotel is well placed for Fisherman's Wharf, for restaurants, attractions, coach tours and with a Safeway and Walgreens nearby, there is the opportunity to stock up on any items you forgot to bring with you.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely good hotel and NO Complaints”
Reviews.Author: sarahHove
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 6 nights with our daughter (25) and son (18) and could not fault the quality. The bedrooms were very comfortable and the beds made and towels replenished every day. The staff were all welcoming and helpful. The breakfast was plentiful and provided a good start to the day. The location of this hotel is ideal as it is on Fishermans Wharf near the Alcatraz Ferry, two of the cable car start points, the F Line (lovely old refurbished trolley cars) and the journey into Union Square takes approx 20-25 minutes by cable car. We would thoroughly recommend this hotel and all four of us could not fault it. Our room may not have had a view but we spent so little time in the rooms that it did not matter - the main thing is the beds were very comfortable and you are given a choice of pillows (soft or firm).

Reviews.Title: “A great deal considering the location!”
Reviews.Author: Riverwood
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my teen-aged daughter and wanted to book a place close to the action. This Holiday Inn Express fit the bill. I was originally skeptical about the "included breakfast" but was pleasantly surprised at how much was offered. Within a two minute walk, you are in the thick of what there is to do. Whether it is the cable cars, the ferries, Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39 or one of the many vendors who offer some type of transportation around the city (double-decker bus, "Go-Car's" or bicycles) it was always right around the corner. The front desk staff was very accommodating and even stored our luggage the day of departure. We didn't want to to schlep our bags around since we were catching the red-eye. They gladly stored our bags and let us access them a few times during the day. The housekeepers were equally friendly. The rooms were very clean and they did a great job. The only negative was the teenagers who ran down the hall past our room late at night. We were near the elevator so this type of noise is to be expected. While the hotel is on the "no frills" side of things, you do not feel like you sacrificed anything. When we go back, this will be a place we will most certainly stay again!

Reviews.Title: “RUBBISH RUBBIH RUBBISH”
Reviews.Author: merangutang
Reviews.Content: This is a terrible hotel which does not honour its booking confirmations. I booked & paid in advance via an hotel internet site & I will NEVER NEVER do this again. We were a party of 5 & booked 2 rooms, each with 2 beds. On arrival we were informed that they could ONLY provide us with 2 rooms but each only had 1 bed. I would have walked out but as the rooms had been prepaid--had little choice BUT I created a big fuss & eventually was given what I had booked-very reluctantly & the manageress had the nerve to inform me that as I had not booked direct then I went to the bottom of their allocation list. I was shocked. This dump has no bellboy--no conceirge--does not allow outside phone calls from your room & our rooms were VERY VERY SMOKEY--despite requestng non-smoking rooms. Anybody who stays in this dump must be a lunatic. Their so called complimentary breakfast is a joke---fit for pigs only. The only good thing is the location, which I admit was excellent BUT do not park your car here or you will be RIPPED off almost 50$ per day including a tip.. We were a family group of U.K. tourists

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: mamalyn27407
Reviews.Content: We chose the Holiday Inn Express (don't confuse with Holiday Inn around the corner) over the Best Western in the next block because the Best Western does not have the breakfast buffet in the morning. Both have great reviews online. We arrived before 10am because of the Amtrak schedule, fully expecting to leave our bags and have to kill most of the day before getting a room. To our surprise, the desk clerk said our room was ready and we were allowed to check in. Everything was great; the beds were really soft and we slept well. Breakfast offered many choices: sweet rolls, bread for toast, cereal, yogurt and hot "eggs" and sausage. This hotel is in a great location, just a short walk from the Wharf area and close to all the touristy things. What you cannot walk to, you can take public transportation from nearby stops. If there are any complaints, one would be that the view out of our window was a wall. The other would be that I called before we left home to ask about laundry facilities and I was told there were none in the hotel. After packing considerably more clothes for the 2-1/2 week trip, we arrived to find in the hotel literature that we can use the coin laundry at the Holiday Inn around the corner. Had I been told that on the phone, it would have been so much easier to pack. As everyone has already said, the entire staff here, including the gentlemen who put out the breakfast, is very friendly and willing to answer any questions, as well as give directions. **We did not find bus drivers or trolley drivers at all helpful; in fact, they were just plain rude, if not mean.

Reviews.Title: “good value, great sleep, clean room.”
Reviews.Author: nikw32
Reviews.Content: Was a little disappointed in comparison with a previous Cali hotel visited before this one, but you pay for what you get. Before I continue, beds were super comfy (and I'm fussy!) and we slept like babies each night. Checked in to find that our booking was not known of (booked online from Australia, and confirmed before we left). Was quite unnerving, but was eventually told that booking went through, it just wasn't transferred to 'the system' for some reason. As a result, we slept in a pretty dodgy room with a view to other rooms (kept curtains closed) and moved the next day (a bit of a pain) to a better room, with a view of other rooms and also some buildings towards somewhere. (Note to others - confirm with hotel before you leave home). Room was clean, beds awesome. No bar fridge (express hotel). Breakfast was horrendous. We went elsewhere each day, even though it was paid for. It just wasn't worth the experience. People everywhere, not enough room to sit down, huge queues for horrible, cold, powdered 'eggs', patties of something and toast. NOT worth it. Found a lovely place down the road, owned by a Mexican family - the best eggs benedict! Otherwise, a great location, close to the wharf and a walk to the Italian quarter (had a nice dinner up there!). We walked to Union Square too, just pack good walking shoes to get there without blisters :-) Overall, enjoyed San Fran.

Reviews.Title: “great value & location”
Reviews.Author: millyPerthWestAus
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to San Francisco with children ( 9,11,13), we had a 2 bedroom family suite, which was spacious, even with the sofa bed pulled out. The beds were comfortable and you have a choice of soft or firm pillows, well done!! The staff were friendly, very helpful with directions and recommendations. Shuttle from the airport was $58 and took about 30 mins. The hotel was walking distance from Fisherman's Wharf, Ghirardelli Square and cable cars/ trams, that took you everywhere else. Complimentary breakfast was good value, especially for fussy eaters, staff were always topping the food up and cleaning away. We stayed during "Spring break....." and even with the extra people around, we didn't feel rushed or had to wait long. Generally a nice clean hotel and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “room comfort”
Reviews.Author: mrchaos
Reviews.Content: Very few times I am impressed with the service at the check in lobby. Most of the time, in other hotels, perhaps they are busy, the service is sporadic. The rooms are satisfactory but onre of the most stringent requirement of my stay at any hotel is the quality of the pillows. I am happy with this issue.

Reviews.Title: “Smart and Convenient to Fishermans Wharf”
Reviews.Author: beauxl2002
Reviews.Content: Like just about everything else in SF this place was of a very high quality in terms of presentation and service. Perfectly located for Pier 39 and the Pier 33 ferrries to Alcatraz, and no more than a 10 minute walk to Union Square. The staff were very professional and the rooms and beds comfortable. Just what is required after a 15 hour flight! For the price you really cant get better location or overall quality.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel! Great location!”
Reviews.Author: delia6110
Reviews.Content: This was my 2nd trip to San Francisco and decided to stay closer to Fisherman's Wharf (previously stayed in Nob Hill which was nice too!). This hotel seemed newly renovated with modern updates and very comfortable. It was convenient to everything and it was nice to have a Denny's next door to grab a quick breakfast. The staff was good. Our room was always kept clean. No complaints!

Reviews.Title: “I liked the place”
Reviews.Author: AhmedTaher
Reviews.Content: Though the scene from the room was not good at all, still, we enjoyed the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Love”
Reviews.Author: PenciaT
Reviews.Content: We used our points for the room. Very nice hotel not ritzy, but quaint & all of the staff were attentive to our needs

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: funtofun
Reviews.Content: Location was great, walking distance to everything that we wanted to see. Breakfast was better than expected, hot and lots of it. Front desk wow, Ady and Brandy were simply GREAT. They helped us book tours, taxi's, advised on things to do etc. We had 2 groups and they even knew which group was in the hotel and which group was not, all we had to do was ask them !!!!!!!!!! We had a number of rooms and did some switching around with no problems at all. One small concern was the noise in the hallways and other rooms, walls must be super thin. We have travelled a fair bit and I would highly reccomend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “You pay for what you get - not saying its bad though”
Reviews.Author: place-name-here
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated near Fisherman's Wharf Pier 39 amongst all other hotels in a one block radius. If you're planning on catching all the typical tourist attractions like Alcatraz, cable cars and Ghirardelli near the waterfront then this is the place to be...if you're more into shopping in Union square, browsing Chinatown, and Golden gate bridge then look elsewhere (ideally finanical district) since transportation is required. Parking is valet only but so are all other hotels in the area; for 2 day parking it cost $98! The rooms looked recently refreshed but could have been cleaner...the ceilings had dirty handprints and the bathroom had grimy residue from use but i overlooked this which is saying a lot since cleanliness is #1 factor for me. The heating system was extremely loud which at times was welcoming since you could hear next door. Everyday i saw someone cleaning the banister or vacuuming the main areas so at least they're clean in that sense. The contintential breakfast was free so i am not going to complain on the quality since you pay for what you get. Overall for the location, quality, and price in San Francisco i thought it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Nicer than expected..”
Reviews.Author: karenb425
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to stay. It was close to everything and very clean. Surronded by other more "pricey" hotels without breaking the bank. We had a king room. The bed was very comfortable. The decor was good as well as the service. They served a hot breakfast every morning for free. We WILL be back. The only down side was no view. Which was fine because the room was bright. Plus the only view you could get was of another building.

Reviews.Title: “Very HAPPY”
Reviews.Author: Iammadabouttravel
Reviews.Content: We were happy at the hotel. The staff were excellent, the room was very clean, the location was perfect. We left a fair bit of our belongs at the hotel in a drawer, A wonderful man named Michael organised it to been mail back to Australia, it was back within a week, I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Hotel & Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: lapis_3
Reviews.Content: We ( 2 friends & myself ) stayed at this hotel for a week in September. From the moment we walked into the hotel the staff were nothing but happy, friendly, polite, great sense of humour, and helpful.... every employee from the front desk to house keeping. House keeping did a fabulous job on keeping our room clean, and any calls we had for extras was accomodated as fast as humanly possible. I know that the hotel was completely full at the time of our stay, but this did not slow down any of the employees. There was not a restaurant on site, but a free breakfast is offered everyone morning. The free breakfast has both cold and hot food, with many choices ... something for everyone's taste. The location of the hotel is perfect... extremely close to the wharf and many tours will pick you up at the hotel. If not ... there is a pickup location for many different day tours literally just around the corner from the hotel!!!! Close to shopping, restaurants, and pubs with live music at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nails1
Reviews.Content: Can Recommend this Hotel - I booked a suite for our family of six that had 2 Queen Beds & a Pull out Sofa Bed. It was great!.. They were all in one big room which was fine as it was very spacious. The Beds were really really comfortable. Suite only had one bathroom but this was clean & spacious too. Had a fairly nice outlook over the street was also really handy to everything! The staff were very pleasant & really helpful. The Complimentry Breakfast was Great too.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Lovetogetaway14
Reviews.Content: Our family visited San Francisco over the new year holiday. We chose this hotel because we could walk to Fishermen's Wharf. When I first called the hotel to inquire about the room configurations, I was helped by Brandy. I was very impressed by her attitude and willingness to help with our stay. Once we got to the hotel, I introduced myself and was happy to see she was just as sweet in person. She helped us out during our stay when we decided to move to a family suite and made the transition as smooth as possible. Now I must say all the front desk people were very nice, but Brandy just made a lasting impression on me. If our business wasn't so far away, I would try to get her to come work for us! The breakfast was pretty good, one day had more selections then the other, but still enough for everyone in the family to get filled up. We ate at Boudins (Fishermen's Wharf) and had some great meals upstairs. Downstairs is a cafe with some nice sandwiches and salads for something quick and cheap. If you walk down a couple of blocks towards Ghiradelli Square there is a Cold Stone, we had that for dessert most nights. We had been to San Francisco before and drove around but we wanted to hear more about the city so we went on a organized tour through Great Pacific. My husband and I and our 13 yr old really enjoyed this, we learned so much and our driver was great. He remembered everyone's names and answered all our questions, I think his name was Malcolm. I would highly recommend it. We also went on a free walking tour of Chinatown, I enjoyed it, but my kids got a little antsy. (It was very cold that morning) Volunteers lead walking tours all over San Francisco for free, just look around on the internet, they really know the city. The Pacific Heights mansion tour looked interesting but we didn't have the time. The family suite was very large and we loved the free internet. My daughter left her pink football in the room and we called when we got home and housekeeping mailed it to us. I was very pleased with our stay and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend - good value and service”
Reviews.Author: Sunny_Skies06
Reviews.Content: Wasnt thrilled about paying for parking but not much choice if you decide to stay around Fishermans Wharf. I had to move my car numerous times as I was also shuttling my college kid to and from the hotel and her job in town. The valet guys were very helpful and nice no matter how many times I came and went. For a freebie breakfast the meal was fine. At least it was more than yogurt, cereal and fruit. They also had eggs (okay they were not great) bacon,sausage, toast, bagels, cinamon rolls etc . If yource watching your pennies or have a large group, this is the way to go. Ady at the front desk was very helpful and I appreciated her booking our Alcatraz tour. The location is very convenient. Would definately stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value; Within walking distance to our favorite parts of town”
Reviews.Author: PaperChased
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here. We spent all of 30 minutes in and around Fisherman's Wharf, which is a tourist trap. Because the Wharf is the closest attraction, and because we didn't care much for it, I'd say the location isn't the hotel's strong suit. However, it's within walking distance to the Financial District--the more traditional location for top hotels--and is just a few blocks from Little Italy, where found our favorite restaurants. San Francisco is such a walkable city that you don't need to spend a great deal of money on a premier location. I'd just suggest being somewhere between the Financial District and Fisherman's Wharf if you want to be close to the best sites. This is a great hotel to be close to the action without paying a ton for it.

Reviews.Title: “OK but avoid the breakfast”
Reviews.Author: RowleyEssex
Reviews.Content: Good location close to all Fisherman's Wharf amenities, reasonable room and the front desk staff are friendly enough. The breakfast though is memorable for it's sheer awfulness - eat out there are plenty of options around

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: dph45232
Reviews.Content: I have been to SF before and stayed in the other Holiday Inn around the corner. I opted for the Express as it was the same price but included breakfast :-) and It was an amazing breakfast. Plenty to eat and set us up for the day. The beds were truly amazing, so comfortable and a choice of pillows too. It was great to have a reception area that you could actually sit in - so many hotels don't have them these days. It also had conference facilities but these were barely noticable. Some hotels tend to forget their 'holiday' guests but they didnt. All the staff that we encountered were most friendly, polite and helpful. The 2 pc's + printer were a very useful item. The room was spacious and an ample spaced bathroom. Great place to stay to go sightseeing - we also purchased the 3 day muni pass ($18) - a great saving - (one of the cable cars is $5 one way!) Good shopping/shopping centre and all easy to get to.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn Express San Francisco - Fisherman's Wharf”
Reviews.Author: LondonEmster
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is in a great location, the staff are very friendly and helpful. The rooms are clean it met all my requirements.

Reviews.Title: “Nice convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: christie79
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Holiday Inn Fisherman Wharf in September 2009 and was not disappointed. The location is perfect, just 5 mins walk from the attractions on the wharf. Very well located as well for the cable car or buses. Lots of places for breakfast outside the hotel. Check in was very efficient. We stayed in the annex building just 2 mins away from the main one, but it has his own reception area so we didn't have to go back to the main building when needed (for check out for instance). The room was gigantic with a big double bed. The bathroom was nice and clean. I can't fault this hotel and would stay here again if I went back to SF.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely recommend - great location and spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: willdc1
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on the recommendations of others on tripadvisor and it was within our budget and booked this hotel on the holiday inn express website. We really enjoyed our stay here - it's so well located - about 5 minute walk to the powell-mason cable car turnaround which goes to union square. It's also about a 5 minute walk to the powell-hyde cable car turnaround which goes past lombard street (crookedest street). The hotel is literally round the corner from the 'route f' trolley car which goes down embarcadero near pier 39 and also pier 33 (where you catch the ferry to alcatraz). I got an all-day muni pass which gives you unlimited journeys for the day on the cable cars and trolley buses and street buses - ideal for wandering around and seeing everything. You can get 1 day, 3 day and 5 day passes. Anyway, I digress - back to the hotel.... The hotel itself is spacious and has a large reception area - it's modern inside and in good shape. The check-in was quick and staff helpful. We took the lift up to our floor. The room was large,spotless and quiet. It had plenty of wardrobe space and a tv.The bed was soooo comfy. The bathroom was a decent size and spotless with a great shower - the hotel provided soap and shampoo. Breakfast was included in the room rate. They provided the most wonderful apple muffins I have ever tasted. Also available as part of the continental breakfast menu was scrambled egg, egg omelette, cinnamon buns, bread /toast, beef patties (thin burgers), bananas, yoghurt and a selection of cereals. Plus the usual selection of teas, coffee and fruit juices. Breakfast was self service so you could go back as many times as you wanted, but do be careful if you go to breakfast about 8.30am as they did tend to run out of things, especially my beloved cinnamon muffins! Just inside the main entrance there are 2 PCs with free internet access and also a printer. There is also a separate touchscreen for online check-in for airlines only, which is attached to a printer so you can print out your boarding card. All extremely handy. All in all, it's a great hotel which I can definitely recommend and wouldn't hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for location,room space and value for money”
Reviews.Author: carolineking2
Reviews.Content: The hotel was extremley comfortable,great beds and lots of space(we had a family room) Being within walking distance of everything you wish to do in San Francisco,the location is superb. The staff were very friendly and most accomadating and helpfull.I would normally judge a hotel by its price but not this as the cost was v ery low for what was a superb place to stay. Highly recomend to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay at any other place”
Reviews.Author: Katsuko
Reviews.Content: Went for a long weekend in June (25th to 28th, 2009) for some shopping and sightseeing with friends. Three women sharing a room. All staff from the front desk to housekeeping were polite and pleasant - really made us feel welcome. Very clean rooms. Location is fabulous - just between 1 and 5 blocks to the piers at Fisherman's Wharf, both cable cars (Powell-Mason and Powell-Hyde) and Ghiradelli Square. Take the cable cars (either one) to Union Square for shopping. Take the Powell-Hyde cable car to Lombard Street and Chinatown. Very good breakfast - nice selection of food. The only drawback about the hotel is that the rooms do have internet but it is not wireless.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn Express Wharf”
Reviews.Author: chi_girl01
Reviews.Content: If you are traveling to San Francisco, this is a great place to stay. Very clean, centrally located and breakfast each morning. We ate and drank at the bar across the street and it was very good as well. The parking is expensive at the hotel, so check the parking garages in the area, we found one for $20 a day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but Amenities lacking”
Reviews.Author: andiezoe66
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights and thought it was a great location. We were in town for a music festival so needed to be able to drive to and from AT&T Park each day. We also went out with friends Friday night in North Beach which is a 10 minute walk from the hotel. My biggest complaint was with the key cards. We had a horrible time using the key cards into the annex hotel elevator (the one with the Denny's) and into our room. We also saw other guest have the same issues. We had the key cards replaced twice and still had issues. If we were staying longer than two nights this would have been a bigger issue and I would have requested a room in the main hotel. My other problem with the hotel was how noisy it was. I was woken up early each morning by other people in the building. The walls seemed paper thin. You could hear everything. I would stay in the Fisherman's Wharf again, but probably would try a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: IowanativeinKC
Reviews.Content: Location is near to everything - including cable cars to get you anywhere in the city. The rooms were spotless. The staff was helpful. We were there 5 nights and had two separate rooms. Perfect stay.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel for a great honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Jaryd6
Reviews.Content: I spent 6 nights here for my honeymoon. The room was on the small side, and our view was a back alley, but who cares, it's our honeymoon, we weren't exactly worried about the view. The bed was very comfortable, and the room was impossibly clean. The staff is very helpful and friendly, also there to answer questions and make recs. Also, the breakfast was very good, and always crowded. Great location, bus stop is very close, and most things are in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS”
Reviews.Author: Bedbug12
Reviews.Content: The hotel has BED BUGS, I felt something bitting me all night. I woke up in the morning with bites all over my arms and upper body. I cant stop inching, and I have huge BITES all over my body. Please check mattress for BED BUG stain before sleeping. I hope the management does something.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, modern and clean...breakfast included!10/10!”
Reviews.Author: crazycollie
Reviews.Content: Whenever I land at SFO, I always spend the first night here. After a long flight from the UK, its important to be in a clean, modern hotel from where you can walk to a multitude of activities - from eating at the 'Rain Forest Cafe' or 'Hard Rock Cafe' (buying the tee shirt too of course!), to seeing (and smelling!) the sealions (or are they seals? - sorry that I dont know which they are!!). its also just a short hop to the cable car or you can walk south to 'Union Square' where a bit of retail therapy might be called for..you can find everything from the Levis store to the 'Cheesecake factory' (at the top of Macey!). Unfortunately you DO have to pay for parking at the hotel, but parking is a problem in SF as most major cities, and its not cheap either..but, once again, you're in a major city so splash out for the location, location, location!!Have a super trip!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: timkoma
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights. Rooms very clean, staff helpful and friendly. Free breakfast helps especially with discounted room rates (reserved/paid early - nonrefundable). If you like to walk a little, it's a few blocks from the wharf, a few blocks the other way to Lombard St. A little over a mile to Chinatown. Had a great stay no complaints about anything.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: pembrokepines
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. Helpful Staff. Clean rooms. Satisfying breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: 13Liz13
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for a mini honeymoon. The staff was very friendly and the location was great. We were able to check in at 9 am when most hotels won't let you check in until 3 or 4 pm. I love that the internet was free!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet, great location”
Reviews.Author: drkathy99
Reviews.Content: You can't find a better hotel for the price on the wharf. The rooms are clean and very quiet (unlike at the Hilton Wharf where my boss stayed, she complained the walls were paper thin). Great breakfast, free wi-fi in room, nice size room, comfortable beds, great location. Staff was very friendly. Absolutely no complaints or problems. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location for a great price.”
Reviews.Author: Nick335
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an amazing location, only a short walk to the waterfront, Ghirardelli Square and numerous other attractions. Once you make it to the area around Pier39, there are streetcars that will take you up/down the Embermercado (including a BART station). We chose to take a taxi from SFO to the hotel instead of BART (due to luggage, etc.) but we did everything else via public transit. Back to the hotel itself, the rooms were clean and well maintained. My only gripe was the lack of a mini-fridge. I personally prefer to keep bottled water in the room. Considering there's so much to see, I'd definitely recommend staying at this hotel and using the money saved to visit the attractions. The staff was awesome and let us store our bags in their locked office when we arrived early (8am).

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Breakfast Included”
Reviews.Author: Angus83
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel basically for the free breakfast, location, and cost. The breakfast buffet was all right, it had a wide variety - eggs, sausage, bacon, cold cereal, yogurt, bananas, bagels, toast, cinnamon rolls (which were cold all but one morning... minus points there), etc. It did get really, really busy later in the morning. You basically get what you are paying for, but we wanted to stay on a budget and not have to purchase breakfast every morning. Mission Accomplished. The location of the hotel was good for our first trip to SF. It was close to the F-line transit stop and the cable car turnaround, walking distance to Pier 39 and lots of other shopping areas and restaurants. We felt safe walking back to it, even later in the evening... we never really were out past midnight. Just stayed aware of our surroundings, which is a given. We had little interaction with the staff aside from check-in. Requested towels a couple times as did not have them enter and clean room daily. Towels were delivered in a timely manner. Our room had basically no view, we looked out on this closed, tiny courtyard. But it was nice and quiet and clean. It was really small, but looking at the exit map it appears we had an oddly placed and shaped room. And it was for sleeping in and that's about it. It served it's purpose.

Reviews.Title: “Just right for Fisherman's Wharf”
Reviews.Author: malawi40
Reviews.Content: My wife are from the UK and were travelling around the USA. This hotel was just right - in a convenient location for Fisherman's Wharf and local sights, the cable car stops, tours and walks. Nice rooms, reasonable buffet breakfast included, with plent to do nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - I would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: minack_7
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with the accommodation at this hotel and the room was quiet, clean and spacious. The king bed was very comfortable. The buffet breakfast was excellent and there was plenty of choice of food. The location was great well within walking distance of a supermarket, the various forms of transport such as the cable car etc and the wharf area including Pier 39. We would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great Location at a good price”
Reviews.Author: bluedriver
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a couple of nights at the end of July. great location if you want to be in Fisherman's Wharf - near Pier 39, the cablecar turnaround, etc Great room for the price - next to much more expensive hotels so you didnt have to pay for the location! Only downer was the breakfast. Room was too small for the tons of people staying. Only one Toaster for all of them. Too few tables and chairs. BUT the room and location were great

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: brentom
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed six nights at this hotel - great room, great complimentary breakfast with a reasonable price for tourist season. Front desk staff and Valet staff could answer any question we had and provided good solid suggestions and information. Location is perfect - two blocks to Fishermans Wharf, and two blocks to Cable Cars which will take you to many tourist locales. My only suggestions upon completing hotel survey, was the addition of a small giftshop, where snacks, papers, and toiletries could be purchased and to clean their windows! Highly recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Hannah_Allen
Reviews.Content: Myself and members of my family stayed here for 2 nights whilst on the way to Hawaii. The hotel is very good. An excellent location for the Pier areas. The rooms are spacious and clean, with good bathrooms. The staff are helpful and the breakfast was excellent. Very varied and plentiful. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay again”
Reviews.Author: LisaHBoston
Reviews.Content: The hotel was fine, the breakfast was fine. It is nothing special. Breakfast was chaotic with the crowds of people trying to get their fill of bad eggs. The neighborhood feels sketchy with the throngs of homeless and cheesy stores lining the street. We walked in a four block radius trying to find a decent restaurant to no avail. If you really want to stay in the area, stay closer to Embarcadaro so you are near the aquarium, Hard Rock and Market Street.

Reviews.Title: “Very Expensive for Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: GrandPoohbaH
Reviews.Content: If you want a pricey breakfast this is the place to come to. Breakfast for 3 was $60. My son only had a water and cereal,my wife Tea, fruit Juice,cereal and a waffle and I had coffee,fruit Juice,Cereal and Yoghurt. Lesson learned I suppose, right across the street 10meters away lovely small cafe that did breakfast for 3 for $26. Valet parking was $40 per day, but is to be expected at San Francisco. Pool was busy with not enough sun loungers. Hotel is very central for all Wharf activities, Pier 39 only 10 minutes walk. Hotel Rooms were clean and fairly spacious, free internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Nice Holiday Inn!”
Reviews.Author: setiramm
Reviews.Content: Very close to the Wharf. If you like to run, location is also accessible to nice running area of the city. Room itself on the small side but more than reasonable. Coming from NYC, actually seems more spacious than some NYC hotel rooms! Hotel is well maintained. Complimentary breakfast is basic and they do have hot food, which is good enough. The work out room is quite sad and pathetic. No pool. WiFi worked flawlessly.

Reviews.Title: “We chose well with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Somesie
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 5am tired and a bit daunted by having to wait until a 3pm check in however the staff were fantastic and found us a room straight away. We were also encouraged to have breakfast that morning as well so obviously we were very happy! The room was great for what we wanted and its proximity to Fishermans Warf etc was ideal. We really recommend this hotel and the free breakfasts were a great way to start the day.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Worldtraveller305
Reviews.Content: On our arrival we were greeted by extremely friendly staff on the frontdesk. We arrived at 2.30pm and realised that check-in was not until 3pm - however we were given a room immediately. The room was large and clean. Complimentary breakfast is a bonus but it was busy every morning and we found it difficult to get a table. The hotel is one block away from Fisherman's Wharf and a very short walk from Pier 39. I would recommend a taxi to Union Square which costs approx. $8 each way. An excellent stay was had by all.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: ELC94
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in san francisco and didnt really no what to expect. after a very long flight we arrived at the hotel to a warm welcome from the staff and they brought the luggage in for us and brought it to our room. the room was very clean and the beds were so comfy (very good to get over jet lag). the breakfast was good at 7:15 in the morning but if you got there after 8 there was nothing left. apart from that me and my family were very pleased with the service and the feel of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: sftbllmomNevada
Reviews.Content: Decent size hotel, located right in the middle of the Fisherman's Wharf. Great location! A lot of bus tours, bike tours are within a 2 block walk. Plenty of food and sights, all within walking distance. I do not recommend bringing a car, as you can walk everywhere and parking is pricey, $41 a day at this hotel. We were a little disappointed when we checked in because we were not greeted as Priority club members. Usually at check in you are greeted and given water or cookies. Not the end of the world, but a little touch we have received at every other Holiday Inn Express, and we like it. Hotel staff was friendly and courteous. The room was a little small but clean. No view, unless you like looking at the concrete walls and other peoples rooms. The bed and pillows were comfortable. The bathroom was clean. The breakfast was good. Eggs, bacon, cereal, bagels, toast, ect. They had their great cinnamon buns but they were luke warm at best. They stack the buns on top of each other so they don't have to refill so often but in doing that they never have a chance to heat up. They are still good but definitely not the same as when they are fresh and warm! It gets really busy! I noticed they stopped putting out fresh buns at around 8:30. Once they stop putting out fresh food your selection goes down FAST! I would suggest getting there before 8:30 if you want a good hearty breakfast. They provide a decent size seating area but it is always full, so search for a seat before you get your food and have another family member hold it. Did not use the fitness room but it looked nice and big. We always use their computer as we would rather not bring our laptop. Their lobby is large. Overall, we had an average stay. Just thought it was kind of pricey for the size and quality of the room. Again, nothing fancy or special, but you will have a comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Anne-Mari08
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from 9th to 12th July and had a really good time. The location is perfect for tourist buses, trams and walking but is not noisy and feels really safe and friendly. The rooms were comfortable , big enough and clean. Breakfast was tasty and filling. Staff all very helpful. We went to a baseball game which was great fun and we were able to walk from the hotel. Lovely long walk along the wharf. Tour bus gives good overall impression of the city but wrap up if you're upstairs going over the Golden Gate Bridge (which is a lot smaller than I had imagined) as it really is cold in SF, especially in the morning before the mist has burned off.Alcatraz was well worth the visit and so is Union Square for shopping and just wandering. The Cheesecake Factory above Macy's is very nice, portions are huge though. Would love to return to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Nice But Not Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Utah_Doanes
Reviews.Content: My husband chose this hotel based on its location to the Fisherman's Wharf / Pier 39 area. It was very convenient to all the touristy areas, 5 minute walk to Fisherman's Wharf. The staff was very friendly, the hotel was very clean and the breakfast was nice. However, our room was very small, and our window looked out into an enclosed cement area. When I opened the curtains to let some light in, the guy in the room across the way was staring into our room. Needless to say the curtains stayed closed. The bathroom was also very small, it just all felt very cramped. Although they had high-speed internet it is not WiFi and at least in our room my cell phone got no service, if I sat by the window I was lucky to get one bar. All in all, it was close to the places we wanted to see and it was clean but it wasn't great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: KKCanada1
Reviews.Content: We stayed July19-22. Our experience was very positive. We did not bring a laptop so we used the 2 complimentary computers in the lobby. There was sometimes a wait -- generally it wasn't too long. The complimentary breakfast was above average but you had to get there early. We quickly learned that July/Aug are not warm months in SF. The temp was probably +10, cloudy & windy. Not the best. We did go to Alcatraz. We didn't have tix ahead of time but the concierge at the Holiday Inn down the street advised that if we go by 7am & wait in line, we'll likely get on the 9am departure. It worked. Because of the crappy weather, we also visited the Science Museum - worth seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Loved San Francisco!!”
Reviews.Author: IMelo
Reviews.Content: ** Our house was broken into last week and my camera was stolen with all of my pictures. I am heartbroken! If anyone out there can share there scenery pictures with me and of this hotel, I would truly be grateful. I will pay for them. THANKS! My email is melo.joe@hotmail.com Great hotel for the price. I would certainly recommend it to anyone. The staff were great and very helpful. Very knowledgable. Hotel is very clean (there was someone always cleaning - the reception area, the hallways etc). The location is great - within walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf. We love to walk so we also walked to Financial District, Golden Gate Park, Pacific Heights, Castro. The free breakfast is awesome and you can a muffin or banana to go for a snack later. The only small complaint was the view from our room, which was a brick wall, but how much time do we spend in our room? Otherwise, no complaints. Would definitely stay here again and would recommend this hotel to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again..”
Reviews.Author: TuffLilCritic
Reviews.Content: My family and I have been traveling all over California for our vacation of the year. When we were in San Francisco we decided to take advantage of the free breakfast, good location, good rate, and free wi fi and decided after a few choices to go with this hotel. The room was very clean, but some rooms that are on the side have the view of the other side of the hotel because it is oddly shaped. So if possible try to get a room with a view. The room was very nice we got a room with double beds. The bathroom was tiny and the shower took some time to get hot. The breakfast was complementary but our family likes to sleep in a little so when we got to the breakfast there was limited choices because most things got used up. So get there early. There is wi fi in the room but it is a plug in which was still ok but in the lobby it is wireless. We liked that the hotel was in Fisherman's Wharf and that it was near the cable cars and things. We liked this hotel but the service was okay we asked for extra towels through the phone and the towels came about 1 hour later so the service is ok not the best. I will defenitly stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaGirl2
Reviews.Content: Holiday Inn Express Fisherman's Wharf is ideally located near Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39, and a hop-on/hop-off tour bus stop, but beware the valet parking costs $41/night and there is no guarantee they will have space in the garage for your car. We arrived on July 4th and were told the garage might be full. Luckily though the parking attendant checked and said they had one spot left. Not sure what we would have done if they didn't have space as the whole wharf area was jam packed with 4th of July fireworks traffic and we had tons of bags. The hotel features an art deco style and had a nice sized room with sofa bed and min refrig. Breakfast was typical fare but very crowded and they definitely stop serving promptly at the time listed, so don't be late coming down for breakfast. For dinner we ate across the street at Knucles and were very impressed with the excellent service at the restaurant and the Hyatt when we wandered into their lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Good location/standard of room.”
Reviews.Author: Albymorkel
Reviews.Content: Have previously stayed at holiday inn and have usually experienced a similar level of cleanliness etc. This hotel was no exception. The one drawback was that we were given a room on the wharf side of the main building that proved to be very noisy at night. Other than that it is very convenient for tourists in terms of it's proximity to tourist sites. You pay for parking however that can be said of most hotels in San Francisco. Would recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place to stay in a great location”
Reviews.Author: sunshine618
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights (6/29-7/3). Cab to hotel was $42 w/o tip. Airport shuttle from hotel to airport was $15 a person w/o tip. Drivers prefer cash (paying w/ a credit card holds up everyone else needing to be dropped off at their airlines.) Location near Fisherman's Wharf was excellent. Walkable to everywhere!! 3 car rental places a 5-10 minute walk away. Rented a car for a day trip to Muir Woods and Napa/Sonoma. $71 for the day from Enterprise (they provided exact directions to both and maps) - could drop off car after hours. Great upscale sports bar across the street for dinner - Knuckles. Good food & happy hour. Very small room - seemed smaller than a room on a cruise ship. The bathroom was big though w/ bathtub/shower combo. Had a queen size bed and the view was of other rooms and the roof. The air conditioning never really worked. We put it all the way down the first day and it never cooled. Wasn't too bad though since it's cold out. TV only has about 7 or 8 channels. I know you aren't in the room a lot, but still. 2 were ESPN and on the last 2 days, one of the other channels froze up. Good breakfast. Lots of choices, lots of tables to eat at. HOT coffee, juices, delicious (!) cinnamon rolls, omelettes, scrambled eggs, bacon/sausage, toast, bagels, english muffins, cereals, bananas. Front desk staff were very helpful and pleasant. Public transportation in San Francisco is great. Tips: If riding the cable cars, the line at the turn-arounds is long and cold. Buy your tickets ($5 for a ride or $11 for the day unlimited rides) and jump on at an intersection. Or just pay the $5 when you jump on. We rode it from Fisherman's Wharf to Union Square and then walked back. Wear layers. You can buy a $10 San Francisco fleece on the streets. I always had it with me - very windy, nights are cold. Wear sneakers. The hills are tough to walk wearing anything else. Alcatraz is a must-see! Bay Quackers was fun. If you can do a day-trip out of the city, it's worth it. Napa/Sonoma is beautiful and warm. Sausalito is also a nice trip across the Golden Gate. I would stay here again if I was trying to save $. Pros: Very clean, convenient to everything, friendly service, good breakfast. Cons: Small room, poor tv selection, air didn't work, horrible view.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jstje
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the family suites for 2 nights. Our family of 5 requires that we have a room with at least 2 full size beds and a pullout sofa. This sometimes requires that we book 2 rooms, but the family suite offered everything we needed, at a very good price. They even provided a rollaway (at no extra charge) which gave the kids even more sleeping room. The hotel is conveniently located only a couple of blocks from the water in Fisherman's Wharf and is nicely appointed. Our suite was roomy, clean and very comfortable, and the staff was friendly. The only negative is that they charge about $50 per day (including tax) to park in the underground garage -- which is a little pricey. Overall, if you're looking for a nice 3 star hotel at a good price, you should stay here if you're visiting SF - especially if you have more than 2 kids.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel; perfect location”
Reviews.Author: metrochica
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights at this hotel and I must say it was wonderful. Its in a great location. Its a few blocks away from the chaotic touristy section of Fisherman's warf so its not noisy at all. Its clean, the staff are super friendly, and its right across the street from the SF cable cars and around the block from the trolleys that head down the warf straight into downtown. Its also near two starbucks, a Barnes and Noble, and a Rite Aid. Its also a really short walk into the Italian section of town up Columbus. I really have nothing bad to say about the hotel except for their wacky chandelier in the lobby. The decor is really nice and I liked the big vintage posters and photos they had in the hallways. Its not a place to stay if you'd like a view though. Most of the rooms faced inner courtyards. I didn't have a problem with this since I spend most of my vacation outside of the hotel room. I'd defiintely recommend this hotel to people traveling with friends, families with children, seniors on holiday and those with disabilities. The hotel has extensive ramps and very large elevators. The hotel can also book you a $15 shuttle to and from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Just about perfect!”
Reviews.Author: JohnMQuincy_MA
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a week's stay here. It was just what we wanted, an inexpensive, clean, comfortable room in a good area. Close enough (2 blocks) to Fisherman's Wharf to be convenient to everything in the city, but far enough to not be noisy. Friendly, helpful staff. The included hot breakfast every morning was a real plus.I'd recommend this hotel to anyone, and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: flojorn
Reviews.Content: We booked a mini-suite overlooking the wharf. The room was large and clean. In the distance, I could see Alcaltraz. One of the windows opened and allowed the sounds of the area to enter the room. I loved that feature. I heard the street cars, sea gulls, and traffic to enter the room. At night, it was very quiet. The location for the street cars and buses could not be beat! Near the hotel was Denny's, Walgreens, Barnes and Noble, Safeway and all kinds of tourist shops. I stopped in a 711 store to buy a lottery ticket and won a $100! The hotel staff was very knowledgeable about what bus to take and/or how to best get to an area. The free breakfast consisted of eggs (scrambled or omelet style), sausage (links or patties), bread (bagels, english muffins, white, wheat), cereal, bananas, milk, yogurt, juices, coffee, and sweet rolls. The breakfast area does get crowded especially around the four toasters. Hey, it is a free breakfast! I didn't mind the wait. The only downside is the tv has a few channels. When we settled in for the evening, it was difficult to find anything to watch. That maybe a personal taste and may not be helpful to you. The Demand movies were $13.99 each. Bring a pen, I guess hotels have recently stopped putting pens in the rooms. Free internet access in our room. That is a definite plus! It was really free! In the lobby, near the business area, there is a way to get your boarding pass. I didn't use it because I am not sure how to. Definite would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable clean room, nice stay”
Reviews.Author: OnlyMyBiz
Reviews.Content: We were planning a trip to Tahoe and decided to take a side trip to San Francisco, since we'd never been. We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights with my mom and 22 year old son for $125 a night on a AA rate. It was safe (my 73 year old mom walked back to the room from the Wharf at night with no fear). It is a block from the cable car switch, 2 blocks from the Wharf, 3 blocks from Lombard Street. The staff is pleasant and helpful. The breakfast was not gourmet and it is crowded, but it was hot and fresh and free. Parking is expensive as it is everywhere in the city. We flew in and did not rent a car until we were leaving for Tahoe. There is no need to with San Francisco's excellent public transportation system. We went everywhere on an 18 dollar three day transportaton pass. It was a wonderful stay- economical. The beds were very comfortable. They have a fitness center, 2 computers with Internet in the lobby and wired high speed in the room. Why spend more money for luxury, I mean how much time do you spend in your room on vacation?

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: patty46
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights last Dec...concierge couldn't be more helpful or nice.
