Convenient to everything, walk to Ghiaradelli Square, Fisherman's wharf, took cable cars,did the boat trour around alcatraz, Room was very, very clean, nice, plenty of towels, breakfast is included and was exceptional, better than Hampton Inns...Would recommend this hotel to anyone and everyone and looking forward to coming back......

Reviews.Title: “Stay elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Dabbo56
Reviews.Content: From check in to check out couldn't find anything to excite me here. Have stayed in San Francisco many times, first and last time here. We got stuck in the Beach Street section, second class at best. Our room looked out onto people's feet walking past, very noisy and quite gloomy. Completely lost power for about 3 hours on the Saturday night, no explanation, no apology, just suck it up. Would recommend staying anywhere else but here. The only bright side - the concierge was extremely helpful, the front desk staff and on-call Manager could do with some lessons in how to treat guests.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value , clean and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: kaff55
Reviews.Content: Stayed with a elderly relative for 4 nights. Breakfast inclusive very good. Room and bathroom very clean . Late checkout no problem. Conceirge services excellent. Hotel within 3 minutes walk to Wharf area and plenty local eateries close by.

Reviews.Title: “Usual Holiday Inn Express Standard”
Reviews.Author: stalig
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and used as a base to explore the sights. It is the usual Holiday Inn Express standard, you know what you are getting. Our room was a decent size, quite dated decor, furniture and bathroom, but for the time we spent in the room this did not really matter. There was free Wi Fi in the room. Breakfast was basic but ample. The usual selection of drinks, toast, pastry and hot food. Location wise, it is about a 10 mins walk to Pier 39 and the other sites at Fishermans Wharf. We also walked to Lomabard St, Coit Tower and Downtown from the hotel. Downtown is a good 45 mins walk with some steep hills on the way, but we didn't mind this. We paid around !00GBP a night for this hotel, which is pretty expensive given it is a basic hotel, but then all the hotels in San Franscisco are expensive. Overall I would recommend this hotel if you want to base yourself around Fishermans Wharf. If I were to visit San Francisco again I wouldn't base myself at Fisherman's Wharf, I visited it 15 years ago and think it is quite run down now and very touristy - with tourist prices!

Reviews.Title: “great place for a visit”
Reviews.Author: polygill
Reviews.Content: we have just returned from san francisco to spain,we stayed in the holiday inn express, excellent hotel with a great breakfast and very helpfull people in charge. san francisco is a great place,and not been very fond of americans in the past found it was a very friendly city,all nationalities were helpfull especially the locals.we ate, drank, and visited all the places recommended by the lads and lassies on the forum and had a great time meeting and chatting with all in sundry, including the buskers and the cable car workers.we can recommend buena vista,for the coffees,i can still taste them now. the sea food at fishermans wharf is second to none, and wipeout bar with its clam chowder! is again worth a try, it is filling for a quick luch break.all the bars were good including the fiddlers green (a spot of irish)in colombus street.the only rip off came at "jacks bar" on the front near the shopping centre. it was charging double the price of any other bar.to be advoided.we certainly would return for a second go at the chowder and the sea food and of course the people.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SSW084
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on the reviews on Tripadvisor. The hotel is very clean and looks new. I requested a quiet room and got a large room overlooking the internal courtyard which was very quiet and very clean. Housekeeping did a good job every day. There was a good choice of food available for breakfast every day and it wasn't too busy. The hotel is in a great location, walking distance to most tourist attractions. I really liked this hotel and would recommend it to anyone, and if I visit San Francisco again this is the hotel I would choose.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Ponyman1
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 6 nights. Arrived at 11am. They had rooms ready and let us check in early. This was great, gave us time to relax a little after the flight and then hit the streets. The location is perfect. 2 blocks from the wharf. less than two blocks to the trolley and dable cars. Walgreens within a block, and Safeway and Trader Joe's within two to three blocks. The hotel was incredibly clean. There was always someone cleaning on the lobby and public areas, and our room was clean when we checked in and always perfect in the evenings when we returned. While not the largest rooms I have stayedin they were more than adequate, and the bathroom always had plenty of hot water. I have read other reviews that the beds were hard, but we thought they were very comfortable. We didn't have a view from our room, but that was alright because it was very, very, quiet. No trouble sleeping at all. The continental breakfas twas good, although by the time we left it bagan to get a little repetive. They did a wonderful job of keeping food out at all times. I don't know how they did it because the hotel was full almost our entire stay. The staff was very good. Anything we asked for or about they went out of their way to help us. One night our air conditioner wasn't working very well. I reported it to the front desk the next morning. When we returned that evening it was cold enough to hang meat in the room and was as cold as we wanted it for the rest of the trip. Our traveling companions had been to Frisco before and stayed at the nearby Hilton. They said the Holiday Inn Express was as nice or probably even nicer than the Hilton. If you want a nice clean place to stay near Fisherman's Wharf, I don't think you can beat the Holiday Inn Express. Convenient location, clean hotel and rooms, and friendlystaff is a winning combination.

Reviews.Title: “A nice, well located place to stay, at an affordable price”
Reviews.Author: SouthAmericanViajero
Reviews.Content: It is an average hotel, very well placed. Clean, wide rooms, although they don't have neither a frige, nor a mini bar. It has no restaurant, no room service. There are some ice and vending machines, some of them out of order, it's got a fitness center, two computers at the lobby with free high speed internet. Although it is clean, if you leave after 9:30 you must tell the clerks to do your room, or else you'll find it the same as you left. The breakfast, al days the same, but it is overall good and healthy, you can find high cholesterol eggs and bacon or burgers )europeans like these kind of meal so much), as well as diet yogurt, fat free milk and fresh bananas. If you come by car, I suggest to use the parking lot one block away going to the wharf , it costs less than a half of what you will pay at the hotel Its location is convenient, there are many restaurants in the open, and you have a Walgreen's open until midnight one block away, where you can buy water, soda juice, or snacks , dispite the cold and wind of the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a very good location”
Reviews.Author: Lesmira1960
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 4 (with boys aged 11 & 7) and arrived at 11.30am after a 15 hour flight from Australia. The staff were only too happy to store all of our bags until our room was ready. This gave us time to have a look around the Fisherman's Wharf area and get some lunch. When we arrived back at the hotel, check-in was quick and pleasant. Our room was quiet, clean and comfortable. The buffet breakfast was good and plentiful. Having the business centre with internet access was an added bonus. The staff were always helpful and gave good directions and good advice about the local public transport. The Holiday Inn Express is in a very good location, just a few minutes walk to the Wharf, the F train, cable cars, several supermarkets and food places. It was a really good place to start our holiday and I would recommend it to anyone going to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “great location, decent breakfast, helpful staff, good size room, modern theme”
Reviews.Author: hppygrl
Reviews.Content: Were in SF for 2 nights and a lot of what we wanted to do & see was in this area. Althought we debated staying in other areas too... glad we stayed here... close to everything, yes very toursity, but we were tourist. I had delayed luggage at airport, hotel staff were always very nice and tried to be helpful. Free internet in lobby was very helpful. We purchased Alcatraz tickets in advance, a must! As well as a touristy bus tour and saved a nominal $5pp but it was easy. The Knuckle's restuarant across the street is nice for a quick meal or afternoon drink. Tolley close too, as well as other public transportation. Pleanty of car rentals in the area to walk to, as well as 2 grocery stores as we purchased crackers, bottle water etc for our drive North into Sonoma/Napa area. We asked for a quiet room, it could have been quieter but was not bad at all, did not face any major roads. **There are other Holiday Inn's in that area, very close... our driver from the airport took us to one of the other 2 and we had a short walk to the Inn & Suites, HI. Again, would stay again! Was def chilly, especially at night...

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Free Breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: LovesDogs5
Reviews.Content: Although there are many hotels in the Fisherman's Wharf area, we chose this hotel because we really like the Holiday Inn Express chain and have stayed in many throughout the US. Besides the great location, I guess the biggest draw would be their incredible free breakfast - not just the standard cereals, but scrambed eggs, bacon, etc. Considering we found the restaurants in the area to be fairly expensive, this was definitely a money saver and a nice way to start the day. As to be expected, though, the eating area was always very crowded. Our mini-suite was somewhat disappointing, rather small, compared to others in the Express chain we've stayed at. At night the room was quiet even though the daytime traffic was noisy. Service was friendly. All in all, a very nice hotel. A tip for riding the cable car at the turnaround near the hotel - we went later on in the day and there was hardly a wait. Also, we'd recommend the Night Tour at Alcatraz. Booking online well in advance is a real convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Carr_Mob
Reviews.Content: We were travelling in a largish group - 7 adults 3 kids and the hotel did their best to ensure we were all on the same floor with rooms as close together as possible. Staff were very accommodating. Unfortunately we were only in San Fran for a couple of nights but could not fault the accommodation nor the city......San Fran is a great destination would definitely stay longer next time and would definitely stay back at Holiday Inn Fisherman's Wharf

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: fun2travelCanberra
Reviews.Content: This is an above average hotel near Fisherman's Wharf. This hotel (Holiday Inn Express, opposite the Hyatt and Marriott) should not be confused with the Holiday Inn. The Holiday Inn Express is a modern, clean hotel that has a quick check-in service. I nearly stayed downtown but I'm glad I didn't - Fisherman's Wharf is the area to stay in if visiting San Francisco as a tourist. The room was very quiet even though the room faced North Point Road. If I went back to San Francisco I would choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Decent Service”
Reviews.Author: DebinthePeg
Reviews.Content: Visited the Holiday Inn Express 4/24 - 4/28. Overall, we were happy with the hotel. The location was perfect for us - close to the wharf and local transit. The hotel itself is very nice looking with a modern decor. Our room, single king bed, was more than adequate. Maid service was good. The breakfast was decent for a hotel complimentery breakfast. There was a good selection to get your day started - juice, coffee, tea, milk, cereals, toast, bagels, yogurt, bananas, eggs (either scrambled or omlette which seemed to be prepacked and microwaved), bacon and/or sausage. The hotel was full on the weekend and the breakfast bar was quite busy at times. I felt the hotel did a great job of refilling things and we never had to wait long for anything. We always also managed to find a table for our group of 4. There were a couple of minor things we noted. While the hotel looked great, it is very basic and didn't have any nice little "extras". I thought it would have been nice to have coffee/tea service in the lobby area throughout the day, not just until 9:30 am - we've had this at other Holiday Inn Express hotels and basic type hotels such as Quality Inns, etc. Some aspects of service could have been a little better as well. I wanted to have a tea in my room early one evening. I had forgot to take a milk back up to the room in the morning - tea with powdered whitener just isn't that great. I had hoped that the front desk could get me a milk - the breakfast room was just a few steps away - but they were unable to help as their "house man" was not on duty. While I was waiting at the front desk an older man approached and indicated that they had just returned from their day out and their room hadn't been cleaned. The gentleman at the front desk indicated that he "couldn't understand how that could happen, it had never happened before". He asked the guest if he was sure he didn't leave his Do Not Disturb sign on the door. The guest replied he was sure he hadn't. The front desk clerk then proceeded to tell the gentlemant there was nothing he could for him as the cleaning staff were gone for the day and again, the house man was not in. The front desk clerk didn't offer anything to the guest for the inconvenience - he just restated he couldn't understand how that could happen. To me, surely someone could have gone up and emptied the garbages and at least gave them clean towels? Also, don't forget that parking is very expensive, as is pretty standard with wharf area hotels. We didn't have a vechicle but noticed that the valet parking was over $40 per night. If we returned to SF, we wouldn't have any hesitation staying at this hotel again as any issues we had were really quite minor.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Martin_B___9
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights with my wife, and I really liked it. Location is great, on Fisherman's Wharf. The room was pretty big, with free Internet access, and a regular TV. There was no refrigator, but there were ice vending machines in the halls. Service was ok, but they didn't offer to help us with our bags (we had a lot of luggage) when we arrived. They did have the room available a couple of hours before check in time, which was great for us. I really recommend this hotel. I really liked it.

Reviews.Title: “Location is everything!!”
Reviews.Author: trene37
Reviews.Content: What a pleasant suprise. We had read mixed reviews about this one but we were happy. The location is fantastic, close to everything. You can walk to get the ferry to Alcatraz, to see sea lions at pier 39, to the cable car, to the crooked street and a bus stops just near the hotel to the city or to the baseball park. The breakfast was fine, yes it was crowded but we always got a seat for 5 and the food had never ran out when we were there. San Francisco is an expensive place to eat so great to fill the kids up before heading out. Front desk were helpful and able to tell us about buses etc that we needed. Room was bigger than we had expected.

Reviews.Title: “Not spectacular, but would definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: poppinfresh0
Reviews.Content: The service was friendly and gave good directions. Breakfast was complimentary and there were many choices. Our view was a cement wall, but out the side, we could see Coit Tower. The room was clean and neat. We were out and about all day and night, so we got everything we needed out of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “nice but woulnot stay here again”
Reviews.Author: cmassi
Reviews.Content: upon arrival we had a queen mini suite.very diappointing with had a view of the concrete courtyard.They could at least add potted plants or flowers. A dirty toothbrush lyng on floor. That night my husband got into bed and it smelled like urine. The next day we asked for a room change. since we were staying for 4 nights. they had no suites available so we got a double room. it was much nicer with a view of acatraz. All amentities were located down the street at the holiday inn on columbus Blvd.. We had to walk there to do laundry and for the pool. Breakfast ends at 9:30 AM. So we never made it. It was a good location walking distance to most attractions. Parking 42.00 a day. Internet via phoneline so you have to sit at desk.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE of $45+ PER DAY Parking fees!!! There is no alternative!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Czarmax18
Reviews.Content: I was out in California for a 2 week business trip. I wanted to fill the weekend with fun things to do since I have not been to California before. This stay started off by waiting to check in for 15 minutes while the person working the check in desk went through every possible thing to do in San Francisco with a couple. By the time she was done with them, the check in line was 4 people deep. I stay at numerous Holiday Inn's and I am a Priority Club Platinum member so I asked if they had any Platinum upgrades. The person behind the desk stated that they did have something available and that she would upgrade me. After we got that taken care of I asked her about the parking situation. They are extremely close to the Fisherman's Wharf I was figuring that they would have free parking for guests or at maximum $10-$20 charge. I find out that the only parking that they have available is valet parking that costs $41 plus applicable taxes that brings the total over $45!!! I asked the person behind the counter if there are any other options, and she stated that she used to tell people to go down the block because they were only $20. She continued to say that now the prices have gone up, and that they are no longer that cheap. No other follow up was done with me. She stated that they do not own the parking area, so that there were no breaks for Platinum members or anyone else for that matter. I over heard the poor lady next to me telling the other family that she was traveling with that the charge is $50 a day per car. They had 2 cars staying for 2 days. That is an extra $200!!! Afterward I did see that there is a $41 Valet Parking charge on their website after I dug around a little bit, and I would have figured that they would have other options than valet parking. I never do valet parking, so I figured that I would just park in the local ramp. Like I have stated I travel a lot for business, and nothing has caught me so off guard as paying 1/3 of the amount that I paid for a room in parking. I was unfamiliar with the area, and I did not feel comfortable driving around trying to find another place to park. To be fair there are numerous hotels around along with this one in this area, and I believe that they all charge close to this much for parking. After the whole parking shocker, I went up to the "upgraded" room. I had originally booked a normal room with a king bed. The "upgraded" room had 2 queen beds. Apparently the "upgrade" means that you get a microwave and an extra small sink. No refrigerator or anything else that would constitute "upgrade" in my book. I went back down to the desk and got my room back with the king bed. I figure that is pretty bad that after an upgrade you go back to the original room that you originally had. The room I had was extremely tiny, and the view out of the window was another room in the hotel. Overall decor in the hallways in the rooms was nice, but absolutely nothing over the top or even special for that matter. If you are thirsty go to the Walgreens up the road since bottled water and other beverages in the vending machine start at $3.00. I had to go down and exchange a towel since it was dirty. Only 2 bath towels were given in the room, so if there is more than one person that wants to take more than one shower you need to use wet towels. The bed makes a funny noise when I sit on it. I do not know what else to say about this, but I wanted to note it. They had wired internet in the room that I was in. I was able to find a wireless signal from this hotel and I called down to the desk to get the access code, and the person that answered stated wireless internet is not available in the rooms. I continued to tell her that it is asking for my Holiday Inn Express access code and she then proceeded to tell me what the pass code is. This just added to the frustration. Overall it really started off on the wrong foot realizing that I had to pay almost $50 just to park, and it really did not get any better. Due to the times I really wanted to stay fiscally responsible for my business trip, and this extra charge took me way over the acceptable costs for a hotel room. Now I am going to have to explain this situation to my supervisors and try and justify the extra charges. I am currently writing this review the night that I am staying at this hotel. I am taking time out of my trip on Friday night to warn people of what they may walk into with this hotel. There is no pool, but they allow you to use the pool from the adjacent Holiday Inn hotel. Like I have stated I travel a lot for business and I stay at Holiday Inn brand hotels 50+ times throughout the year. This one is absolutely the lowest value for the dollar that I have stayed in. The location is nice, but if you are planning on staying more than one night be aware you may be dishing out close to $100 for parking. BUYER BEWARE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice room - expensive parking”
Reviews.Author: Phil2408
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed in a Family Suite for 3 nights. Although not technically a 'suite' (it was all in one room), the room was huge and would easily accommodate 5 or 6. It was clean and comfortable. It had a microwave oven and small fridge (though no crockery and cutlery) Breakfast was adequate - it gets very busy and is not a relaxing experience! The hotel is ideally located for FIshermans Wharf, Alcatraz and the Cable Cars. This was the 7th and last hotel we used during a tour of California and it seemed expensive. It cost more than any of the others and gave us less. (5 of the others were suites - i.e. seperate bedroom and living room - , all 6 had full kitchen facilities, 5 had swimming pools, 5 had free parking, 3 had cheese/wine or other free 'goodies'. Perhaps this is a reflection of San Francisco, rather than this particular hotel. Parking is very expensive (about 40 dollars a night, from memory), but the service is very efficient. In summary, this hotel delivers the basics very well but has no 'extras'. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for family group on holiday in SF”
Reviews.Author: salisburyjane
Reviews.Content: Location - great - convenient for restaurants, Fishermans Wharf attractions, and (although we discovered on our last night) 3 minute walk to large supermarket. Complimentary breakfast - good choice, although very busy. Delicious healthy bran & raisin muffins. Good coffee. Rooms - comfortable, well equipped (table & chairs, large t.v., iron & board, hairdrier, coffee machine). Could have used more drawer space for family of 4. Also, proper cups would have made a big difference to enjoyment of coffee! Free wireless available in bedrooms (am using it now!) - easy to use, and made our stay a lot easier. General - if we come back to SF we will stay here again. Good value.

Reviews.Title: “Thin veneer of quality”
Reviews.Author: tonyofutah
Reviews.Content: At check in waited 10 minutes at the unattended reception. The free breakfast is like feeding time at the zoo with dozens of people milling around trying to get at some of the hopelessly under-resourced food bars. was given room 320 right next to the stairwell. Really great to hear the stairwell door slam shut about 9,000 times in the night. From the outside this hotel looks very up market, but is in fact drag and worn out. I can live without a minibar, but there wasn't even a bar fridge in the room. Stay at the Hyatt just over the road.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: sue21348
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely one of the best hotels we have stayed in. From the moment we arrived we were greeted with a smile and extremely friendly reception stay. Throughout our stay all the reception staff we met were wonderful, nothing was too much trouble for them. Our room was cleaned daily to a very high standard, it was extremely clean and the bathroom was probably one off the best I have experienced in a hotel. The towels were changed when ever you needed them. The bed linen was changed regularly and the bed must have been at least seven foot wide. For the first three days we didnt eat breakfast in the hotel allthough it was supplied free with our room.. But after spending over 30dollars for two outside the hotel, we decided to try the hotel breakfast. It was fine. It wasnt as overcrowded as I had previously read about on this forum. We always found a table, and the food was certainly good. My husband managed to get bacon or sausage with scrambled eggs or ommeletes every morning. The hotel is perfectly situated for fishermans wharf, to my mind one of the nicest areas of S.F. It is so close to the cable car turn-around. I would so recommend this hotel to anyone. We travelled on a package with Virgin, but I'm sure we could have got it cheaper if we had booked the flight and hotel indepenty. One place the Virgin reps really try to push is a diner called Denny's, I must say we tried it a couple off times, but would not recommend it, it seems to serve mainly junk food. I once asked for fresh fruit and because they didnt have any they bought me a bowl of apple sauce, before even bothering to check with me first.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was just OK”
Reviews.Author: tifgmu2003
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a good location and obviously right by Fishermanâ€™s Wharf and Ghiradelli Sq. Since we like to walk, we walked the distance to China Town and Union St. We also walked along the water from near the hotel all the way to the Golden Gate bridge which is about 2 miles. On a nice day it is amazingly scenic, so I recommend taking in some sites that way. This hotel was pretty much purpose-only. It was nothing special to look at from the outside and inside. The room was just your basic hotel room and our view was of a wall. We had a handicap room I think because the shower had handrails and a big bench. The bench took up most of the shower so you had to stand pretty much against the wall and the water pressure was weak. Luckily the showerhead detached so you could rinse more efficiently that way. At least the mattress was really comfortable. That is a bonus while on vacation and trying to catch up on sleep. Unfortunately a travel agent got this room for us and I paid full price on a weekend of $230+ a night and wish I had gotten a different hotel for that price or tried Hotwire.com. Besides, Fishermanâ€™s Wharf is a good location, but you can see that in about an hourâ€™s time so if I could go back, I would prefer to be more in the heart of the city near Union St. The breakfast was a big bonus for us since we were eating all meals out for our week long trip to northern California. Since we were up early due to the time change from the east coast, we didnâ€™t have to fight crowds for food at 7:00 am. At 9:00 when we were headed out to start the day in the city, the breakfast area was packed. But even so, you could get your coffee and something to eat pretty easily. The free internet in the room was a bonus since we brought our laptop. Our hotel in Monterey didn't provide breakfast or free internet in the room. We spent two days in San Fran so we didnâ€™t pick up our rental car until we were leaving for Monterey since the parking at the hotel is $40 and the closest garage had a sign for $30 a day. In the end it was a good stay, but if I could go back (because San Francisco was an amazing city!) I would stay closer in towards the heart of the city for that price and probably picked something myself rather than a travel agent who didn't get us any sort of deal.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded My Expections”
Reviews.Author: MrsKanga
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Express for 3 nights and it was far more than what I expected from a 3 star hotel. First thing I liked about the Holiday Inn Express is its location which is a short walk to Fisherman's whaft. There are cozy delis and a Japanese restaurant next to the hotel, and a Dennys right around the corner. This is perfect for those who have children who are picky eaters. Inside, the check in staff are very accommodating and nice. Rooms are big, clean and roomy. Except for the banging doors, of rooms next door, you can't hear the street noise. They have wifi, and 2 internet stations at the lobby. Breakfast items are very limited which is not a surprise for a small hotel. There are 3 Holiday Inns around the fisherman's wharf but Holiday Inn Express along North Point Street is better located and more accessible. For families on a budget looking for clean accommodations with fantastic location, I would recommend the Holiday Inn Express

Reviews.Title: “Ideally Situated!”
Reviews.Author: cariad6
Reviews.Content: Searched for a hotel on Fisherman's Wharf and came up with this gem which was perfect for our needs and great value for money. In the heart of the tourist district among the other major hotels - Hilton, Radisson etc, but cheaper! Also had a surprise by the quality and amount of breakfast available, albeit a little haphazard! Free internet service. Gym on site, although no restaurant, no need to worry as there are plenty within the area. Literally 5 minutes walk from Wharf and tram stops. Walgreens around the corner, also a great supermarket for other needs.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and the staff is so nice!”
Reviews.Author: kellyanndc
Reviews.Content: I live in Oakland and I had a large group of family visit San Francisco this past weekend. I suggested they stay in Fisherman's Wharf because it seemed like that was a better family locale than other parts of the city. Living in the Bay Area, I am usually pretty anti-tourist locations like Fisherman's Wharf. But I have to say that I was pleasantly surprised at how different the whole area was...and how easy it was to get to everything we wanted to do from there. While there was some confusion between the Holiday Inn Express and the Holiday Inn (down one block) and my family was split between the 2 hotels...it ended up being no big deal and they were both really nice. The staff was amazing and extremely helpful at both.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Wishyouwerehere79
Reviews.Content: My friend and I arrived on Saturday, March 21 at approximately 11 pm to check in. I had booked a package deal on Expedia for flight and hotel and had put in a request via Expedia for a non-smoking room with two double beds, but when we arrived, we were informed that there was only one room available and it had a king-size bed. The front desk person assured us that we could change our room for the remaining four nights of our stay to a room with two doubles. When we got into our room on the third floor, we noticed that it was also a smoking room, so we called down to the front desk and were told that there was nothing that could be done about this. The following morning we checked out of that room, but there still were no non-smoking double bed rooms available, so we moved ourselves into a non-smoking room with a king bed, which we remained in for the duration of our stay. Other than this matter with the rooms, we were happy with our stay at this hotel. Rooms were clean. Free breakfast was a bonus and the service at the breakfast bar by the hotel staff was good. Location was great as it is near Fisherman's Wharf but still quiet as we did not hear any street noise from our room. There was complimentary internet on three computers available in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel with very friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: kat721
Reviews.Content: Went back home with my 13 year old. His first time in the city. Our room was not ready, early check in, so they upgraded us! No extra charge. Room was very clean and comfortable. Staff was the best I have ever encountered in this city. Decent breakfast every morning. Can not say enough about this hotel or the staff! Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Raj5000
Reviews.Content: We spent the last 2 nights of our honeymoon here, after being in Hawaii, and it was great. The location was very central to checking out the city, the staff were really helpful and friendly, and the rate we paid was much less than other hotels of the same level were charging. Free breakfast was a nice plus, though it was tricky to wake up by 9am due to jet lag. No complaints, and I'd recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Londonstevo
Reviews.Content: Just what you would expect from Holiday Inn, good value great staff and great location. My partner left his wallet in the bathroom the day we were flying back to the UK, the reception team arranged a limo to drive it to the airport prior to us flying.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Clean Rooms, Good Value!”
Reviews.Author: waiomaogirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here March 5-8 and was pleasantly surprised. The room had 2 double beds, was clean and comfortable. Also, there was no road noise like other hotels I've stayed at in the Fisherman's Wharf area. You can still hear the doors opening and closing from neighboring rooms, but that's normal. The location is right around the corner from Fisherman's Wharf. There is a Burger King one block down if you get hungry and want some fast food. There is also a Safeway and Walgreens two blocks down from the hotel. The breakfast was the same most days - extra extra crispy bacon, sausage, eggs, cereal, muffins, bagels w/ cream cheese, bananas, warm cinnamon rolls, yogurt, milk, coffee, etc. The hotel only offers valet parking at $41/day + tax. So take this into account when reserving your room. Overall, a very nice stay at the Holiday Inn Express and I would definitely stay here again in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Lea016
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on 29 & 30 Dec. 2008. We are a family of 5. I rang the hotel to find out if there were any rooms that could take all of us in one room, but was told that these were all sold out and they did not put roll aways in the rooms. Had to book 2 rooms with a request for inter-connecting rooms. The guy I was talking to said he would put that request in but could not guarantee anything until we arrived, to see what was available on the day. Our flight from Australia arrived early in the morning and we arrived at the hotel about 9.45am. We couldn't book in straight away as the rooms were not ready, this was not a problem as they could store the luggage for us and we could go sightseeing. However , we were told that the hotel does not have any inter-connecting rooms and that the best they could do was give us 2 rooms side by side. That was the only down side. (Do not know why the guy on the phone couldn't tell me this.) The staff were very helpful. The breakfast was reasonable. - only fruit choice was bananas. The location was fantastic - walking distance to most things. Great restaurants near by. The kids enjoyed the Rainforest cafe. The Christmas decorations throughout San Francisco were beautiful. Even the historic cable cars get decorated for the occassion. Fisherman's wharf was extremely crowded at this time of year - was a bit unprepared for that. Decided to stay here for the location, a sister-in-law recommended it and thought we could all stay in one room. Loved San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: TerriAnn3
Reviews.Content: My family of four stayed here for a few days during Spring Break vacation. The hotel was everything we were looking for. It was within walking distance to Pier 39, public transportation, fantastic restaurants and some of the local attractions. Our room was a mini suite with 2 comfortable double beds. The room was clean, had a small fridge and microwave, and was cheery. The maid did an exceptional job of cleaning everyday. The continental breakfast offered a great variety of items and was plentiful. Some of the foods offered included scrambled eggs, bacon or sausage, toast, bagels, english muffins, cereals, cinnamon rolls, bananas, yogart, milk, juices, and coffee. The staff we dealt with was always pleasant, helpful and greeted us with a smile and hello. We had no complaints about anything during our stay. It was truly exceptional!

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer_Kate
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with this hotel. The hotel is clean and modern with many facilities. The rooms are great. They have free internet, a small gym, and breakfast is included in your rate. The location is wonderful. You can eat at restaurants nearby on Fisherman's Wharf or catch a cable car (two block walk) and go up to China Town. I cannot fault this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Nice Location, Service Needs Improvement”
Reviews.Author: jjminer
Reviews.Content: Yes, beware the parking fees, but to be fair, they list it right on their website. And, unlike some places I've stayed, it's $41 for the day, not $41 each time you put the car in. (Of course, check their site, fees change.) The hotel location is great, right on the wharf, the lobby was spotless, as was the room. The valet parking, while expensive by Madison (WI) standards, was very nice during the day, we didn't have to wait to drop off or retrieve the car. The downside? The service. The check-in clerk was disinterested, at best. On check-out, the clerk was downright rude. They also refused to discount or refund the final "day" of parking, despite our departure at 4AM. On top of it, the valet was not on duty, so I was given the keys and sent to the garage to find the car. So, stay, if you're not driving, or if you've carefully compared other accommodations, including parking.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Be Fooled by the Low Rates”
Reviews.Author: AvidTraveler15
Reviews.Content: I travel to San Francisco quite often for weekend vacations. I usually stay close to San Francisco International Airport due to the fact that the hotels close to the airport offer better rates and are within a short drive to Downtown. However, during my last visit, I booked this property due to the low rate that the hotel offerred. However, the room became very expensive due to the fact that the hotel charged me forty-one dollars a day to park my car. Further, the rooms were small and the breakfast bar was poorly stocked. Next time, I will probably choose to stay at one of the airport hotels again since the rates and rooms are better and since those hotels do not charge for parking.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel location, plenty to see and do in SF!”
Reviews.Author: F1FanMississauga
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a week in SF. Definitely recommend this hotel. Great location. 5 mins walk to tourist area of Fisherman's Wharf. FW itself is somewhat "tacky" and 100% focused on tourism, but the hotel is far enough to be away from that, yet close enough to walk there! - Buffet breakfast was very nice - 6.30am to 9.30am. Standard cereal, toast, pasteries etc. tea/coffee/juice. Can take back to room too. - Nice room, no problems with maid service/cleaniness etc. - all excellent. - Plenty of shuttle bus companies from SF airport to FW area - anywhere from $11 - $17 each way. Look for coupons on the hotel map flyers to book your return shuttle. - For souvenier shopping, I would suggest check out Chinatown FIRST, then stroll to Fisherman's Wharf. Generally, Chinatown is cheaper and has the same range. - For tours, I went with Gray Line through San Francisco Sightseeing Tours. I took the Muir Woods tour (with ferry back from Salsolito) and the Yosemite tour. Both very good. If I could only pick one, it would be Yosemite. - Book your Alcatraz tour through the offifical website - about $26 US. Really worth seeing and the audio tour is great. On the audio tour, skip following the official route and work your own way around - you can still listen and get the general idea and miss the crowds. - Take the walk from the hotel to the GG Bridge. Allow about an hour there and an hour back. Completely flat trail along the bay and then a stepped climb for the last part next to the bridge. You'll know it was worth it! - If you're vegetarian/vegan there are plenty of places to eat in SF - way more than other cities I've visited. - Cable car ride (must do!) is $5 regardless of trip length. Do as the tour books suggest and catch the cable car one or two stops up from the turnaround points to skip the tourist line-ups. If you want more info on anything, feel free to e-mail me :-)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and value for the money”
Reviews.Author: Superchick
Reviews.Content: This hotel was right by Fisherman's Wharf and only a 30 minute walk to Chinatown. It is a short walk to the Muni bus stop where you can catch the 30 Stockton bus to go south to Chinatown or go west to the Golden Gate Bridge. The hotel is only a 10 minute taxi ride from the Embarcadero BART station. It should cost you $8-$9 US Free buffet breakfast was a bonus. It got us out faster in the morning to go see the sights. The breakfast was nothing elaborate but it was fast and there was lots of variety. The front desk staff were very helpful and patient about sightseeing questions and let me extend my check-out time by 1.5 hours. The room was very clean and quite nice. The coffee maker in the room was great for making tea in the evening. The hotel was very quiet and we slept soundly as the beds were very comfy. There are 2 laptops for guests to use to access the internet which was great. We were able to e-mail messages home.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for SF tourist seeking good value/location”
Reviews.Author: foofighter1981
Reviews.Content: The consensus about this hotel being excellent is right on the money; I can attest as I chose this hotel after reading the reviews here. Some finer points that weren't mentioned that I think could be useful: -Not only is this walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf, you could walk to/from Union Square via Little Italy and Chinatown (both relatively safe neighborhoods) in about 30 minutes. Moreover, the path to/from is not too hilly relative to other parts of SF. -The lobby floor has a bathroom, which is useful if you are squeamish about using the disgusting ones around Fisherman's Wharf. -Though the valet was indeed expensive (a given with a hotel in a good location), the cost includes in/out privileges. Valets were quick at both check in and out, and always asked if you needed directions. -Breakfast gets really crowded, so get there before 8:00 if you want to eat in relative peace. -The bathroom products have a cinammon scent... could be good or bad depending on your take. In any case, there's a drugstore about a minute walk away for misc toiletry needs. Overall, I easily recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a good combination of value and location.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location!”
Reviews.Author: Kellysmom49
Reviews.Content: Since I arrived late at night on a Wednesday checking in was no problem. I didn't notice any bell person but no problem I had my daughter helping me with my luggage. The mini suite was nice, bed comfortable and having a refrigerator and microwave was good to have. Other reviews listed noise as a problem, I didn't notice any. The continental breakfast was okay. I have also noticed others complaining about the plastic utensils and plates --- to me, that is convenient especially when you want to take food to your room. What did people expect, real plates? It is a great hotel and in a nice location. Will be back in March.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: Peech
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for tourists. It's just around Fisherman's Wharf and close to a lot of food outlets, both cheap/fast food (IHOP, In/Out Burger, Denny's) as well as fine dining (Gary Danko...). Walgreens, Barnes & Noble, Trader Joe's...etc are all nearby. It's also close to the tram depot so it's convenient for transport. Room is clean and spacious, with a great bathroom. I had a little kitchenette in my mini-suite. Internet was free so this was great. Breakfast was OK. Staff at the front were very helpful. No in-house laundromat but it's available at the Holiday Inn next door. Would defintely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loving It”
Reviews.Author: annabanannaMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Paid around $50 USD/night for this hotel on Hotwire, which is a real bargain in San Francisco! Room is lovely, large and very clean. Nice and quiet. Room has safe, coffee maker and plenty of space for storage. Free wi-fi with good signal. No problem with staff at reception. Valet parking is expensive- $41 for 24 hours. Cable car is a 5 minute walk away. Great location for tourists. Breakfast provided is ok- bagels, english muffins, eggs, sausages, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Bad service, good location”
Reviews.Author: JaanaCyprus
Reviews.Content: We stayed the first 5 nights of our holiday in a small boutique hotel in San Francisco and after changed to the Holiday Inn, unfortunately.. There was nothing really wrong with the hotel itself, but the service from the front desk was so unbelievably bad that I have not encountered such attitude anywhere else. On arrival we were placed into the Beach street annex of the hotel and the two ladies who worked there had really a bad attitude problem, maybe because they had to work in the cold lobby. The reception also closed during the night hours and it felt a bit unsafe to enter the hotel through a parking lot and find unmanned reception. Others the location was fabulous and the rooms were equipped very well. We were glad to get familiar with another part of San Francisco but would not choose this hotel again because of the service.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is fantastic”
Reviews.Author: chonga65
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as our first stop from Australia on American holiday. I was not sure what to expect and was pleasantly surprised. Location is excellent less than 2 blocks from fishermans Wharf & easy walking distance to cable tram and other attractions. We have 2 children 11 & 14 and it was a great location with low noise and comfortable facilities. The free breakfast was simple but nice & fantastic cost saver to start our holiday.There is a great bar acrooss the road called Knuckles and if you like beer you must go to Jac's bar which is easy walking distance. San Francisco was great and this hotel excellent way to see it all from...

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: ImOnHoliday28
Reviews.Content: What a great Hotel. We stayed here for 6 nights in August 2008 and we were completely blown away. The hotel is in a incredible location on Fisherman's Wharf with an approximate walk of ten minutes to Pier 39. There is so much to do here and everything is easily accessible as the trolley leaves just around the corner from the hotel. The room's were modern and very clean!! Spotless even!! The hotel staff were the best that I have ever encountered, they were so friendly and always willing to help us no matter what! Breakfast was included as part of our package and changed everyone morning but it was so yummy! Internet access was free the hotel even provided 2 computers for their guests to use in the lobby. The only thing that we were upset about was that our room did not have a fridge, we quickly got over that as we hardly spent any time in there. I highly recommend this hotel to everyone that is visiting San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: KnowingMeKnowingYou
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in a really good location, 5 mins walk from Fisherman's Wharf. The staff were friendly and helpful, the room was large and clean and the free breakfast was very good. I would definatley recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at HI Express Fisherman's Wharf”
Reviews.Author: Eveleyn
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our 3 children in a suite which was very quiet, comfortable and clean. The staff were efficient and friendly at check-in and the valets were helpful but as others have said the parking is expensive. On arrival the fridge in our room wasn't working- we contacted housekeeping and a whole new fridge appeared in 10 minutes! The location is great for all the sights in SFO. We hired bikes from the shop around the corner and rode from Fishermans Wharf, around the Bay and over the Golden Gate Bridge- a real highlight and the kids loved it. The breakfast can get busy but we always got a table- don't wait until the last 30-45mins though as they seemed to run out of the hot food. Altogether a great time and we would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: jessc2078
Reviews.Content: This hotel was close to everthing. Walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39 and Ghirardelli Square. Staff was very friendly and rooms were very clean. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Clean”
Reviews.Author: teena99
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Holiday Inn Fisherman's Wharf Thursday October 2 and Friday October 3 2008. Arrived early and checked in immediately. They had a room ready., I had been told about the possibility of getting a room in the Beach building across the street and down the block. I was a little dissapointed when she told us we were in that building, but we did not ask to change it, as the main building were smoking rooms, Ours were nonsmoking. They offered to take our luggage over, but it was really just a short walk. We went to our room and were very satisfied. We loved the free wireless internet. We were only at this location for 2 nights, and we did get a ground floor room. There was a little street noise, I would recommend asking for a higher room if this would bother you. The desk at our building was open almost all the time and the employees were very helpful. We had to fax some papers for our balloon ride and something was not working. She tried and tried. She would not give up, even called the company and finally got the papers faxed. We did not eat in the restaurant in the hotel, because we have a strict rule for not going to any type of chain restaurant while visiting other cities,. The location was perfect to visit the Fisherman's Wharf area. There is a most wonderful (5 stars out of 5) restaurant just down the block called Beach Street Grill. I highly recommend eating there for breakfast. We both had excellent food, outstanding friendly service and great Momosa's. If I were to stay near Fishermans Wharf again, I would definately look into this place again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. All in all a great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: RUSTYknoxville
Reviews.Content: GREAT LOCATION for pretty much every site in San Francisco. The shopping district was a short bus route away. Hop on a tour bus and get a good look at the whole city. It's fantastic. The breakfast was standard, it was a nice change to actually see a hotel in America doing complimentary breakfasts. The rooms were standard and comfortable. Clean and staff were friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Tinycat007
Reviews.Content: Front desk were very helpful, they were able to give us lots of information about the area. Internet is available free to use on two shared computers next to the lobby. Breakfast was okay, a bit plastic (tasteless) but complimentary. Good location, 2 blocks back from fisherman's wharf, very easy walk and back far enough that you didn't have any noise or crowds. Tour desks close and end of cable car turnaround is only 2 blocks away. Everything was an easy walk and transport was easy to catch if you wanted to venture to down town or take a tour over the Golden gate bridge. Rooms were very clean and the bed was comfortable. You don't get a view from most rooms however you don't spend much time in your room anyway as there is so much to see in San Fran. If you want to do laundry you do need to use the coin operated machines in the next holiday Inn which is in the same block. The front desk can swap notes for quarters to use the machines.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, expensive parking, crowded breakfast”
Reviews.Author: jfmelle
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Holiday Inn Express in Fishermans Wharf with my wife for 5 nights in October 2008 as part of our vacations at the West Coast. I got a reasonably good rate considering the location of the hotel and that we had breakfast included. The king room was above average. Clean, comfortable, and with the expected amenities. Everything looked new, and that also gave us a good impression. Free internet (cable, not wireless) worked well. Breakfast was included in rate. Completely over crowded, as the hotel probably has more than 400 rooms, and is located in a highly touristic zone. That said, it had eggs, bagles, cream cheese, etc... But dozens of people at the same time, so don't expect to be in a quiet zone. From time to time you can notice that the staff isn't able to replenish the food, so don't let to have breakfast at the last 30 minutes. Parking is extremely expensive (thirty nine dollars per day). Location is excellent. Walking distance of the cable car, pier 39, Guirardelli square and other attractions. Hotel is near other famous hotels as Hyatt, Hilton, Marriott and even Holiday Inn. As a tip, there's a 24 hours open denny's around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with best location in Fisherman's Warf”
Reviews.Author: HBBear
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful great hotel located one block from the center of Fisherman's Warf in San Francisco. Safe area which allows you to walk to many San Francisco tourist spots. Restaurants everywhere. Trolley line at your doorstep for ease of getting around. We have stayed here before and love this hotel and location. This hotel sits right next to a regular Holiday Inn but this Holiday Inn Express is much newer and looks great from both the inside and out. Here are the only two things to be aware of: First, recheck the hotel website about a week before arrival to see if the rates have been lowered. We saved about $100 per night by doing this. Secondly, the fee for parking your car is $39 per day plus parking tax of $5.46. This is very pricey and is a hidden fee unless you read the fine print. Just be prepared. Overall, a Great experience and would stay here again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: seniortravleer
Reviews.Content: With the exception of the, in my view expensive parking, this is a great hotel, good location, helpful staff, nice rooms, I did not eat thereso cannot comment.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stokie81
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Holiday Inn for 5 nights and just used it as a base to sleep. Good central location with access to most attractions especially the trams and tour buses. We didn't use any of the services whilst at the hotel but when we did ask any questions all the staff were very helpful! The room was very clean and of good decor with very comfortable beds. We did not have a view of sorts but that did not bother us as we only used the room to sleep. A short review but we did not use the hotel that much, overall very nice and I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: lamberts52
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights and very central for all the main tourist sights. Hotel was clean and breakfast was OK but really the cooked food we avoided.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: heatherdan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in Sept 2008. Location is great, rooms clean, service good, free internet access, valet parking was great service, close to all food and points of interest Down falls, no pool, parking $40 a day (ouch) Great place to stay, would recommend. But if you plan on using a car.....which I advise.....stay further out, parking is cheaper, hotels are cheaper, and you have to pay to park anyways anywhere in the Fishermans Wharf area.

Reviews.Title: “It was just what we needed...”
Reviews.Author: Portia142
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here at the start of a 16-day trip (for three nights). We knew we would be late arriving (having missed a connecting flight) and had phoned ahead with our expected arrival time. When we arrived we found that Reception had made of note of this and check-in was smooth. Our room was in the middle of the hotel (very nice and quiet) and it was just what we needed after a long trip from the UK. We were staying here over the Labor Day weekend, so the hotel was busy. We only really noticed this at breakfast, and whilst there was plenty of food for everyone we did notice that at around 8am one morning free tables were scare. A very minor point, and only to be expected, and it didn't cause any problems. The hotel is excellently situated, being between the ends of two cable car lines and one block from the street car (tram). We would definately stay here again and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Norvsta
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just completed a trip around the world staying at a variety of hotels, some bad, some good. We both rated this hotel very highly. The reception staff are kept very busy with the high volume of tours which come through but they still treated us with warmth and a smile. The concierge, Rhoda, was particularly helpful, as was their comically dressed bellboy, who was great at whistling down cabs and providing directions. If you are staying at this hotel try and get onto the 5th floor. This is the floor with the business centre. We stayed in room 506 which was large, clean and very well equipped with everything expected from a quality hotel. The king sized bed was also fantastic. We did not have any meals at the hotel as it is located very close to Walgreens supermarket. We saved lots of money buying fresh fruit and groceries from this store. The room also had a microwave oven which came in handy heating up a few TV meals. The coffee making machine was also a nice touch, especially for my wife! Fishermans Wharf is a great place to stay. Even though it is very touristy, its where the action is and there is lots of cheap clothing and characterful shop assistants. San Francisco is a superb city. For a fun filled day, if you have the energy catch a cab to Haight Ashbury, walk from Masonic down Haight St and check out all the great shops and survivors of the hippy and punk eras. Keep walking through Golden Gate Park ( about a 2 hour walk) visit the attractions and get right down to the Pacific Ocean. Just keep heading west towards the sun. There is a great hotel just to the left here. Have a few wines or beers and catch a cab home. What a day!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: WisteriaWay
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are in our 60's and stayed at the Holiday Inn Express at Fisherman's Wharf for four nights in September 2008. Very clean, quiet modern room. Very comfortable beds. Convenient location to the Wharf which was extremely crowded when we were there. Lots of restaurants and touristy stores and stands nearby. Continental breakfast was adequate, but that's OK. Lots of tour buses and some mornings the dining area was crowded, but we always got a seat. Hotel has only valet parking which is a whopping $39.00 per day. Near cable cars and public transportation. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: jcd016
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived in the morning intending to store our luggage until later in the day. The woman at the front desk checked, and a room was ready, so we checked in. The room was smaller than at the Hyatt across the street (which we had just checked out of), but pretty much standard for HI Express. It was clean and the bed was comfortable. We had no problems whatsoever during our stay. The free breakfast buffet had some hot items including cinnamon rolls, some pre-made cheese omelets, and bacon one day and sausages the next. We thought it was good enough to eat there again the second morning. The hotel is in a great location close to the wharf, and convenient for catching the streetcar, buses, and cable cars. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Service, especially if you book with Hotwire”
Reviews.Author: CodSt
Reviews.Content: On arriving we had to wait for the front desk staff at the main building to finish playing with their hair before being checked in. They asked if we wanted a smoking or non-smoking king room and we said non-smoking. We had been put in the notorious beach building around the corner and across the street. As we entered the corridor there was an odd odour of car fumes and cigarettes but trusted the staff hadn't given us a smoking room. On entering the room the smell was awful, there was someone elses hair attached to the ceiling of the bathroom and the bed was clearly a single room. We couldn't understand it when I had signed a document at check in that said it was a non smoking king. We had a terrible nights sleep as we were on the ground floor and had buses and people being loud outside our room. As soon as we got up (not that I got much sleep - I didn't feel very safe) we asked the front desk in our building to move us. The room we moved to was twice the size and clearly a non-smoking room. The front desk, bell man etc in the beach house building are not reliable, half the time they were closed. When I needed quarters for the laundry (don't use the drier, your clothes would dry faster by blowing on them) we had to go all the way to the other building because they don't have any at the beach building. The internet was not working in our building as well. I am certain that we were given a single room because when collecting quarters a man at the front desk said we wanted to move from one and the number of his room put it in the same position as ours but on a different floor. In short, I wouldn't stay here again. They have poor customer service, unequal access to facilities based on where they put you and did not give me a room for 2 when that was what I paid for. It did not feel safe either.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice!”
Reviews.Author: IllinoisGypsy
Reviews.Content: Holiday Inn Express at the Wharf was a great choice! The hotel was very well maintained . Free breakfast was included and could always find a selection that was fine and would get your day started. The staff were very helpful and friendly. Location was super, could hop on a bus ,streetcar or walk to any attraction along the wharf area. Would absolutely stay again and would recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: lewpylew
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Holiday Inn Express for 5 nights at the start of September with my boyfriend. Hotel was in a great location 2 minutes walk from the heart of Fisherman's walk. Central San Francisco was easily accessible by streetcar just around the corner at a bargainous 80p. Our room was on the 2nd floor. Was clean and spacious and couldn't fault it. The hotel offers a free contintenal breakfast, We only had it one day as the choices of food were limited and it was very crammed when we went downstairs which was a little off putting. Free internet access in the lobby which was helpful. Would stay here agan as couldn't fault it.

Reviews.Title: “Spot On!”
Reviews.Author: alanjonesbath
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at the HI Express for a couple of reasons. Most of the Fishermans Wharf hotel were coming in at about the same price, so went with what looked like best value. The HI Express offers a free breakfast every morning, so that sealed the deal for us. Location can't be faulted, it's right in the middle of the Wharf. You can walk to pretty much anywhere within 5 mintues, including Pier 39 and cable car turnarounds. It is on North Point Street, a fairly quite street from our experience. Our room overlooked the street, and we had absolutely no complaints about road noise, or noise from other rooms for that matter. We were on the 4th (top) floor, right at the end of the corridor, which must have helped keep noise levels down. With only 4 floors, there was never a long wait for the elevator. The hotel looks very new, everything feels fresh, and everything was spotlessly clean. No complaints whatsoever, and the daily housekeeping did a good job. The bed itself was very comfy, though the room itself wasn't that large. Fine for the two of us, but you couldn't have fitted anyone else in there. Not a problem though, as we weren't there to spend time in the hotel. We found the two internet access PC's in the lobby very handy, and on only a couple of occasions did we have to wait. Breakfast was very good for a 'free' breakfast. They had the usual selection of cereal, fruit, yoghurts, pastries, muffins, etc, plus a small selection of cooked foods like sausages, bacon, egg, etc. Free coffee, juice and milk as well of course. The staff at the front desk were very friendly and polite. Both check-in and check-out were efficent. We didn't make use of the parking at the hotel, which at around $42 a day plus tip (it is valet only), we were glad we didn't have a car. The hotel does have an undercover pull in, which is big enough to hold a couple of cars, which was handy for us on checkout day as we collected a car from Avis just around the corner, and brought it back to the hotel to load up. They were happy for us to park in the drop-off area for 15 minutes to load up. We'd have no hesitation in recommending the hotel to others, and would certainly stay there again. It's not really that cheap (we paid $200 a night at the start of June 2008), but no more expensive that anywhere else in the area, but we were happy with what we got.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in many ways!”
Reviews.Author: OpaqueEntity
Reviews.Content: An amazing place. The best hotel of my trip. Arrived at night at Pier 39 after being bussed from Amtrak across the Bay and being pointed in the right direction I took the short walk to the hotel. I'd worked out the right way in from using Google Streetview which helped me a huge amount in San Francisco but with all the hotels in the area it's not always obvious. Fast check-in, upstairs and right upstairs in the lift. Lovely big comfy bed, great bathroom, lockable 'safe' in the cupboard which was useful and free internet access which I made good use of. No view (out into an internal courtyard/gap between rooms) but unless you were on the top floor at the front I don't think you'd get a view. Ice and drinks machine round the corner, first one I'd seen where you needed your door key to get to it. Talking of keys I locked mine in my room one day and the front desk were very quick at replacing them for me. Fishermans Wharf is round the corner and there are lots of places to shop and eat. Walgreens is amazing and exceptionally useful being open so late when you desperately need after sun lotion from cycling around all day! So many attractions nearby in the wharf but also Pier 39 and it's seals and shops. Bit of a gap and a walk until you get to the Ferry Building which is the only 'issue' I had but the city has so much to offer. I was exceptionally happy with my stay, just wished I could have stayed longer. I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to Fault”
Reviews.Author: 20aloha08
Reviews.Content: Had a four night city break to San Francisco in late June 2008. First time in the city and chose this hotel after looking at reviews on this site. We were not disappointed and found a lot of positive features. The price was good, especially when including the buffet breakfast which was simple but allowed enough choice to set you up for the day. We had two rooms between five and they were both good sized, clean and reasonably furnished. While we didn't have many occasions to require help from the staff, when we did we found them friendly and helpful. The big plus for this hotel is definitely the location, just off Fisherman's Wharf, with lots of attractions within walking distance. There is a MUNI terminus just around the corner and two cable car lines end close to the hotel. There are also plenty of restaurants in the surrounding area. For anyone looking for an affordable, well located base to explore San Francisco, we strongly recommend considering staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Too few beds”
Reviews.Author: Cheesehead91
Reviews.Content: We booked 3 nights at the Holiday Inn Express San Francisco - Fisherman's Wharf through Hotwire. We booked the room for 2 adults and 2 children (age 11 and 14). When we arrived, we were told the room wasn't ready, but to go to lunch and come back in an hour or so. When we came back, we were given a room with one King sized bed for 4 people! They told us they could not give us 2 beds because they were oversold on those rooms. They also said that Hotwire didn't guarantee the number of beds in the room. I argued that Hotwire did guarantee a room that would sleep the number of people that the reservation is made for. They offered us a rollaway at no cost, but could not put a second rollaway in the room due to fire code. They suggested I call Hotwire and ask them to move us to a new hotel. Hotwire offered nothing to help us. The hotel told us to take it or leave it, since they knew we had prepaid the hotel stay at a fraction of the cost that they could book the room for. The hotel manager spoke to Hotwire on my cell phone, but never once came out to talk to us! We had to sleep 3 of us in the King sized bed! Buyer beware ... Hotwire is very vague as to the number of beds that are provided in a hotel. The hotel can do what they want. You are caught in the middle. I'm not sure I will book a hotel through Hotwire again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great position”
Reviews.Author: gogggsy
Reviews.Content: Our family (4) enjoyed a nice stay at the Holiday Inn Express, Fishermans Wharf. Room was a good size, the breakfast was a good start to the day. Staff were friendly and the hotel is in a great location. If you plan to go to Alcatraz then book before you get here as it is vey popular and can get booked up, we were very lucky and got on the tour the first day of our 3 day visit after that the tour was booked up for the rest of the time we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: Essexfamilyontour
Reviews.Content: I really liked the holiday inn express - the staff were very accomodating - the front desk staff in particular - the location and facilities very good. Breakfast was of a good standard and plentiful. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: 66AMS
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, initial room was very noisy, asked to move but were given two Queen beds rather than a King so had to ask to be moved again but a lack of rooms limited options. However, good overall stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good what i wanted at a reasonable room rate.”
Reviews.Author: singaporeflyer
Reviews.Content: This is a overdue review, since i was at the hotel back in Dec 2005. As a Priority Club member, i have stayed in several 5-stars Intercontinental, Crowne Plaza and 4-stars Holiday Inn during my business and leisure trips thoughout Asia. This hotel is the first HI-Express i am staying in (not many HI-Express franchises in Asia), but since i am on a vacation and paying my own hotel bills, i don't mind and had no expectations whatsoever. I booked on the basis of the photos posted on the hote's website. When i arrived, i was pleasantly surprised by the clean and well kept condition of the place. It looks new and very well maintained, from the lobby to the elevators and to the rooms. Requested for a Alcatraz facing room and request was met. Great ! The room is fairly alright for 2 persons, and very typical of the Holiday Inns i have stayed throughout Asia. The shower/toilet was cleaned. The room provides free wired internet and Playstation console. I guess the concept of HI-Express is minimal service and facilities. So that way, they keep cost down and room rates affordable. I paid about US$90 per night and i would say its a great deal considering the clean and well maintained room, the free self serve continental breakfast and the free internet. If what u need is a good room and safe hotel to sleep in, this is it. If you like to lounge around the hotel in the day, require a swimming pool. fitness centre or a bar in the evening, try the Hyatt across the road or Sheraton around the corner. My wife and I were there for a vacation, so we returned to the room past 10pm and out the next day by 10am. So we are happy with the price and quality. Good location too. The last stop of the tram is a short walk away, and so is the pier where u can see the crab stalls. The free train ride to Union Sq is also just round the corner, and getting to ferry terminal to Alcatraz is a 8 minutes pleasant walk. Lots of food options around, from burgers to cafes. I enjoyed my 3 nights stay there. Am thinking of returning in Dec 08 for a couple of nights, whilst on the way to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Calgary-visitor
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights after disembarking our Panama Canal cruise. This hotel was in a perfect location for sightseeing and only a 5 minute taxi ride from the cruise pier. We enjoyed walking to sight see at Pier 39, Lombard Street and Fishermans Wharf area. We had 3 rooms as were travelling with our extended family. The lobby was very large and contains the breakfast area. Breakfast was adequate and included. Our rooms were clean and quite large. We used the valet parking and had no problems.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for Fisherman's Wharf”
Reviews.Author: CaliTraveler020
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the HI-FW the weekend of August 8, 2008. We found the hotel to be a good choice for our trip. We were in the Main Building (the one with the front desk) at the corner of Levenworth and Bay. This location is located right in between Ghiardelli Square and Pier 39. About a 10 minute walk to either. We stayed on the business floor since we are Priority Club members. I was able to see both Alcatraz Island and the Golden Gate Bridge from my room, so that was cool. I believe it was room 565. There is a Walgreen's drug store one block from the hotel so that made stocking up on water and forgotten items easy and affordable. We did not rent a car and took taxi's or public transportation. The taxi from the airport (SFO) was $50 including a nice tip. A taxi to union square is $10 from the hotel. About $15 to the downtown financial district. We love the garlic crab at the Crab House on pier 39. We ate there twice. We went to a Giants game at AT&T Park. We shopped at Union Square and Chinatown. All were fun. The Holiday Inn has 2 buildings. The one with the Denny's is about 1 block East of the Main Building. Both are well located to all the stuff in the area. We go to SF every couple of years and the Holiday Inn was comparable to the other chain hotels in FW. Some are a little closer to Pier 39 if that matters to you (5 minute walk instead of 10.) I recommend the Holiday Inn if staying in the FW area.

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful experience in exhorbitantly priced budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: SeacatIreland
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for two nights through Expedia.com at a cost of $342.00 per night for what turned out to be a budget hotel. On arrival no assistance was available to help with the luggage and we had to look for a luggage trolley to bring our luggage to our room. Rooms were clean and adequate, if somewhat drab and location was good. However, the exorbitant price we paid for the room was not reflected in any way whatsoever in the room or service. It might be reasonable value at a third of the price we paid. Free internet (2 PCs provided) was supplied but was not working on our first night. As with most San Francisco hotels, car parking is expensive and at $44.00 per night, this hotel was no exception Breakfast was a complete fiasco on both mornings and we cannot understand how other reviewers spoke so favourably about it. People mobbed around the self-service breakfast area and had to use cardboard trays, plastic knives and forks as well as paper cups and plates. Food variety and standards were poor with service very bad and with a large number of guests milling around, the queue for food was very slow. There was nowhere to sit to eat breakfast with all tables used up, other guests using all lounge chairs in the foyer of the hotel whilst the remainder had no choice but to carry their breakfast to their rooms. Without any doubt this was the most astonishingly dreadful breakfast experience we have had in nearly 40 years of staying in hotels around the world. Our stay at this hotel was an unbelievable experience, an absolute disgrace at any price but at $342.00 per night it was appalling.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: RoadTripDuo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here during our cross-country trip (by car). The service was superb and location; the best. Literally, right around the corner from Fisherman's Wharf and the Pier. The cable car and Gharadelli Sq. are right there too. We couldn't have picked a better location. Not to mention- safe! This hotel is close to everything yet very quiet. The breakfast buffet (included in room rate) was way above average. It had everything you wanted. The room was very large (king bed) and clean. We would recommend this hotel in an instant.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: taffytoes
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in August and found it to be a great choice. The hotel was extremely clean and our room on 4th floor was very quiet. The breakfast was also very good and I was hesitant after reading some complaints about breakfast area and although we found it to be crowded , it was well stocked and a nice amenity. We had considered Comfort Inn at Van Ness and must say we definitely made the right choice. Very close to everything fun to do! Just 2 blocks from Fisherman's Wharf. I am very particular about where I stay and would not hesitate to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, good location”
Reviews.Author: Mike_in_CO
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our two teenage nieces and it was comfortable, reasonable and located well for tourists. Also, on-site parking was useful.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Holiday Inn Express Fishermans Wharf”
