Reviews.Author: Aussie1956
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at this hotel. It was very clean and we were provided with an excellent suite on the 4th Floor with views to Alcatraz. I do not like traffic noise and this hotel was very very quiet. Our room was all we expected. It had a coffee percolator and tea making facilities. We travelled with our 14 year old teenage son. The hotel is very close to all the attractions to Fishermans Wharf. The breakfast was adequate and we had no complaints. The buffet is not extensive, but if you are happy with cereal, yoghurt, fruit and pastries, omlettes or scrambled eggs- then you will enjoy the meal. Staff were always attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: catlovertina
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn express is a nice ,budget hotel . I stayed here for 4 nights with my family and not a problem . The staff could not have been more welcome ! Great location and just a short walk from pier 39 and stores.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Meere
Reviews.Content: We just spent 3 nights here and had a great experience. Two blocks from the Wharf excitement, but far enough from the noise to sleep at night. The rooms were clean, so were the hallways. Front desk staff was very helpful and we enjoyed the free breakfast in the morning. More than enough choices for parents with two teenagers. I was able to use the internet and we printed out our boarding passes for free. Valet parking is pricey, though.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: daisy61
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as a family of four. Nice big room, good bathroom and in a great location. Breakfast was good, wasn't too busy and staff were very friendly and helpful. Good value for money. Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price!”
Reviews.Author: antrimman
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights for $89 per night, booked through Hotwire. Great rate considering normal rate was $230 from the web site. Hotel was in a great location within easy walking distance of Fisherman's Wharf. Requested a quiet room and was assigned one at the end of the hotel, facing one of the small courtyards. Breakfast was great - ample food and wide variety. Very happy with the facilities, internet (included in cost) worked fine. In summary, I'd happily recommend this hotel if you get a deal but not at the normal room rate, as you could probably get a better class of hotel in the area for same or slightly more.

Reviews.Title: “Did The Job !”
Reviews.Author: Movingmike
Reviews.Content: Our first time in San Francisco, decided to stay in the Wharf area and from TA hotel reviews decided to stay at Holiday Inn Express. We stayed for 4 nights, the room was very clean and well supplied. The breakfast fare was very good and plentyful. It is well situated to use the public transport system either to the Wharf / Pier 39 / Ferry Buildings area or up to Union Square area. Did not have a car but noted valet parking @ $37 per night which appeared to be the norm for SF. The staff were very helpful. I would use this hotel again when returning to this area.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for the area”
Reviews.Author: KB08
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a trip to SF and stayed 3 nights at the HI Express FW. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The hotel was extremely clean, had a wonderful breakfast, the staff was nice and the location was perfect. We stayed at another hotel in SF for the first part of our week (wanted to stay in two different areas while we were in the city) and this one far exceeded the other hotel. The breakfast was especially helpful and saved us at least $20-$30/day. The staff was very friendly and helpful; even helped book our shuttle bus ride back to the airport. The location was perfect because it was one or two blocks from the main attractions; close enough to be very convenient yet not too close to all of the hustle and bustle. Overall, this was an excellent hotel and I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: richnc100
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just great. Breakfast had lots of hot choices, staff was nice, good location and price was good for the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Great Value for Families”
Reviews.Author: ksm1985
Reviews.Content: My family and I just completed a stay at this hotel and would highly recommend it for anyone looking for a good, clean hotel at a decent price. The location of this hotel was great - two blocks from Fisherman's Wharf and two blocks from the cable car line. The staff was very helpful. The iron in the room malfunctioned one morning when we were rushing to get to a tour and a security guard brought up a new iron since the housekeeping staff hadn't started yet. Also, our flight home wasn't until 12:30 a.m. and we stayed at the hotel until 9:30 p.m. and paid a day rate which was only 50% of the normal rate. This enabled us to continue to sightsee on our last day and then clean up and relax before going to the airport. The expanded continental breakfast is quick and easy and everyone was always able to find something they liked to start the day. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone traveling with a family on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: pilar007
Reviews.Content: We arrived early several hours before check-in time and were pleased that we were able to check right in. The hotel is in a very convenient location, easy walking to all the Fisherman's Wharf attractions. It's also very close to the several cable car stops and has a taxi waiting area right across the street. We had a fair sized king room on the fourth floor with a king sized bed. The room was clean and comfortable but with no view. The hectic complimentary buffet breakfasts were convenient but they were often slow replenishing items that were finished. Front desk service was friendly and helpful. Price could have been a little lower but overall a perfectly fine stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - room - service.”
Reviews.Author: BadCoKCMO
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights (June 12-15, 2008) in a King room on the 1st floor. There was no view, just a courtyard of windows - but that didn't matter, because we were sightseeing from morning til night and I was too tired to care when we were finished. If you need a nice hotel, in a great/safe location, with a clean room & free breakfast - look no further. We got a rate of $187 per night through the hotels website - and when you factor in the complimentary breakfast - that's a pretty good deal. There is plenty to eat - not just danish & coffee. They had hot cinnamon rolls, cold cereal, carton milk, eggs (scrambled or omelet depending on the day), bacon or sausage (depending on the day) biscuits and gravy (daily), and then breads, english muffins and bagels. If this doesn't work for you, there is a Denny's literally right around the corner - as well as a Walgreen in case you need pop/water, medicine, sunscreen, snacks, toothpaste, film developing, socks - or anything else you forgot or think you might need. The turnaround for the Powell-Mason is only 2 blocks from the hotel. You can pay $5 per way, per person. Or buy a 3-day unlimited ride pass for $18 per person. We chose this option which gave us no excuse to explore the city more. Overall a great hotel - no complaints! The rooms were big & clean. Had in-room safe, iron, ironing board, coffee, internet, movies, video games, etc. There are 2 computers for internet access just off the lobby that are available 24/7, at no cost. Great for printing boarding passes for the flight home, booking tours, researching restaurants and attractions - and checking your emails from home - as well as sending the standard "wish you were here" email to the folks back home.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, clean hotel with good service”
Reviews.Author: cw_squared
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights (June 10-14) in 2008. The room was ready upon arrival and was very clean. We called ahead to ask for a room along the north face of the hotel as this would give us a view out towards the bay. When we got there we were told they really didn't reserve rooms in spots just details like King bed or non-smoking. So our view was just another wall of the hotel. Other than that, the staff was extremely nice and I realize that everyone would want that view so I guess it's just the luck of the draw. The complimentary breakfast was pretty good. They had cinnamon rolls, bananas, bagels, various cereals, bread for toast, bacon or sausage (seemed to alternate), biscuits, gravy, milk and various juices. There may have been more but we can't remember. The food was good (not great). And the crowds were generally not too bad except for Saturday morning. The room wasn't large but it was fine for what we wanted. Just a place to relax between excursions around San Francisco. It was very clean and had a decent decor for a regular hotel. The staff was always friendly and willing to answer any questions we had. We considered it an excellent deal for the price we got off Hotwire as the location near Fisherman's Wharf was the best feature of the hotel. A quick walk to several attractions made our sightseeing easier. We didn't rent a car because so many forms of public transportation are within a couple of blocks from the hotel. The selection of television channels were pretty sparse but we didn't spend tons of time in the room aside from showering and sleeping so that didn't bother us too much. I would suggest trying to find a deal online if you can. We saw a guy walk in off the street and they were asking $239.00 for the one room they had.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CDMN
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel June 6-9, in King Bed standard room. Room was very clean and nicely decorated although not overly big (but who cares...your not going to SF to stay in your room!) Common areas were also very clean. Two computer stations near the front desk with printers available 24/7. Nice complimenary breakfast included (cheese omlettes or scrambled eggs, sausage or bacon, biscuits & gravy, yogurts, cereals, fresh cinnamon buns, toast, coffee and juices). Location was great. Close but not too close to Fisherman's Wharf. Two blocks from Powell & Hyde Cable Car stop (can buy 1, 3 and 7-day MUNI passes at booth at this location). Two blocks from F Line stop. Walgreens and Safeway also a few blocks - good for snacks, drinks, etc. for your room. Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. I converted my Air Miles into Priority Points for three nights free - nice!.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: bandit
Reviews.Content: Used my Priority Points for a two night stay. This is a nice Holiday Inn Express with a wonderful location. The first room we were given was on the 4th floor and was tiny, with no view. Called the front desk and asked for a room with some sort of view. The only available room with an outside view was on the smoking floor, but we decided to try it out. There was no "smoking" smell in the hallways and the room we chose had no smell of smoking at all. (Room 370). Very nice room with good views and the windows did open so we could get some fresh air! Yes, it was loud with the windows open, but with them closed, it was quiet. The beds were very comfortable, staff was friendly and accomodating and a great location! Breakfast was nice with both hot and cold items. Sure saves a lot of money! We did the Super Sightseeing Tours which is next door to the hotel. We did two tours (Muir Woods and City) as we only had one day to really get out and see the city. I am glad we did! Safe location - Cost Plus World Market right down the street, so we bought our wine and snacks there and enjoyed it in the room! I would definitelly recommend this hotel for a trip to San Francisco. Wish we would have had more time in the beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: eden2
Reviews.Content: Great location, 5 mins from harbour and 10 mins from Pier 39. Room was in Holiday Express building 2nd floor overlooking main road and trams. Didnt find it noisy at all. Room was clean, comfy, staff pleasant, breakfast fine, although the 1 evening meal there was disappointing. There is a large late night Walgreen supermarket across the street which had food, toiletries, drinks etc etc, plenty of eating places around. Highly recommend Boudins on the Wharf for breakfast, sourdough soup and ambience. Really recommend taking yr own hairdryer to Holiday Inns in the US, the ones supplied are weak and lethal!

Reviews.Title: “Does the job with great service”
Reviews.Author: Tedf
Reviews.Content: When I booked this hotel, one of the main considerations was proximity to Pier 35 as we were taking a cruise to Alaska. We settled on the Holiday Inn Express after trolling through the many reviews on the different hotels in the Fisherman's Wharf area, and I'm happy to say it fit the bill exactly. If you're looking for a hotel with lots of history and character, don't come here. However, if all you need is a comfortable bed, a quiet room, a safe location and friendly service it's perfect. Previous reviews had also mentioned asking for a room facing the courtyard to minimise noise - I included this when making my internet booking, and our wish was granted, with our room also being on the top floor. Our flight from Australia was scheduled to arrive around 10.30am, but a quick call to the hotel a couple of days before confirmed they had a luggage room if we needed to kill a couple of hours before check-in. Imagine our surprise and pleasure when, on arriving at the hotel around midday, we were given our room straight away. The hotel has a free business centre near reception, with two PCs with internet access, plus a printer. There's also a breakfast area on the ground floor, with a free continental breakfast included in the price. It's not exactly gourmet, and our first experience there was a little overwhelming as a large school group were staying - enough said! However, the Hollywood Cafe a couple of doors down did a great lunchtime BLT, so I'd imagine their breakfast was pretty good too. There's a pretty good sports bar/restaurant right across the street, plus there's also a Safeway and a Walgreens a block or so east on North Point. We found the staff unfailingly helpful and friendly, the bed was very comfortable, and the room EXTREMELY quiet. The hotel's just far enough away from the main action at Fisherman's Wharf to be quiet, but is just a five minute walk away.Once we checked out, Pier 35 was an easy walk of 5 blocks, towing our bags along. While this style of hotel may not be to everyone's taste, it does the job well.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in San Fran”
Reviews.Author: kristen412
Reviews.Content: We are members of Priority Club so we booked a reward night for one night. This hotel is modern & clean, and the staff was very friendly. Valet parking is $37 per night which is average for the area. The hotel is in a great location with walking distance to all major attractions. The complimentary breakfast was good too. We will stay here again for sure, its a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “well impressed”
Reviews.Author: tony_w_62
Reviews.Content: Me and my fiance stayed here in may 08 for four nights. I had read some reviews prior to our stay and I did have my doubts but we were very pleasantly surprised when we arrived. Of course bearing in mind this is only a 3 star hotel and you would not expect the ritz I can honestly say the staff could not have been nicer, they were very friendly and efficient, from the check in to the cleaning staff. The room was very clean and spacious, the breakfast was very nice too. we did"nt book this hotel the travel agency did that for us, but if and when we go back to San Francisco I will definately stay here again. Thanks to all at the Holiday Inn Express. Oh and its very well located too .

Reviews.Title: “excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: ontheroadagain567
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights, first impressions were of modern, clean hotel. Rooms were of good size, we asked for top floor room which had a bit of a view over the harbour and also turned out to be quiet as well. Comfortable beds, soft and firm pillows allowed good nights sleep, coffee maker, clean bathroom with all the necessary bits and pieces included. Cool bucket supplied and with ice maker and vending machine down the corridor, (mini fridge would be better suited.) Internet access downstairs with 2 computers to allow one to check e mail etc.( free service in the room.) Breakfast was choice of cereals, yoghurts, toast, pastry and choice of 3 hot plates, never any rush and plenty of food. Yes would be nice to have a bar or restaraunt in the hotel but really it is location here that is important, this hotel is minutes away from all the touristy areas with all sorts of eating establishments and with easy acces to public transport. We had a hire car which the valet allowed us to leave at the front door free of charge while we unloaded our cases and checked into the room , then we returned our car to local depot. No need for a hire car in SF, public transport is fun, easy and cheap while public parking is expensive. Shuttle bus to the door should take 30-40 mins and $12-15. Would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday inn Sanfrancisco”
Reviews.Author: FrannyAlbertaCanada
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights on the May long weekend they did give us the wrong room 1 bed instead of 2 but they did sort it out, rooms , and bathrooms were very clean A 2 block walk to the tram and the warf. No pool but the holiday innn Next door does have one you can use. There contental breakfast now has eggs and either a sausge round or bacon. I would defenetly go back. Staff were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, and MORE!”
Reviews.Author: Aviatorstarboy
Reviews.Content: This is a gem in the City by the Bay!!! Only a block from all the fun and excitement in San Francisco, 1.5 blocks from Fishermans wharf, and 1 block from the F trolley line. Even close to it all, you hear almost nothing, as the rooms are well insulated. We chose the mini suite, which had the kitchenette, and sofa extra, and had a large bathroom and entry way! Lots of closet space, and very comfortable beds! The breakfast was just amazing as other posters had indicated! It was changed daily with full hot options, cereals, beverages, and pastries. Excellent layout so you were not tripping over fellow guests, and a large area to enjoy your meal and plan your day! HIGHLY recommended !! Well done Holiday Inn Express!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Quite pricey though.”
Reviews.Author: Dizneylvr1971
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed here from May 3rd through May 6th. We had never been to San Francisco and wanted to be in the middle of Fisherman's Wharf, which it was. It was an easy walk there and was within easy walking distance of most of the public transporation options. We had a room on the third floor that overlooked the sports bar across the street. The room was clean and the bathroom quite large. When we first entered the room, we thought the windows were open judging by the noise level. Upon inspection, they were actually closed! Thankfully after it got dark, it seemed to get much quieter outside. I did not have any trouble sleeping. The room includes a breakfast, which was quite good. They had eggs (with or without cheese), bacon, biscuits, sausage gravy, toast, bagels and these wonderful cinnamon rolls. We were impressed by how much variety there was for a free breakfast. The room was very nice, the breakfast good, but we were not impressed with the price of $270 a night we paid. I would probably stay here again, if we could get a great rate.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel,great location”
Reviews.Author: muke07
Reviews.Content: we have recently stayed for a week at the holiday inn express sanfrancisco,and we really enjoyed our stay there.the rooms are very nice and we were lucky enough to have a view of alcatraz.we found that all of the staff were very friendly and helpful.the hotel is in a great location for pier 39 and other attractions,the cable car turn around is just a couple of blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay at Holiday Inn Express”
Reviews.Author: lucylocket57
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights at this hotel and had an enjoyable stay. Our room was on the 4th floor and just looked out onto a void courtyard but this meant that it was very quiet. The beds were very comfortable and had a choice of soft or hard pillows. The bathroom was a bit on the small side. The hotel is in a good position for Pier 39 at Fishermans Wharf and easy walking to lots of other attractions. The breakfasts were ok, but not a huge choice, we did have a problem one morning finding a free table to sit at. We arranged a taxi through the hotel back to the airport, the taxi arrived promptly and for 4 people cost just under $40.

Reviews.Title: “great family hotel”
Reviews.Author: israelifamily
Reviews.Content: Our Family of 5, stayed at the H.I.E. and was extremely pleased. As noted it is well located, has a great free breakfast, internet, and pleasant staff. The rooms are large and well kept. We ordered through hotwire for a 79$ rate- where its identified as "customer favorite". The place gets our families top recomendation.

Reviews.Title: “This was THE PERFECT HOTEL!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: M&D1970
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved this hotel! Stayed for four nights in room 483 and 485 (the fourth floor is the top floor so this is not a huge place). There was no view as you are sandwiched in between hotels and other buildings but we didn't come to sit in the room. We paid $62/night through hotwire.com on a rather last-minute trip and this was an extraordinary value for this normally $200+ night hotel. The hotel looks like it is brand new!! It is probably the cleanest, best maintained hotel we've stayed in and we've stayed in a lot, including upscale five star establishments! The furniture, furnishings, linens, beds ... everything ... top notch and in perfect working and very comfortable condition. The staff, including the maids, are all very friendly and helpful. The new hot breakfast is very good and saves a ton of $ on breakfast every morning. The only complaint - well, a couple complaints, is it isn't very hot. The hot items are lukewarm at best and the variety is the same every day. Some pancakes or waffles would be a nice touch as not everyone enjoys biscuits and gravy (a daily offering). The other complaint that really doesn't have as much to do with the hotel is the other guests - every morning we had pushy, rude people crowding in trying to cut in line, like a bunch of pigs waiting for food at the trough. The thing the hotel could do to mitigate this is re-think the way the breakfast is set up. Logistically it could be set up in a better way to avoid people crowding in. It is fantastic that they provide a hot breakfast, it is good and the gentlemen manning the breakfast ensure there is never anything empty, they do a very nice job. A nice touch are the two free computers they provide in the lobby for internet use. They are even hooked up to printers which was great to be able to print out city maps etc. They do get busy though and the waiting line can be long. The hotel location is perfect and so close to everything you'd want to do. We didn't have a car to worry about the exorbanant parking charges; we took the 'Go Lorries' airport shuttle both to/from the airport which worked out wonderfully. We walked everywhere or used the 3-day MUNI passes we purchased for $18 to ride the cable cars, streetcars and bus system all over SF. The passes were well worth the money. We would stay at this hotel again in a heartbeat and we were sorry to leave!

Reviews.Title: “beware of expensive valet parking”
Reviews.Author: popeadventure
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights as part of our Virgin Golden Triangle tour and it was by far the nicest hotel.Rooms very comfortable and modern,good beds, towels and bedding changed daily if you wished. Good central location but we found Fishermans Wharf dirty, full of tramps and over-rated! Free breakfast is great. The only downside of this hotel is the VERY EXPENSIVE parking fee of $42 a night. We have never had to pay to park our car in a hotel we are guests in and found it a totally unreasonable charge. After our first night we found that we could park on the road on a meter from 7pm to 7am for free outside the front of the hotel and then moved the car into a $10 car park for the day. We later found that further along North Point there is free road parking day and night in some parts so its worth looking for, but be carefull to check the road signs each time you park as the roads are cleaned between 2am and 6am on alternate days of the week. We visited the Golden Gate Bridge\park, the Presidio, Muir Woods and Sausalito and they were all great, if you have a car drive up and down all the steep roads, great fun! Go up to Twin Peaks for views to die for of the whole of San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: dani861
Reviews.Content: We booked through hotwire and got a great deal at $69/night + tax. Great location right near all the action of Fisherman's Wharf and public transit. Rooms and hotel new and modern. Great extended breakfast. I would highly recommend if you are going to stay in the area!

Reviews.Title: “Good choice near the Wharf”
Reviews.Author: famlyplanner
Reviews.Content: This H I Express is the nicest we've stayed in by far. We were pleased with the solid construction - never heard neighbor noise or traffic noise (we had courtyard rooms.) The breakfast bar was fully stocked for a large crowd and they kept it full for the entire morning. The room was updated and stocked with all the right things, the beds were comfortable and the fiber-filled pillow selection was great. We only had 2 complaints: 1) no wireless in the rooms. They do have connections in the rooms, but it doesn't work easily for Mac users. The staff was very attentive in trying to help us make it work, but in the end, we just used 1 of the 2 computers near the lobby that they keep open for guest use, which is very helpful. 2) despite a reservation for 2 adjacent rooms made 6 months ago, the only thing they had available were two 1st floor streetside rooms (they admitted the rooms were noisy.). But they accommodated by putting us on the quieter 3rd floor. Though the rooms were far apart, they didn't question us when we had our teens stay alone in the 2nd room. (Many hotels have a problem with that.) The hotel is near some great restaurants (Joe's Crab Shack - great family friendly menu and view over fun goings on in the wharfside street) and Boudin (very good chowder - recommend the outdoor eatery - less hectic.) It's an easy walk to Ghiradelli & Cannery Row and a pleasant, do-able walk to Pier 39. Transportation advice: The hotel is near the 2 starting point terminals for cable cars, but if you go after 10 am, you're looking at a half hour wait (an hour on weekends.) However the historic street car (the F line) that travels down Embacadero isn't too crowded except during the 4:30 - 6pm rush hour. And that's only $1.50 per trip. That line can take you to the Ferry Building area, or to Union Square. From there you could walk up to ChinaTown. We wasted our money on the 3 day $18 municipal pass. The cable cars were too crowded to make use of, so we used the buses or the streetcars, which are significantly cheaper. Our family's favorite things - Alacatraz (get tix a day in advance or order from alcatrazcruises.com online), a Giants game and Pier 39 (sea lions, shops and Hard Rock Cafe). Due to the cold weather, we didn't rent bikes and ride through G G park or across the bridge. Next time . . .

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Holiday Inn Express - beat all expectations”
Reviews.Author: blondelinda
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 2 adults and 2 teenage children We had been traveloling the US for 3 weeks until we hit San fran I booked this hotel direct with hotel, based on reviews on this site I was not disapointed in any way and more than pleasantly surprised The hotel is only 5 years old, very modern with all new amenities Free cooked breakfast free internet in room (if you have laptop) or pc's in lobby free too Best of all....LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION The locations was superb, right on Fishermans Wharf, next block to cable cars and all the restuarants. You just cant beat this place, specially for the $$$$$ paid I would definatly return hear, and think this hotel is in a much better location than some of the more upmarket and expensive ones

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay, but Watch the Parking Charge”
Reviews.Author: dwwilburn
Reviews.Content: Nice stay. The room was plenty large for the 4 of us. Breakfast was really good. However, they don't have wireless connections in the room, so I had to go down to the Lobby. Then, I never could connect to their system and ended up connecting to the Hyatt's. Weird. Also, watch out for the parking charge. It is a big $37 bucks. Looking around, the Marriott parking charge was $22 bucks.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE!!! - Modern, clean, large size rooms, Free Full Breakfast +Internet”
Reviews.Author: LisainAZ
Reviews.Content: Holiday Inn Express - Fishermans Wharf was a great value. I would highly recommend it. I stayed 2 nights at this hotel March 7 - 9th 2008 and the staff were very friendly, the FREE breakfast was more than I expected (biscuits+gravy, eggs, bacon, sausage, juice, bagels, cereal, pancakes), and the rooms were clean with granite countertops and a wet bar, mini fridge, and comfy beds. The last night of my stay in San Francisco I stayed in the Sheraton Fishermans Wharf which was a nice hotel but I would much rather stay at the Holiday Inn Express next visit as its breakfast are FREE and the internet was FREE plus there was a big difference in price...I saved lots of money at the Holiday Inn Express. The hotel is new and very modern, perfect for families, couples, or even the business traveler. The location is perfect as you can easily walk to everything..the cable cars, buses, and all the attractions. My suggestion is to purchase a "Go San Francisco Card" you pay one price about $75.00 for 3 days and it includes all the tourist attractions you can visit...museums, Palace of Fine Arts, Exploritorium, Aquarium, Wine Tours, Alcatraz, Boat Cruises, Cable Car Rides, bike rentals..and much more. Great upbeat attitude when I called the front desk and a pleasant experience checking out. I travel 3 weeks out of a month for Business and It was a home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: JEKOhio
Reviews.Content: I chose the Holiday Inn Express Fisherman's Wharf primarily for location and because I was using Priority Club Points. I was not really expecting much. But I was so pleasantly surprised by this hotel. The location is indeed great. It is (obviously) near Fisherman's Wharf, but it is also near both Cable Car lines and Ghiardelli Square. It is near Golden Gate Park and plenty of shopping and restaurants. Check-in was pleasant and easy. However, they only offer valet parking, which is vey, VERY expensive. But San Francisco is an expensive city. There are probably cheaper options nearby. The hotel is very well maintained and the art deco, cruise ship theme works well. Our room was fine. Spacious enough and clean. We were in a corner room, with a bay window which actually looked out at The Bay. There was only an ON/OFF switch for the air-conditioning/heat. No other controls. And we had to search for that, as it was hidden in the closet. Very odd. The weather was cool, so we kept our windows open at night. There is a free breakfast buffet every morning, with plenty to offer and lots of space to sit. This is a well run, nice, clean friendly place to stay. Go for it.

Reviews.Title: “Great!!”
Reviews.Author: freddyheather
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very clean, centrally located, staff was friendly and helpful and the room/bed was comfortable. We were not disturbed by noise at night, the breakfast was diverse and plentiful, everything was great. The location is unbeatable - you can easily walk to the Fisherman's Wharf area (Pier 39) or if you decide to see a more cultural/non-touristy side of San Fran, you can simply walk inland instead. I recommend renting a Go Car on Hyde - that is a blast. It was sort-of cold when we were there, but it was still a great trip. Holiday Inn Express was perfect as usual.

Reviews.Title: “Hotwire Customer Favorite”
Reviews.Author: Aphishionado
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a great value hotel near fisherman's wharf - look no further. beds are comfy. breakfast is incredible. only down side is parking - its $37 for the hotel parking. there is street parking which is free from 7-7 = after that its 3.00$ an hour 25 cents every 6 minutes! which would be a pain if you had to sleep in. would stay there again. i booked thru hotwire - it is listed as a 2 1/2 star hotel with the thumbs up for customer favorite -

Reviews.Title: “An absolute gem”
Reviews.Author: Kai-17
Reviews.Content: The first thing i have to say is that this is probably the best hotel we have ever stayed at - for many reasons. First the location is fabulous, you are a very short walk from Fishermans Wharf and Pier 39. You are also close to the cable car stop. There are several great restuarants in the area, our favourites being Bubba Gumps and The Rainforest Cafe - both fun places, with good food and service. Our room was a good size, well equipped, comfortable and quiet. We had no view at all, we over looked other rooms, but who goes to San Francisco to stay in their room. The bed was amazingly comfortable - if only we could have sneaked it home in our cases. the free breakfast was wonderful. especially considering it was free. There was plenty of room to sit, plenty of food, and it was replenished through the morning (during the set hours) There were plenty of healthy options available too. It certainly set us up for the day, and nobody seemed to mind us taking fruit with us (for a mid-morning power snack!) . The staff were polite, helpful and willing to help when we needed assistance. Having free internet access in the lobby was great, there are two computers and at times we had to wait to use them , but if we popped back to the hotel mid-afternoon (to drop off shopping!) they were usually available. The hotel is clean, and nicely decorated and has a welcoming feel to it. Like other people who wrote reviews, we were on the first floor and had to use the lift as the stairs were all marked as fire exits. But this is such a small thing to mention, and lets face it you're going to get plenty of exercise walking up and down those hills - you'll probably be glad of the lifts. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone. We plan to return to San Francisco in a couple of years, and will certainly be stopping here again.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise! Better than expected! But beware the grouchy valet”
Reviews.Author: lim288
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel rather late on Saturday night (830pm). We pulled up into the driveway where the parking valet is stationed. My husband got out of the car and asked him if they had a self-parking garage. The valet had an attitude. He said, "No, valet only. Is that something you want?" I wanted to say, actually, from you, no...but what other choices do we have in Fishermans Wharf ?? The valet stood by and watched us as we unloaded the luggage. He didn't even offer to help...not that we expected him to. As he wrote up the valet claim ticket, he said, "You're checking into the Holiday Inn Express, right? Not the Holiday Inn? Because that's next door..." Frankly, he acted bored, like he wanted to be somewhere else. Too bad he's the 1st person the hotel guests meet. Thankfully, checking in changed our 1st impression! Our reservation was for a 2-Queen beds, non-smoking room. The very nice, courteous, front desk clerk upgraded us to their version of a "suite" (wet bar sink, microwave, small fridge, sofa) at no extra charge! I don't know if it was because we arrived so late, but what a pleasant surprise! (A regular 2-queen bed room at the Hyatt is about $35 more) The hotel decor is Art Deco. The room was very clean, very comfortable. We had one of the suites facing Northpoint St, across from the Hyatt. Surprisingly, it wasn't as noisy as we anticipated because there was very little traffic in the area. The breakfast buffet is included. Not bad (meaning, we've had worse). There were cinnamon rolls, scrambled eggs (looked like Egg Beaters), sausages, biscuits and gravy. There was a good assortment of cereals, bread (toaster!) and muffins. There were all kinds of beverages (low & fat-free milk, juices, coffee, tea) but strangely, no ice. We ate at the height of the breakfast hour (8am), so finding a table was a challenge. Overall, I'd say we would stay at the Holiday Inn Express- Fishermans Wharf again. The location is great!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Bubba&MaryJo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is, as itâ€™s name suggests, ideally located for Fishermanâ€™s Wharf, being just a couple of blocks away. Also well within walking distance are the shops and restaurants of Pier 39, the Alcatraz tours departing from Pier 31 and the cablecar turnaround at Hyde. Around the corner there are many tourist shops selling everything a tourist could hope to buy. We also rented bikes for a day from a store here. The hotel is a fairly modern block, although the outside looks very Art Deco, and the room we had was reasonably spacious, clean and well decorated. A king size bed, TV, table and chair are in the main area. The bathroom has a bath, with shower, toilet, sink and hairdryer. A coffee pot is also provided. If itâ€™s important to you, make sure you request a room with an outside view as our room looked out onto an internal blank space although we had a view of the sky to see the weather (rooms with an outside view wonâ€™t have much of a view anyway just onto the road). Our room was located on the 1st floor (2nd to North American readers) and, annoyingly, the only stairways we could find were all marked as being emergency exits only. Accordingly we had to use the rather slow lifts to travel up and down one floor! A continental breakfast was included in our booking - cereal, toast, coffee, juice, fruit and pastries were all available. If you prefer something cooked, we understand you can obtain a voucher at reception, which can be put towards the cost of breakfast in the Dennyâ€™s attached to the Holiday Inn next door. Thereâ€™s no bar in the hotel (that we could find) if you fancy a night cap but there is a sports bar directly across the street. There is a small gym and free internet access on the ground floor. Although we didnâ€™t require it, parking is available at the hotel but weâ€™d recommend checking the cost first as it struck us as being ludicrously expensive (although perhaps not for San Francisco - we donâ€™t know). Check-in and check-out where quick and efficient and the airport shuttle organised for us by reception turned up on time to take us back to SFO. ($14 each one way) Although the surrounding streets have many hotel options in competition, the HI Express was quite busy which probably says a lot for itâ€™s great value and location. We certainly would have no hesitation in returning here and indeed, plan to do so later in the year. An excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean and good value”
Reviews.Author: alikay61
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a large room with 2 queen beds and kitchenette. Very comfortable beds and room was spotlessly clean and nicely decorated. Location was great for using public transport and had shops and fast food/family type eateries nearby. Breakfast was complimentary and had a good selection of items available. 2 computers available for guests in small area off the reception and free wireless internet in rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Greatly Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Foreigner_in_London
Reviews.Content: I really didn't have high expectations at all of staying at a Holiday Inn, but I was pleasantly surprised. This hotel is really nice. It's clean, has new decorations, a nice little gym, lovely smelling toiletries, really friendly staff, and a good breakfast (that's included in the price). One really cannot ask for more. It's also in a fantastic location, near the seafront, which beats Union Square any day, as there are few bums loitering, unlike around all the Union Square hotels. There is no room service, but I think internet connection is free. The parking, as pretty much everywhere else in SF, is rather expensive. It's a relaxed hotel, and I felt far more comfortable staying at the Holiday Inn Express than I did at the Fairmont to be honest, and it's cleaner than the Fairmont too. It's by no means a luxury hotel, but it's definitely above average, and I would very happily go back there to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: LisaB-Texas
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly, the beds were extremely comfortable and the location is outstanding. Everything seemed very clean. Two thumbs up from me!

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn Express is a great deal”
Reviews.Author: gardengirly
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 just spent a night at the Holiday Inn Express, and were pleasantly surprised with the great location and comfort of the room. We had a family suite on the second floor. It was VERY large, with a living room, small kitchenette and a huge bathroom. It was nicely decorated, with a marble sink, and nice furniture. It was everything we needed to hang out after a long day of traipsing around the city. My husband & I could read in the living room while the kids watched TV on the beds. The free continental breakfast was perfectly adequate, with a variety of pastries, cereal & fruit. And the location is great - just a few blocks from Fisherman's Wharf, Ghirardelli Square & the cable cars. We had to book at the last minute, without shopping around much, but we thought it was a bargain for $225, and I'm sure with some shopping around, you could get a better price on Expedia or Priceline. If we were to come back to SF and had a week, this is definitely where we would stay - it has everything.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: BCape
Reviews.Content: I'm just wrapping up a stay in San Fran's Holiday Inn Express in Fisherman's Wharf. Overall I would rate this experience as above average. The entire 4 days we were in the city it rained/downpoured, but we were entertained none the less. The hotel was nice and clean with the staff always around. Our room was on the second floor, but we hardly ever heard the road and we're pretty light sleepers. They serve a continental breakfast in the morning which is nothing extravagant but a nice little meal before you start your day. The have internet in the rooms and two computers for community use down in the lobby. The computers are pretty old though and there is always people waiting so I'd bring your own if you are going to email often. Parking is pricy, but seeing as how we were on business work paid...$37 a night. Try "Mood- Thai foor and Sushi" on Beach St. one block away. Yellow curry and pineapple fried rice were oh so good and pretty inexpensive. If weather permits I reccomend a hike in Muir Woods, over Golden Gate to Pirates Cove... Eat at Dipseas for lunch. Overall you can't beat this hotel's location. It's right on fisherman's wharf and is a bargain price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: RaddogUK
Reviews.Content: Stopped here over New Years and did some sight seeing. The location of this hotel is amazing and all the other major brand hotels are clustered around. Right next to streetcars, cable car and the wharves. Walking distance to bars and restaurants. The hotel is in the same building as the Holiday Inn. The room we had was small compared to others in the hotel but clean and well maintained. The front desk were helpful although it was always busy and we often had to stand in line before we could speak to somebody. Great free breakfast, but that is the only food or beverage service available inside the hotel. Valet parking at $35 per day with unlimited access and ability to enter or leave the park. A great place to stay and cheaper than the surrounding hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: gk_terato
Reviews.Content: My family and I booked this hotel for the last day of our vacation before we returned to Vancouver. I saw the reviews online but I did not expect the hotel to be this nice. We paid ~210 for 1king and sofa bed for a stay on New Years Day Dec31 07. We were going to stay at Best Western near SFO but ended up here because of its great location near the Wharf. It's only a ~5minute walk there! The staff were all courteous and polite. The rooms look pretty new and everything seems to be in shape, no leaky faucets, squeeky bath tubs, busted light bulbs..etc. My only complaint in the pricey $39 parking, which isnt even valet. But I guess thats the market price around this area of the city anyway. The security in this hotel seems to be pretty good. There were people watching over the parkade and room keys are needed to access the hotel guest rooms. I will definately stay here again in the future if we come back to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: richbuck
Reviews.Content: My wife loves SF, so when her 50th birthday rolled around, that's where she wanted to go. I got a very good deal on Hotwire for two nights. The rooms are standard fare, very clean, large bathroom, firm, queen beds. A closet safe, TV, table and chairs, coffee maker, thick towels, internet access, hair dryer and all the stuff that we have come to expect in most of the better hotels enhances our stay. We're off and running. Two easy blocks, slightly downhill to the Fisherman's Wharf. Strolling, observing, stopping for snacks. I even got pulled into a street performance. They needed a slightly overweight, big guy, to pick up the girl and stand on the performers chest as he laid in broken glass. My daughter was slightly embarrassed by the whole thing but my wife was cracking up. We ate well, spent a little more than normal in the tourist trap, but for the most part it was very good... My wife is partial to fish and crab.. and the wharf is a good place to find it The next day, after the continental breakfast, (which we all loved and felt was quite complete and generous) we decided to take the bus to the Union Square for shopping. $1.50 a head, with free transfer. We rode thru the Chinese area on the way. Many older ladies got on with their shopping bags and gossiped at breakneck speed. As we passed, I noticed the stores selling food were jammed. I felt transported to a crowded Asia. I quietly commented to my Asian wife that she will look right at home on this bus in a few years chatting with all the old ladies.. That comment was overheard by the lady sitting across from us who laughed out loud upon hearing it. We chatted with her and had some laughs. We had fun shopping in the stores. Macy's has 7 floors on each side of the street, 7 for men, 7 for women. That was pretty cool.. I bought my wife a nice gift. A reasonable $10 fare to take us taxi back to the hotel.. We rested, then strolled some more, all jacketed and ready for the cold San Francisco nights. We slept well that night and came home safely. The hotel served it's purpose more than adequately. The location, the full continental breakfast, and the cleanliness of the room stand out in my mind. The beds were sturdy and comfortable.. The staff was friendly and helpful. The only negative is those damn parking fees in SF, $35 a night plus tax. We could have saved about 7-10 dollars a night by parking off site and walking but it wasn't really worth it to me. But the Hotwire mostly deal offset it.. I know now that Holiday Inn Express can deliver comfort and convenience to the traveler and tourist. Without equivocation, I can tell you it's as good or better than the 4 star hotels we've visited.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: Lvv2trvl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as last resort using points and I was impressed. Like others mention, it is in a good location. We walked to fisherman's wharf for dinner at Alioto's (highly recommend). The room was clean, nicely furnished, and the concierge was helpful when helping to find a restaurant for dinner. The breakfast brunch was good, although a little pricey, The overall service was good. I have tried to avoid Holiday Inns until staying at this property...it definitely exceeded my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price paid”
Reviews.Author: zhusky
Reviews.Content: After reading other reviews of this hotel I thought that it would be the best bet for our family-weekend in San Francisco. Seemed to have a good location, competitive price, and is fairly new. I found the best deal by pre-paying directly on the hotel website and even chose a mini-suite as it would be myself, my wife, and my two young boys so I wanted a little extra room. So, check-in went fine and the valet parking was great. $35 + tax per day with in/out priviliges. The hotel is decorated well and is very clean. The hallways are very wide and, overall, the 'feel' is very appealing. Once we found our room (4th floor overlooking the wharf) I was a bit disappointed. The mini-suite means that there is a fold-out couch sitting in the window area and an area is setup with sink, mini-fridge, microwave. I do admit that the kitchenette area was good to have, but the room itself was not much larger than a normal room. I was expecting a bit more I guess - oh well. Once we unpacked I noticed that the walls were VERY thin. I could hear the TV from the room next to us, water running from what seemed to be every bathroom, and the noise from people in the hall was overwhelming. This was a huge turn-off for us. I realize that you get noise when you are in a hotel but this was a bit extreme. The next morning we went down for the Continental Breakfast. This is definitely nice to have, although the quality of the food was not that great. You cannot expect too much for a Continental Breakfast so take these comments as just that, comments. Check-out went smoothly, we were able to extend our check-out until 2pm, which was good as we were tired and didn't need to leave for the airport until 2:00. All-in-all, this is a Holiday Inn - which seems, to me, to have gone downhill in recent years. You can get rooms at very similar prices at almost any hotel on the wharf if you look around.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for families”
Reviews.Author: AdelaideSurfnsun
Reviews.Content: Could find nothing wrong with this hotel. Room size was good with 2 x queen size beds for 4 of us (2 adults and 2 children). Bathroom was excellent. Also very quiet considering our room was at street level. Internet access via 2 computers near the lobby. Continental breakfast was adequate. Plenty of shops and restaurants nearby, including those at Fisherman's Whart. Starbucks just around the corner. Safe and easy to get around at night. Would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to anyone. Definitely on our list of places to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “We liked it!!”
Reviews.Author: quiltlover
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The staff at the reception desk was friendly and helpful. We got maps and informations about SF when we checked in. No problem with our luggage to store as we were there before check-in-time (3 p.m.). Our room was nice and clean and size was o.k.,too. We did not have a view but who needs a view in SF when in town all day long... Wi-Fi was free. We liked the free beakfast. Plenty to choose from. The location was just perfect: minutes from Fishermans Wharf, close to cable car stop, a Trader Joes was around the corner (we loved it!) plenty of restaurants and shopping possibilities. There is a pool at the HI next door which can be used from guests of the HI express, too. We were glad the we stayed st the Wharf. Yes, it is a tourist area, but arenÂ´t we tourists?

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & hotel”
Reviews.Author: AmberNewZealand
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Express for 3 nights and was very impressed. The room was a good size and was very clean and tidy. Excellent breakfast - my boys loved the doughnuts & pastries on offer. Excellent location and only a short walk to Fishermans Wharf and Pier 39. Great area for kids and felt safe walking around at night. We enjoyed our stay in San Francisco and would have liked to have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “just ideal”
Reviews.Author: LincsHobnob
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for just 2 nights but would have been happy to spend a week.If this hotel was in London it would getat least 4 stars.The rooms are absolutely spotless,bathrooms are large with really great showers and loads of lovely fluffy towels.The complimentary breakfasts are fine,excellent doughnuts of real american proportions! Staff were very helpful,I had a problem getting hold of our car hire firm so the receptionist did it for me with a smile. The hotel is an easy walk to Fishermans Wharf and to the tour bus stop.This hotel is ideal as an introduction to both San Francisco and to America,no standing on ceremony,relaxed and above all courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for the San Fran tourist!”
Reviews.Author: hlbetzy
Reviews.Content: This a a great base for a San Fran vacation. We stayed here for one nite before transferring across the street to the Hyatt for a conference. We preferred this hotel, hands down! Staff was warm and accomodating. Rooms were well-sized and comfortable. As a Priority Club member we were upgraded to a "suite" with a microwave and refridgerator. Rooms were very clean with comfortable beds. Our check out was delayed for 10 minutes and were offered a free movie for the inconvenience (without asking..) Cable car stop is steps from the hotel, as well as Fisherman's wharf, Pier 39, Giardelli Square and sweeping views of the Bay, Golden Gate Bridge and Alcatraz. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, good tourist location”
Reviews.Author: doconner
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through Hotwire because it was the best deal we could get for our trip. The location is great for first time tourists to SF because it is close to Fisherman's Wharf, a Trolley Car, and a short walk up Columbus to 'Little Italy' and Chinatown. Lombard Street and Coit Tower are also within walking distance. The hotel itself is clean and the beds were comfortable. They were not able to offer us rooms with 2 beds, so gave us rooms with King beds and offered up a roll-away bed for free. The Free breakfast included a few cereals, toast, donuts, fruits, cinnamon rolls and muffins. Coffee, juice, and milk were also available. Free internet access in the lobby Easy, although long, trip from the airport: - Take the BART ($5.15 - 30 minute ride) from airport to Embarcadero/Market Street - Go to street level and catch the Muni #10 ($1.50 - 10 minutes) bus towards Vanness/North Point. - Exit at North St & Jones St

Reviews.Title: “Comfy Room”
Reviews.Author: NatDublin
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 4 nights as part of my California coast trip. Hotel itself is nice, rooms big and comfortable. Continental breakfast served from 6.30 to 9.30 its a cold buffet with tea.coffee, juices and cereal toast , pastries etc... i thought it was good. The location is in fisherman wharf which is the touristy spot, it was very handy for us as we went to see Alcatraz and the Golden Gate bridge. Plus you can go downtown in 10 minutes. I really liked it but i think i d rather go into downtown next time i visit for a better choice of bars and restaurants. But apart from the location i really enjoyed my stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Worth it!”
Reviews.Author: KiwiinEssex
Reviews.Content: Overall, very good and we would stay again. Good points - rooms, cleaning, continental breakfasts, location, swimming pool (in Holiday Inn next door) and reception. Poor points - lifts (slow) and coffee facilities in room. Why a coffee percolator and in the en suite?! Only enough coffee/milk/sugar for one maybe 2 cups. Overcome by 'borrowing' tea bags, milk and sugar from breakfast. Why not get the coffee in rooms right? No homeless seen in area. Excellent location for Fishermans and transport to other parts of city. Overall, very happy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Samslik
Reviews.Content: They say location is everything. In the case of the H.I Express at Fisherman's Wharf this is very true. My wife and I just returned from a four night stay there. Everything is within a short walking distance. The Wharf is a block away, the cable cars are another block away, the famous F line is also a block away. Our room was facing the street but we had no problem with noise. The staff was very nice and helpful, even in giving directions. If there was a down side, I would have to say, the room is bit on the small side and pricey. However, it is adaquate and clean. We would definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: million196
Reviews.Content: I love the location for this hotel in San Francisco. You do not need to rent a car because you have all the transportation around you needed at all times of the day and night. We also took numerous tours which picked us up in front of the hotel. If you decide to rent a car the rate per night at the hotel w/tax is approx. $42.00. The Holiday Inn Express is very clean and unusually large and soundproof. The beds should be upgraded because they have seen many years of abuse. We used our points and did not have to pay anything and were put in a mini suite which included a fridge and microwave. The view was of the Wharf from our room but being we were on the run the entire week it was a pleasure to come back and leave from that location. The breakfast could be better and maybe more of it being you have a lot of people from other countries who took advantage of filling bags for dessert - I blame this on all of San Francisco who charge ridiculous prices for all food especially breakfast. I was told Denny's around the corner charged for 3 people an average of $72.00. New York is much cheaper than this City. Also, the homeless are out of control every place you walk in the best of areas they are begging, trying to touch you and sleeping in the streets. In fact they are out of control and make it very uncomfortable because no police and very little security around. They are even outside of the hotels but I felt fine because I had my husband and 15 year old son with me. If I was alone it would not be enjoyable. When you stand on the line for the Trolley Cars they are grabbing on to you and begging. Every park, every landmark, every place there are tons and tons of them even sleeping on the Trolly's before they roll out in the AM. I was interested in taking one of the Trolley's and stepped on the bus because I thought one of them worked for the transit and almost got cornered by 4 of them until my husband came behind me. This City is NOT SAFE for single women. I think they need to stop protecting them and clean up San Francisco because it is a beautiful place to visit. Everyone we met felt the same way in fact one women from England went to the baseball Giant Game the same night we attended and 3 of these homeless men sat next to them and every time they moved the homeless followed them until one fell and split open his chin and was bleeding but refused help and paramedics left the scene. I called them bums and almost got my head chopped off by many of the tour guides that we took trips with. One place we stopped to take a picture I walked with my son ahead of my husband and he felt someone right behind him when he picked up the bag that we were carrying and thought it was me but instead had a homeless right in his face. If people would stop visiting they would have no choice but to do something about it.

Reviews.Title: “Did the job nicely!”
Reviews.Author: sheamy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of a two day stay in San Fran and have to say it was perfect for what we were after, Close to Fisherman's wharf & Pier 39, the vintage tram (a must!) which takes you to the shopping haven that is union square, and also close to the alcatraz ferry (one of the highlights of our 2 week stay in the US!). The hotel itself was well presented & felt modern. Apart from the poor view from our room, I was pleased with it overall, the free wireless was a bonus and the complementary continental breakfast hit the spot. All in all I would definitley recommend this hotel for a short stay in San Fran.

Reviews.Title: “Wow....made our trip special.....”
Reviews.Author: Donna1001
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent. The staff including Brandy who checked us in the hotel, made sure everything was correct and special. We had a great view of the ocean..alcatraz and even the top of the golden gate bridge. Our room was extremely neat and clean each and everyday. The bed made, carpet cleaned, bathroom sparkling. The breakfast was a wonderful way to start the day of sight seeing. It was always busy and always well stocked. Internet access throught their computers was fast and we were even able to print directions. Checking out was a breeze. We stayed nine nights and we can't wait to stay again!!!! Bob and Donna...Tn fans in the land of the golden hotel

Reviews.Title: “Steps to Wharf”
Reviews.Author: another_mother
Reviews.Content: One night stop over only. First timers for 4 of our party of 6. Steps from the Wharf and all the night life you need. Great food vendors and shopping along walk to Pier 39. Clean rooms. Courteous front desk workers. Valet parkers excellent, with no wait in the a.m. when leaving! No views except to other rooms, but we hardly spent any time in our room except to sleep. AC worked well, as it was HOT when we were there. Shower water pressure was okay. Continental breakfast was great, with oatmeal, coffee/tea/hot chocolate/juice, toast, danish, cereals, muffins, apples & oranges. Quick check out available. Would stay here again, and recommend to others. No pool was disappointing!

Reviews.Title: “Good location.”
Reviews.Author: Parklandmom
Reviews.Content: Loved - Location and cleaniness of room. Free breakfast. Improvement needed - Closet door was broken. Shower wall was cracked and "fixed" with tape. Was not able to check in until 1 1/2 hours AFTER check in time. Room was not ready.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect For A Short Stay - Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: LONGHURSTFAMILY
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Express with Virgin Holidays. It was only a three night stay so for this reason the hotel was fine. The room was large and the beds confortable. We stayed in one room with our 2 children and had ample space. It is in a fantastic location for getting around San Francisco. The bed linen was clean and a maid service was supplied every day. We did not have the included continental breakfast as we chose to eat at the Denny's around the corner. We had a lot of help from the desk staff who advised us about how to get around and the best plass to visit and how to get there. Just a suggestion you must visit Alcatras and book tickets at home as it is normally fully booked when you go to buy tickets on the dock on the day.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from Dennys”
Reviews.Author: Bamull
Reviews.Content: Stayed in H. Inn this july, hotel in good location, decent size rooms etc. We were in the second building across the street where there is a 'Dennys' situated Stay away from 'Dennys' as it is daylight robbery. ...Basic breakfast for 2 adults+1 child consisting of coffee, toast, ceral, fruit etc approx $45-50. Much better to try the 'Latte Express' deli across the road on Beach street. Great selection of cereals, juices, sandwiches, excellent coffee etc to stay or go to suit families either on a budget or those that don't like getting ripped off. Go through the sliding doors beside the concierge desk onto the street and latte express is across the road on your right hand side.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: Mowzer
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great for its location in Fisherman's Wharf and great for its breakfast. Although each morning felt like a scramble for a table and food, there was plenty of choice and you could stock up for the day! Staff were very pleasant and room was adequate for what we needed but nothing special. The free internet access in the hotel lobby is a bonus and the hotel is modern and well kept.

Reviews.Title: “Great Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: EasyNote
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few days in November 2006 and had a really nice stay. The hotel is in a great location in which to explore Fishermans Wharf and is a few minutes walk to the main attractions. The rooms are ample and reasonably furnished. The staff are ok , although the breakfast bar can get crowded and is a little messy.

Reviews.Title: “Best Buy near Fisherman's Wharf”
Reviews.Author: TVTravel
Reviews.Content: I have clients with offices near Fisherman's Wharf and must check up on them several times each year. After trying all the alternatives, I've settled on the Holiday Inn Express as the best place to stay in the area. The room cost is reasonable. The rooms are clean and set up for a business traveller (free high-speed internet, and a decent desk). I've only stayed in a room with a street view once, with all other rooms facing interior courtyards. The good news is that these rooms are quiet, while the street view rooms have heavy traffic noice. The bad news is that there is no view in a city famous for great views. Holiday Inn Express offers the same breakfast at every property I've stayed at. It gets the job done, but don't expect anything fancy. Coffee, cold cereal, toaster waffles/english muffins, cinamon rolls, and an orange colored liquid that claims to be juice. If you are driving a car, be prepared to pay a $40 daily charge to park it at the hotel. High priced parking is pretty standard at all San Francisco hotels, but can be a shocker if you aren't prepared for it. Want a restaurant recommendation? Try Pompei's Grotto. It's about 2 blocks away, just West of the zooey part of Fisherman's Wharf. Good seafood at a reasonable price. If you are searching for a fantastic mega-meal with a view, McCormick & Kuleto's in Ghiradelli Square is the best.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: pmezz
Reviews.Content: We need a hotel to at when friends came to visit on 7/7/07. Our friends were staying at the Holiday Inn Fisherman's Wharf. We managed to get a reservation at Holiday Inn Express. Cost per night $200 was pricey for us. But from the time we arrived, we were treated very well. The hotel looked like it had recently been renovated from the lobby, floor hallway and the room it self. The updated furnishings were well done. The free continental breakfast was okay but very limited. BUT WHAT WAS OUTRAGEOUS to us was paying $30 a night in HOTEL TAX. WOW!

Reviews.Title: “Hated the holiday inn express”
Reviews.Author: kleithal
Reviews.Content: This hotel is shabby carpets are thread bear and linen shabby. The staff were etremely rude and they do not move on the homeless people in the foyer

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: mickeym1
Reviews.Content: Great location, quiet and only minutes walk to Fishermans Wharf. Excellent room, we shared with our 2 children and found the room to be a great size for a standard 2 x double room. Bathroom good size, modern, great shower, spotlessly clean. Continental breakfast very good and plenty on offer. Staff very helpful. I would definately stay at this hotel again. Excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: TheWanderingVFamily
Reviews.Content: Great location, friendly staff, clean rooms. This was by far the best hotel we stayed in during our vacation to San Francisco. We would definately reccommend this place to friends and family. They accommodated us at every turn and we could not have been happier. We would stay here again in a heartbeat. Thank You Holiday Inn Express at the Wharf you made our vacation a pleasure!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, location and service.”
Reviews.Author: MrsDallas
Reviews.Content: We stayed in The Holiday Inn Express during our honeymoon in San Francisco. The rooms were clean and pleasant (and we could just see the Golden Gate Bridge!), housekeeping was superb - well above average, staff were pleasant and helpful. The location was excellent - great for the Wharf, bike tours of the bridge, and well located for tram and bus stops. Lots of restaurants round the Wharf area and lots to do - would be great for families. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would definitely go back. Beds very large and comfortable, good choice of channels in rooms and free broadband which was a great bonus. Excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Wharf and Cruise Terminal both! [=”
Reviews.Author: skinnedknee
Reviews.Content: Prior to a cruise to Alaska, we had a quick over night stay at the H.I. Express at Fisherman's Wharf. We were travelling with 7 others, but they had opted to stay at another chain hotel nearby...their reservations were messed up, their check in was late and their hotel more expensive than ours. Us? We checked right in, had the good luck to receive one of their 3 rooms with a "wharf" view, and had a generous late check-out the next day. Be forewarned, the rooms are on the small side (think New York hotel rooms) but the staff was extremely helpful, the rooms very clean and it was located in a great place ~ about 3 blocks from Fishermans Wharf (close enough to walk, far enough to be quiet) and a short cab ride to the cruise ship terminal. We were very pleased with all the H.I. Express at Fisherman's Wharf had to offer. Thanks to others that posted reviews on this site...cuz that's what helped me decide where to stay!! (sorry no photos...too excited about the cruise to remember to take them!! )

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: Johnro
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a Memorial Day Weekend getaway in San Francisco and stayed at the Holiday Inn Express at Fisherman's Wharf. The location is supberb for all there is to do at Fisherman's Wharf and easy access to transportation for other areas in San Francisco. The hotel offers your standard Holiday Express amenties and does a great job in doing so. One addition that would be nice would be an indoor pool not that I would have had any time with so much to do in San Francisco. Facility has a clean modern look to it. The rooms are nice size for a large city. The only drawback was the beds seemed to sit a little low for my preference. The staff here were just awesome. Everyone that I encountered was friendly and went out of their way to assist.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: pebb876
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean, comfy hotel. Just a few blocks from the wharf and the trolly. Vallet parking underground about $35 a day. Cont breakfast was more than expected with hard boiled eggs, cinnamon rolls, and pastry along with cereal and doughnuts. Room was comfortable and even had its own coffee maker. Interior room view was not the best, but we didn't stay for the view. Friendly and helpful staff. They were great with directions. I'd recommend for the budget watching folks who still want to stay within walking distance to the wharf. Overall, a great stay and no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: cmwUk
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very good value for money and the staff are helpful. The only slight problem was a noisy party next door one night , but the desk staff attended to this when I complained and there was no further problem. The rooms are a reasonable size, I had a view of Coit Tower, and the location is excellent. The breakfast area gets a bit crowded at the weekend but that is a small price to pay. I would go there again.

Reviews.Title: “holiday inn express, san francisco”
Reviews.Author: zoobie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Express in February 2007 and it was fantastic. I can recommend it to anyone wanting a fishermans wharf area hotel as not only are the rooms spacious and clean, but you also get a free continental breakfast which is a rarity in the U.S. There is also a Sports bar opposite which has a friendly atmosphere (much nicer than the bar at the neighbouring Holiday Inn!) Only problem with this area of the town is the distinct lack of nightlife but regular trams take you up to Union Square where it is much livlier. A great hotel at a great price

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: ThePJs
Reviews.Content: Good tourist location, modern clean rooms and bathrooms. Very helpful reception staff. The valet parking is expensive..around $40 with tax, but very convenient - the car is parked in a garage under the hotel. If you want to save money on that, it is possible to park for less just a block or two away. The breakfast is acceptable as a "free" breakfast, but we chose to eat in the Hollywood Cafe next door for an inexpensive big American breakfast ! Overall I'd highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: helenf01
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights after an eventful journey from the airport via BART! Checkin was very quick & cheery & helpful although we did have to insist on 2 beds! Room was nice no real view but the beds were comfy & the pillows plump. Great location just 2 blocks from Fisherman sWharf. Breakfast was included & good but not always plentiful. it consisted of cereals, fruit, juice, coffee, croissants, donuts, bagels & toast. 9am was ok but dont expect everything! Staff were helpful with directions. The hotel was clean & fresh & very pleasant! Free internet access just off the lobby. Hotel is surroundedby other hotels & lots of souvenir shops. There is a 7-11 & a walgreens nearby (in different directions!) Had a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for family”
Reviews.Author: youngboo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here this past week with our girls 8 and 10. It was perfect. Had a junior suite which included a kitchenette - fridge and microwave. Great for snacks. It was clean but the room was not large. We were comfortable. The breakfast was tippical but perfect with one girl up at 6:30 and starving and the other up at 8. Close to everything. Would recommend it for a convenient/safe/clean place to stay. Nothing fancy.

Reviews.Title: “Better Than Expected”
Reviews.Author: JeanannTexas
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean, quiet, modern and conveniently located. The staff was always helpful and the free continental breakfasts were quite adequate. The decor was something between art deco and modern/ contemporary. Many restaurants were within walking distance and the view to the water from some of the rooms was fabulous. Internet access was easy and the excercise room was a pleasant bonus. We asked for a handicapped accessible, no smoking room with a king size bed and that is exactly what we got. There were no strange odors or other undesirable surprises. The only drawback was the $35 per day parking fee. But the parking valet service was swift and polite. I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Location and Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: GA1Travels
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Spring Break Week, April 3 - 8, 2007. I booked a mini-suite and was notified of a free upgrade to a full suite upon check-in! Prior to arrival, the hotel booked a city tour and a Muir Woods/Sausalito tour for me and my daughter. The hotel is very clean. The continental breakfast was a benefit - saved money. I am a healthy eater and I found, the fruit (bananas, organges, and apples), boiled eggs, fat free milk, wheat toast, and raisin bran & tea sufficient for me. Plenty of muffins, crousaints, and danishes, etc. are also available. A full hot breakfast is available across the street at "Knuckles" at the Hyatt or try the mom and pop shops adjacent to the H.I. Express and eat inside or on the curb! No restaurant is at the hotel, but a sports bar, Knuckles, is across the street. Want something late nite like I did? Denny' s open 24hrs is a 3-5 minute walk from the H.I. Express. Very short walk to Fishermans Wharf! Would stay there again. The hotel is on the same street as other Major hotels. I would easily choose the Hotel again. I am a business man that has been travelling a lot since 1985.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Robjoy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights 20-25th March and the location is superb.Hotel check in was very good and the room,although a little"tired" was ready on our arrival and clean.It had all the usual facillities and was nice and quiet.The breakfast is more than adequate,with a good selection,(but the toasters could do with replacing).Fishermans Wharf is very good,and we would HIGHLY recommend trying the clam chouder which is served up in a bread bowl,its just gorgeous.Alcatraz is still well worth a visit but book early in the day to get a place on the boat across.We had a lovely walk over the Golden Gate bridge(get a taxi there though) and we carried on walking right round to Sausalito which dosnt take very long and then have a coffee overlooking the bay its really nice.Take a tram car for the experience,plus the streets are very very hilly,and take a walk down Lombard Street,then keep going to Coit Tower.This is a lovely city with plenty to see and do,and dont miss Chinatown.Once again there are a lot of street performers and homeless people begging and sleeping in the streets but they dont cause you any trouble.Go to San Francisco and enjoy,its wonderful,and stay at this hotel too,its adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Second time as good as the first”
Reviews.Author: Daisiegee
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the HI Express in September last year for 5 nights and were as pleased with it this time as last. Excellent free breakfast which is served just off reception and it can get very busy here , but the place is quickly tidied and you wouldn't know that there had been hundreds of people eating there. We had a large disabled access room which was immaculate and very roomy. Large bathroom well stocked with towels and toiletries. Front desk staff were the same as 2 years ago, which I liked. I'd definitely stay here again as I actually like being near the Wharf but close to transport. Great value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Rjoc
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is the location. It is literally minutes from the very touristy Fishermans Wharf and is even closer to bus and cable car stops. There is nothing flash about the hotel but it does provide a quiet, relaxed base from which to explore San Francisco. The room I had was spotlessly clean and was a decent size although the bathroom was a little compact. Having said that, the room had everything needed for your stay. In room safe, tea/coffee, hair dryer, iron, etc were all included free of charge. The huge bed was comfortable and provided a sound nights sleep. Breakfast was disappointing.
