The continental selection was small and the only warm food available was an apple cake. It wasn't bad, just that I prefer a cooked breakfast, or at least the option of one. There is a small fitness room in the hotel with six or seven exercise machines available free of charge. The hotel has no bar but the one directly across the street (knuckles) is excellent and I'd recommend the BBQ pizza which is big enough for two and only costs $13. The Holiday Inn Express is designed for the customer who only uses the hotel for sleep and rest and they have got the balance just right. It is a perfect base to explore San Francisco and have a restful nights sleep after all that hill walking. I would use this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Good location, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Titchvic
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is the location. It's in easy walking distance to Fishermans Wharf which is where most of the touristy stuff goes on. We did venture into downtown SF, but felt a lot more threatened there than at fishermans Wharf. The hotel itself is quite bland, but clean and comfortable. If you are not planning on spending a lot of time on your room then this is fine. But whilst we were there it poured with rain most of the time, and we found the room quite small when we were trying to dry out our soggy clothes. In this hotel we also got a complimentary breakfast which was a good variety, and a good start to the day. We dont like to get up too early when on holiday so the fact that the breakfast was available until 9.30 was a plus for us! I knew SF was hilly, but they still surprised me - and thank god for the cable cars and trams!! We had a great time here, but mainly becauise we were out and about rather than because the hotel was great. The hotel is basic and functional - clean and the breakfast was good, and a convenient location, but otherwise I dont think we would stay here again. Mainly because we like to stay in different places each time, but also because the room was smaller than we had hoped, and that it just seemed very bland.

Reviews.Title: “Great and Ideal”
Reviews.Author: reenie13
Reviews.Content: I travel the world as an Flight Attendent and always stay at 5 star hotels so when i went on vacation i stayed at the Holiday Inn Express, Fishermans Wharf. It is situated in a fantastic location, near to all the piers and all transport to different parts of the city. The room was very clean and daily cleaned to a high standard. reception staff were extremely helpful and nothing was too much trouble, especially funny was Brandy. The fitness centre was adequate for its purpose and the free internet was a bonus. Free complimentary was nice but you have to be early but then again who wants to eat every morning when there is so much choice in the big city. Overall i thought the hotel and amenities in and close to the hotel was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “worth a visit”
Reviews.Author: sarahWarwickshire
Reviews.Content: We spent two week in California, touring, staying in 5 different hotels, and this one was one of the cheaper ones, but just as nice. The rooms were clean and large enough for a family of 4, we had the option of free breakfast each morning with coffee and oj it was basic but nice. the hotel is close to lots of main attractions - our son is in a wheelchair and we had no problems getting around. The only down side was having to pay $20.00 per day to park the car, and should you want food or a beer you have have to go to the hotel next door - a bit of a pain, but there are lots of places to eat near by, the sports bar across the road served food and it was great. THIS HOTEL IS GREAT VALUE FOR MONEY AND IS WELL WORTH A VISIT, we would go back. GIVE IT A GO.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: megsnan
Reviews.Content: The room was comfortable and warm, the bathroom clean and there were two queen size beds which gave me one of the better sleeps of the holiday (having been round the World, this was the last stage of the tour). The hotel is convenient to the Hyde Street cable car (get there early to avoid the queue) but there is also a lesser known route at the bottom of Taylor Street and it is also worth getting a ride on the old street cars which start in Leavenworth Street. All are within a couple of blocks of the hotel. It is also pleasant to walk through Fort Mason and along the waterfront. And, of course, it is convenient for boats to Alcatraz and Sausalito. Breakfast at the hotel is free but it is also a free-for-all. Everything is disposable - cups, plates, cutlery - so wasteful. The healthy stuff consists of cereal, apples, oranges or bananas and hard boiled egg but if you want muffins, cakes, pastries, donuts, chocolate donuts, etc etc, then this is the place to be. The breakfast room was busy, typically plates were being overfilled and discarded when eyes proved bigger than tummies, and it was far from the quiet, laid back, relaxed breakfast that I enjoy. After a couple of days we gave up on it and went to Starbucks or one of the cafÃ©s up the road. There is no restaurant at the hotel but you can use the facilities of the Holiday Inn next door. Pier 39 has some restaurants but they are expensive and have a captive market. Likewise, Fisherman's Wharf itself. We caught the cable car up to Chinatown a couple of times - very good quality and very good value food - and walked back, or we walked up Columbus Avenue to Little Italy where we also got good value meals. Walking at night is OK as there are usually loads of people around, but in some of the streets around the hotel there are down and outs sleeping in doorways but they were asleep and did not give us any hassle. One welcome advantage was the free Internet access in the lobby. I have stayed in other hotels in Fisherman's Wharf and found that this one offered a similar room at a lesser price than some of the others.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JEFNOLA
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location. Good continental breakfast, friendly staff and clean rooms. I would recommend this hotel for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location”
Reviews.Author: Jen1985
Reviews.Content: We did not stay here but did a sight inspection as part of work (I am a travel agent). This Holiday Inn is located opposite Fishermanâ€™s Wharf and was built in 2001. Lobby and rooms feature very modern dÃ©cor and furnishing. Rooms are of a medium/large and have Nintendoâ€™s for childrenâ€™s entertainment.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location, great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: eliza316
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Holiday Inn Express in mid September '06 as a last minute change from a Union Square hotel, and I'm certainly glad I changed hotels. The Holiday Inn Express is in a perfect location for easy access to all the very "touristy" haunts of Fisherman's Wharf and beyond. Literally a block away there is a metro car stop that goes all the way back down to Union Square for a very reasonable fare. Slightly further away is the most famous cable car line in the city, and being so close allows an early jump start on the queues. I felt the neighbourhood was very safe, even the less populated areas, for example I walked back from Coit Tower in the late evening and never once felt nervous. The hotel itself is very good. As I said I relocated at the last minute and the staff were very helpful, both at check in and at check out. The room was very clean and well appointed. I did not partake of the continental breakfast, but found the free computers with internet access in the lobby very useful. Overall I would strongly reccommend this hotel as a great base to explore one of the best cities I have ever visited.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MichiMet
Reviews.Content: A fabulous hotel in a fabulous location. Rooms reasonably small but very clean, comfortable and quiet. Best thing about this hotel - the free continental breakfast. Very helpful and friendly front desk staff. Great location - close to Cable Car stop, Lombard Street and Fisherman's Wharf and Pier 39. Reasonably priced too. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: kmc1
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed at this hotel sept 06. The staff were pleasant and very helpful and the rooms were clean and spacious. Continental breakfast was adequate, however it is a very short walk to other restaurants that provide a large choice of cooked breakfasts if you prefer. The hotel is conveniently located on Fishermans wharf, just a 5 minute walk to pier 39. Public transport stops are also a few minutes walk away. If I return to San Fran I would definitely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Worst breakfast we encountered”
Reviews.Author: Aussieflyer
Reviews.Content: After five weeks on the east coast of USA,we had stayed in many Holiday Inns, Hampton Inns, Embasssy Inns etc. Without doubt this hotel had the worst buffet breakfast. Even allowing for the disgraceful use of disposable cutlery, crockery etc that we encountered everywhere in the USA, I cannot believe that so many reviews accept chocolate iced donuts, cardboard muffins, fruitloops, the sweetest orange juice ever , white bread for toast , overripe bananas, and flowery apples as a "great breakfast". Travel to Australia, Italy and New Zealand and find out what a good breakfast means! Avoid the breakfast and go just a block away on the corner of Taylor and Lombardo to a really great, cheap cafe for smoked salmon bagels,really good coffee etc, so good for around $10 a head that it covered lunch as well.

Reviews.Title: “San Francisco - Perfect for our Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: HSE
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights for our Honeymoon in October 2006. Firstly, the weather was fantastic, warm days with bright blue skys. We were told when we were in SF that this was the best time to visit. We arrived from Las Vegas so at first were slightly disappointed (we had a suite in the Luxor and had been spoilt) but the hotel was perfect for what we wanted. The hotel boasts a central location, I would say Fishermans Wharf is the 'tourist' area with plenty of souvenir shops etc, also a lot of seafood restaurants to choose from as well as the usual, Rain Forest Cafe, McDonalds etc..... Check in was smooth, we were allocated a room on the front but the AC did not work so we asked to move and were placed at the back which was much better, no noise at all. Once settled in we were extremely pleased. Guests at the hotel can use the outdoor pool at the neighbouring Holiday Inn for free. We never got the chance! The breakfast was excellent, plenty of cereal, toast, muffins, doughnuts, fruit, tea, coffee, juice, all very fresh and plenty of it and this was available 6.30-9.30. The later you went down however the busier it was but still plenty of seats. The area is great for catching the cable car/bus and I would highly recommend this hotel. All hotels seemed the same standard in the area, there were the more exclusive hotels in the City Centre (Hilton, Mark Hopkins, Francis Drake, Marriott etc) but for what we needed it was perfect. San Francisco is a fab city and Alcatraz is a must but be sure to book in advance. We also found the all day cable car pass $11 each to be very worth while. Shopping is a must here and you can pick up some fantastic bargains, whatever you are into!! - the only disappointing thing was the GG park did not seem to be too accesible, and we were curious as to how as this seems to be quite a large area to visit, we hired some bikes and cycled to the GG bridge, very good value for money and lock and helmet supplied which meant you could have lunch, or have a look round the souvenir shops. Altogether, a fantastic package and we would not hesitate to choose SF for a destination in the future.

Reviews.Title: “location location location”
Reviews.Author: ginkomama
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights early Sep 2006. The location is perfect for Fishermans Wharf and Pier 39. Get place to stay to do all the touristy things in San Francisco. I thought the breakfast was good and well organised. We never had any problems staying here and would definately recommend to anyone wanting location very close to FW but not noisy. The only niggle I had with this hotel was the bed was harder that I would have liked. Having said that I would still stay here again for the location!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: kazz_usher
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at this hotel, mid September 2006! It was better than I expected! Check in - Was smooth and the staff were very friendly. I was checked in and in my room in 10mins! Rooms - Very clean! I dont think any of the rooms have fantastic views, I was over looking the road and If I listened really carefully you could hear the boats using there fog horns in the morning. Room was large. The fan in the bathroom was a bit noisy, but it turned off straight after you turned the light off. Comfy bed and lots of extra pillows! Location - Perfect, was a very short stroll to the heart of Fishermans Wharf, and although tacky, I did enjoy it and all tourists have to go! I didnt feel unsafe around the hotel and the neighbourhood seemed fine to me. The hotel is really close to two cable car turnarounds, which is really handy! Comp breakfast was perfect! TIP- Wake up early because once everything gone, its gone. Also the toasters take forever so be prepared to stand around for a long time. Staff- Very friendly, although on two occassions they did send us on a wild goose chase, so dont trust them when they tell you what directions to take...get a good map! I would definetly reccommend this hotel to anyone, it was clean, modern and safe! 4/5!

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel in Grubby Neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: AJO_UK
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was a standard Holiday Inn Express with adequate, clean rooms and a good complimentary buffet breakfast. Hotel Foyer was pleasant. Points for concern: - Parking is valet only and $32 + tax per night which is a rip off - Staff had a take it or leave it attitude - Fishermans Wharf is a tacky blemish on the face of a beatiful city - I would never stay there again - Hotel is in a noisy location My recommendation is that you stay at another hotel out of the area

Reviews.Title: “Hotel/Clean but Wharf/Sketchy”
Reviews.Author: BTC1
Reviews.Content: First trip to San Fran. The hotel was very convenient in that we could walk to many of our spots. The hotel room was tiny but very clean. The front desk staff was extremely nice and very helpful. The complimentary breakfast was substantial but get an early start to beat the big crowd, The only negative was the Wharf at night. Walking back from any of the restaurants in the area at night is pretty sketchy. I am not sure I would stay in that general area again but not because of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay”
Reviews.Author: NJFamilyOfSix
Reviews.Content: Out of three motels we stayed at on our trip up the coast, this one was by far the best. We stayed here for two nights. It was within walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf and Ghiradelli Square, which made everything so much easier. The staff was friendly, and the breakfast was full of people but organized and good for families. The inside of the hotel looked just like the pictures, and our room was clean - carpets and all. For a break from the city and a drive over the Golden Gate Bridge, we recommend visiting Muir Woods. The trees are amazing, and the kids loved it, too.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Location, Nice Motel, Noisy”
Reviews.Author: dood636
Reviews.Content: Outstanding location in the middle of Fisherman's Wharf. Walking distance from most of the nearby attractions. Very loud street noise. Friendly hotel management and staff, nice and well-kept property. Valet parking service was expensive (maybe $36/day), but it was always nice to have a parking space waiting whenever we returned to the hotel. Rates were reasonable, complimentary breakfast buffet was mediocre and crowded. Decent hotel, but too noisy for my wife.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is great, Fisherman's Wharf is not so great”
Reviews.Author: delledge
Reviews.Content: Like a previous reviewer, my family came for a short visit to San Francisco while spending the majority of our vacation time in beautiful Lake Tahoe. Having not visited the Fisherman's Wharf area for many years, the primary shock was finding the dirty, cheesy state of the wharf. Homeless folks and other unique characters along the streets caused us, my young daughter in particular, to be uncomfortable. But within that disappointing aspect of the neighborhood, we found the Holiday Inn Express a wonderful place to come home to. The hotel seemed quite new and sort of boutique-like in its decor. Rooms and public areas were quite clean and the complimentary continental breakfast was much above average for "budget-style" accomodations. Staff was friendly and always helpful. The rooms were smallish, and probably not large enough for 4 people, and our room was probably one of many without any view whatsoever. Thankfully we chose this hotel for easy access to the cable cars and other things on our "to do" list. Valet parking was $32.00 per day (before taxes). I felt our car was fairly secure in that lot, however the hotel elevator takes anyone down to the parking area unsupervised. For our personal tastes, we will likely try a downtown hotel next time we come to San Francisco, not because of the hotel but because of our personal discomfort in the wharf atmosphere. Finding a good rate may be difficult, but location is important to us.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate lodging”
Reviews.Author: sheltercove
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night on a short side trip we took to San Franciso while we were staying at Lake Tahoe. (Good Points) The hotel is located right near the wharf area which would be a plus for most people. It is only a short walk to the cable cars and trolley. The hotel is new and shows no wear and tear yet. The breakfast is the typical Holiday Inn Select breakfast which I believe to be one of the best around. The hotel staff is friendly and helpful. They put out fruit on the counter in the afternoon. (Needing improvement or that which you may want to be forewarned of) We needed two rooms. The one my son and his friend stayed in was a typical two bed room of adequate size. The one my wife and I stayed in was really small (477 I think). It reminded me of some of the smallish european rooms we have stayed in. It was adequate, but should not have been priced as high as the others. Parking your car here is 32 dollars a pop for one night. I consider that too high even for a large city. I believe you can park it cheaper at some of the local lots. Neither room had a fridge or a micro. As this is a new hotel I would have expected this to have been included. I do not think there is a pool for the kiddies, but I believe you can use the Holiday Inn pool a few doors down. Would I stay here again? Yes

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Tea_Bird
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel from the 22nd August, the facilities were as described on the website, the room was spotless, the free internet access was very useful, the staff were friendly and the service was good. The location was excellent, there are plenty of things to do locally and the hotel is easily accessible for public transport or to walk to the rest of san francisco (mind the hills!!) i would definitely stay there again, the only thing i would say, is make sure you go for the complimentary breakfast early as it gets busy later on, which we found out due to jet lag!

Reviews.Title: “Happy with The Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: Stuartbuxton
Reviews.Content: Although we stayed in the sister hotel above Denny's we found it to be of a good standard. The rooms were kept very clean and the coffee/tea facilities were generously replenished. The entrance through a badly lit car park could potentially be tricky & the management should be aware of this - increased lighting & more visible security at night would give more peace of mind. Some reviewers have questioned the quality of surrounding nearby restaurants, but Holiday Inns can hardly be held responsible for this. We would have no hesitation in staying here again. It was generally good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: H-Wilmes
Reviews.Content: We can only agree with the last couple of reviews. We booked this hotel based on its reviews in tripadvisor and its location. We really liked it: great location with good public transport connections for the rest of downtown, the rooms are modern and clean, beds are great, bathroom is excellent, breakfast is okay, staff is nice and helpfull. I do not for the life of me understand those people who complain about the location. Anyone who informs himself before going to SF knows that Fisherman's Wharf is a tourist trap. Big deal. If you don't want to walk the Pier or see the tourist shops, just head in the other direction. Or book a hotel in another part of town. We did not see any homeless people or beggars while we were there. We took the cable car in the evening to the restaurants in North Beach, came back late at night, no problem. This part of SF felt like our home neighbourhood, we did not feel unsafe or felt that we had to look over our shoulder. Definitely a good place to start your discovery of beautiful San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: lofdol
Reviews.Content: We spent a wonderful weekend in San Francisco and stayed one night at the Holiday Inn Express (this hotel does not allow pets, the writer below confused it with the Holiday Inn which is older and does allow them). This property is new and spotlessly clean. We paid extra for a suite and our view was amazing. From our room we could see Alcatraz and part of the Bay. You are walking distance from everything at the Wharf and it is great to be so close (even for bathroom breaks). The parking is $32 but we rode the ferry from Vallejo and parked our van for free there. It was a great trip and I highly recommend it. The hotel may not be the fanciest but you can't beat the location and the price is about the best at the Wharf. The staff at the front desk were very friendly . The breakfast bar was great with a decent variety of food and of course those awesome Holiday Inn Express Cinnamon Rolls!

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay...”
Reviews.Author: cbpdcop
Reviews.Content: Arrived July 23rd for a three night stay and overall we were very satisfied with our stay. We wanted lodging within walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf/Pier 39 and selected the Holiday Inn Express and reading generally favorable reviews on this site. The location is great, convenient to the Wharf, Pier, Bay & Alcatraz Tours, Ghiradelli Square, the Cannery, and the Cable Car line. The hotel does not have a pool or a restaurant but you can use the pool at the adjacant Holiday Inn, where there is also a Denny's Restaurant located. The hotel serves a continental breakfast in the lobby starting at 6:30 AM, consisting of cereal, fruit, pastries, hardboiled eggs, breads and a variety of beverages. We felt the selection was great, but don't sleep in late and expect to be able to eat because it closes at 9:30 AM. The stairs were hard to find and the elevators as slow as any we've ever been on, also the bathroom fan was rather noisy, but the room was clean and adequate for our needs. Aside from the rather high $32 daily parking fee, we felt the hotel was well worth the $110 nightly rate. We would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Place to Experience SF at the right price”
Reviews.Author: CaptainEO7
Reviews.Content: I had looked into what hotel would best suit our needs in San Francisco for several months and decided on the Holiday Inn Express due to a combination of Location, Price, inclusion of buffet breakfast & age of the actual property. With all this in mind me and my girlfriend were satisfied with our stay, not jumping for joy but happy. The location is great for the Wharf. There are around a dozen large hotel-chain properties all situated within an area of a few blocks so whether you stay at the HI Express, Sheraton, Hyatt, etc etc you'll more or less be staying in the same area. The main drawback is that the location is two blocks back from the Wharf area and the immediate vicinity isn't exactly a pleasant one. Pier 39 is a great place for a stroll, grab a meal and browse the shops. The area around the Cannery, Ghiradelli Square & the Cable-Car turnaround is also nice. It's the few blocks in between these areas however that make the Wharf un-savoury. A concentration of very tacky souvenir stores and one-too-many colourful characters spoil the area although we still felt happy that we'd chose the Wharf as our base. We were originally planning a stay at the Westin on Union Square and whilst we saw that the hotel itself was very grand we weren't convinced that staying smack-bang in the centre of the city would have been a better option. Every one of the 4 days we spent in the city involved starting things off within ten minutes of our hotel - whether it be Alcatraz, a superb city tour or cycling over the GG Bridge. The major gripe we had with the area was how early everything closed on Pier 39. We expected to be able to browse the shops, etc after dinner each night but from 10pm onwards the whole area closes up and you're left with the choice of having a drink in one of the few restaurant bars or returning to your hotel. The hotel itself is very modern and spotlessly clean. Certainly no character and most of the rooms face into central courtyards but if it's a new hotel with good standards that you look for this hotel is ideal. The rooms weren't large but fine, especially for a city hotel and the shower, room temperature, furniture etc were all great, as was the buffet breakfast included in the price. All-in-all our 4 days in San Francisco were brilliant, taking in some memorable experiences. If you want a very clean, modern hotel and can get a good rate at the Holiday Inn Express I'd recommend staying here and using it as a base. NB - Some people mix up the adjacent Holiday Inn with the Express - the normal HI is a lot older and I'd definitely opt for the Express over it. We did like the look of the Sheraton however although all the hotels were similar in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: MHS8874
Reviews.Content: We spend 5 days at the hotel. We selected it because it was dog friendly and reasonably priced for the area. The staff are inconsistent - some were great, others need to get another job. The facilities are older but good, but the beds are rock hard and the pillows about the same - after 5 days, needed a chiropractor. Its a good location for dogs because of the small park next door, but beware the homeless who sleep there. Most ignored us, but some were persistent until we walked off. Its a good jump off for the trolley and a great walk through the Fort, etc. But it is cold! We live at the top of a mountain in Colorado, but this is a piercing cold amplified by the wind and the fog. Plenty of restaurants, but all priced to take your last dollar.. do try Boudin's though - good combination of service, food, and cost.

Reviews.Title: “Its all been said before but heres my bit...”
Reviews.Author: ALB498
Reviews.Content: Yep, have to agree with the majority of the reviews, this is a great hotel and would definitely recommend it to anyone looking for a mid-priced stay in San Francisco. The rooms are clean, modern and good sized, with all the expected amenities. There is a great buffet breakfast included in the rate, where you can help yourselves to cereal, donuts, muffins, toast (English people beware of the american's evil sweetened bread, its manky) juice, coffee and warm cinnamon buns (mmm cakes for breakfast, who needs a fryup) Have to give it 4 and not 5 because it is let down by being too close to the hideous tacky tourist trap of fishermans wharf. It is convenient for all things touristy so I would have no problem staying here again, its close to cable cars, f-line, some useful bus routes and walking distance of most central places and felt safe at night, but just round the corner it gets so tacky. Its full of nasty souvenier shops (think Blackpool) overpriced, lousy restaurants (ok so didnt try them all but..) and scruffy buildings and parking lots. Not sure what the appeal is to any of those suckers filling the sidewalks, yuk! Still, dont let that put you off this hotel, just please dont spend too much time thinking fishermans wharf is all there is of San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, good location”
Reviews.Author: europe_skier
Reviews.Content: we stayed there for a long weekend and had a good time. the staff was friendly, service was excellent and they offered this great breakfast. valet parking was also ok. the rooms are a little small, but who cares, if you are here for sightseeing? they were clean and well equipped. if you like to be near the pier or cable car - this should be your first choice!

Reviews.Title: “Greatest Stay Ever”
Reviews.Author: hicksWinnipeg
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited from Winnipeg, Manitoba ,Canada, from May 5, 2006 until May 12,2006 and stayed at the Holiday Inn Express Fisherman's Wharf. We had an unbelievable stay at this hotel. We could not be more pleased with the room (overlooking the wharf) or the hotel front desk staff. They were all "A 1" to us and could not be more helpful with anything we asked. Everything was within walking distance of attrations and restuarants. We will be returning to San Fran in the near future and would be requesting to stay at this great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “For safety sake, do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Do not stay here if you value your safety! We were constantly harassed in front of the hotel as soon as we left the hotel, and we had items stolen from our room. The staff showed no concern for these problems, and didn't do anything about them! Why stay where they do not value your business. There are many alternatives, closer to Pier 39, such as the Radisson and Wharf Inn.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place to stay in at Fisherman's Wharf”
Reviews.Author: LydNewHope_PA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel before starting a cruise out of San Francisco. I did a lot of research to find a reasonably priced hotel as well as being in a great location. We certainly picked the right one. The location could not be greater - within a block of Fisherman's Wharf, the rooms and public areas are very, very clean. The reception staff could not be more helpful. A big bonus is the continental breakfast buffet. They have boiled eggs, warm sticky buns, all kinds of juices, muffins, cereals, yogurt and of course coffee or tea. This buffet is way superior to any of the other continental breakfasts we have had in the past. While checking out, I asked whether we could keep our luggage there for the day when returning from our cruise since our plane did not leave till 10:00 that night, and again was pleasantly surprised that we could. I am in the travel business and will always recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to San Francisco and when we come back again, we certainly will stay here again. Thanks for a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Bloody great!”
Reviews.Author: Harvey871
Reviews.Content: Really great location and really clean, good size room. This hotel offers great friendly service, in a truly fantastic location, a stones throw from the action and bars of the local piers. Double beds in a twin room ...

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: H&SP
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to San Francisco and we chose this hotel because of the good reviews and also the price that we got from the hotel website. The location of this hotel was fantastic - just a few minutes walk to Fishermans Wharf and all its sights. It is close to many restaurant and the Hyatt Sports bar across the road serves a very decent burger and cold beer. It is also close to the two cable-car turning points at the Wharf and so makes it very easy to get to other areas including Union Square. Our room was very clean and was a decent size. There was no view from the room but then we weren't there to look out of our hotel window. The free breakfast was excellent and was just what we needed to set us up for the day. The area did get quite busy but we didn't have a problem getting a seat. We thought that Fishermans Wharf was a great place to stay especially for a first visit to San Francisco. We would definitely recommend a visit to Bubba Gumps at Pier 39 for dinner and a city tour on a trolley bus. We will definitely book to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT, GREAT, GREAT”
Reviews.Author: raish
Reviews.Content: ABSOLUTELY fantastic stay......everything about this hotel is excellent. Would stay again, wouldn't bother looking around at others. This has best location, service, quality, comfort that you could ask for. Thanks to the team at Holiday Inn Express San Francisco

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel with our 2 teenage sons after a long flight from the Uk only to find our room was not ready. What could have been a dreadful start to our holiday was saved by the prompt attention of the reception staff who not ony found us another room without delay but upgraded us to a suite! We spent a very enjoyable 3 nights at the hotel & cannot fault it for comfort, location & staff. Anyone looking to stay on San Francisco on a budget should look at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel. Location good.”
Reviews.Author: jenstef
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights as part of a 2-week trip to California. Room was quite large with a nice bathroom and clean. Breakfast was good and had a reasonably wide choice - though was busy and had paper plates etc. Location was close to Fisherman's Wharf the Mason cable car stop (much less busy tthan the other main route to downtown) and the tram F route. So easy to get most places pretty quickly and plenty to do within a 10 minute walk. Only downside was our view - which was of a bland and undecorated interior courtyard within the hotel. But overall very good value for the location. We paid around Â£40 per night on a package with UK Air Miles.

Reviews.Title: “Reliably comfortable, clean, good service un a good location!”
Reviews.Author: malousadiua
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at this hotel in fisherman's wharf, but what I didn't know is that there is no view of the wharf here at all! I was expecting my 3 year old to be able to watch the goings-on at the wharf but couldn't do that! It was very close to the wharf though, without much noise at all. Because it is a Holiday Inn, it is reliable comfortable, clean, and what you would expect a good hotel would be here in the states. Try looking for this standard in Europe and you would expect to pay much more! This hotel tries hard to keep up with all the conveniences and it succeeds. This is a GOOD hotel! The only thing I might add is it is a bit pricey. It could be because of the location. I would still recommend it if you don't need a good view. Otherwise be prepared to pay a lot more. Another thing, there is no refrigerator in the room, which was surprising to me! Not good if you need it to store formula, etc. for a baby! But overall we had a good stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “excellent low cost base”
Reviews.Author: navstu
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 4 nights March 19th - March 23rd on our way to Hawaii. Clean and large room with kitchenette. Excellent breakfast buffet. Freindly staff. Location ideal only minutes walk to fishermans wharf, cable cars and streetcar terminus. Lots of buses about too but never used them stuck to cable and streetcars. Would stay again if returned to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great anchor in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel and staff were wonderful. Our rooms were exactly as ordered and met our needs. The location is great for walking to tourist areas. Parking fee of $32 was a bit steep but competitive for the area. Highly recommend this facility to others.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable but completely depressing decoration”
Reviews.Author: Saffy2
Reviews.Content: Don't stay here if you're looking for a romantic getaway. This hotel is weird. The reception area is decorated in funky red and blue with modern furnishings and lighting. The bedrooms, however, are decorated in various shades of green and beige with matt finishes that make the room drab. Most rooms (except for family suites) face a "courtyard" which is small enough that you can see straight across into the opposite room. But, if you're there just to sleep, the beds are super comfortable and bathroom is well appointed with a nice long bath and plenty of towels. Breakfast is generous but hardly healthy and the eating area can get busy and noisey at peak times. Trays are provided so there is nothing stopping you taking breakfast back to your room. The staff were friendly enough and the area is safe for walking around at night. I would probably shop around before I stayed here again. The room was too average for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice disposable hotel, poor area”
Reviews.Author: NVZ5BKUQ
Reviews.Content: This hotel has good desk service. It also offers free internet access. It is a nice frill-free place to stay and shares its facilities with the Holiday Inn immediately adjacent. Local attractions include Alcatraz, a submarine tour and a Liberty boat tour. Breakfast is a help yourself buffet which consists mainly of bread products and jam, doughnuts, pastries etc. although they do offer apples, oranges and bananas. It must all be eaten off disposable plates and trays so don't expect to see any china. It is reasonably placed to catch the two tourist cable-cars and the boat to Alcatraz, but otherwise Fisherman's Wharf is a horrible collection of downmarket shops. Pier 39 seems to be more famous for the way it obtained planning permission than anything on the pier. In March it is a windswept and cold collection of downmarket shops. I recommend that you stay in a different area of SF and travel to Fisherman's Wharf. The HI Express doesn't disappoint but it is a poor base to explore San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Fab at the Fisherman's”
Reviews.Author: LondonDeborah
Reviews.Content: If you have a young child and are going to San Franciso, the holiday Inn at Fisherman's walk should suit. The hotel has an outside pool and you are in flat 1 minute walking distance from all the attractions at Fisherman's Wharf, with its bars, restaurants, and boat trips to Alcartraz. Also, the area is flat so no hills to push a buggy up. Very close to the main tram station into San Francisco. We booked with Virgin and they were perfect picking us up from the airport in a limosinine for no extra cost and the whole trip was effortless thanks to the very helpful staff on the plane.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great location - right around the corner from San Francisco's #1 tourist atttraction - Fisherman's Wharf. Pier 39, sighseeing tours, cable car and tramway's stops are right there. You'll be able to get easily to the Union Square (downtown), BART stations, all the piers and many sighseeing spots ( crooked Lombard St, Coit Tower, Columbus St with tons of restaurants (Stinking Rose is great!, Cannery with shops and restaurants and many many more by foot or a quick ride on many of SF's public transportation choices. We had an upgrade to the Executive floor witha veiw of the Bay and Alcatraz. The room was great - clean and spacious. The staff was nice. We had no problems whatsoever. Highly recommend this place if you have no Ritz-Carlton expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Very Basic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is considered a 3 star hotel, but I feel it's more of a 2 star. Remember this is an express hotel, which means it has no restaurant on site, no room service, no bar area, etc. It has the basic necessities you need. Here are a few details about the hotel itself. *The room and bathroom were very small, but clean *It's a newer hotel *Free continental breakfast-excellent if you are taking children *Great location-walking distance to all the tourist attractions

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were most impressed with this hotel after having spent four days there with our two teenage daughters. It is within walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf yet far enough away from the hustle and bustle. The rooms, service and staff were great and this is basically a new and modern hotel. The free breakfast was more than adequate for Australian tastes and took away the stress of having to find decent food early in the morning. We took the limousine service to the airport and this was cheaper than taking a shuttle or taxi. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Perfectly situated, beautiful room, decent breakfast and what a city! This was a lovely hotel and my whole family, seven of us aged 6-68, spent a wonderful four days there last summer. I miss it like crazy and would, without hesitation, return. Why not 5 stars? Only two toasters in the breakfast room between dozens of us.

Reviews.Title: “Nice visit overall”
Reviews.Author: JPBCa
Reviews.Content: Overall I really liked this hotel....It seems really nice and clean. Just a couple of suggestions and comments. You might want to ask for a room not near the street. In the early morning you could hear the rail cars go by your window. That was a bit annoying. I think even more because the hotel didn't seem busy, so you wonder why they put you there? We had one other problem-the heater didn't seem to work well. I reported it to the hotel but nothing was ever done about it. I just called housekeeping for more blankets. Oh, I didn't like not having bars of soap. The front desk says you are supposed to wash you hands with the gel labeled scrub. All the other Holiday Inn Express' we have stayed at had bars of soap, but anyhow maybe just a small issue. The free breakfast in the morning was a big plus in the rate, except I've seen better selections at other Holiday Inn Express'we have stayed at. I didn't like the big bins of cereal. They had these scoops inside and people put their hands inside to scoop the cereal out. I thought that was unsanitary so we skipped the cereal. They didn't have any hot tea or bagels so we were not happy about that either. I would probably stay there just for the location. We really like Fishermans Wharf and it was walking distance from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great for business or pleasure trip”
Reviews.Author: GoBanana
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for a combined business / pleasure trip, and found it great for both. They provide all the services you need to complete tasks with minimal stress, but never descend into that smarmy brown-nosing found in so many "high-end" hotels. Also, it's located within easy walking distance of Fisherman's Wharf & Pier 39 (go see the sea lions!), so I had lots of fun during my off hours. Another plus: it's located on the streetcar line, so you can access public transport easily.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in this hotel and would highly recommend it if you want to visit San Francisco on your own as it has a perfect location near Fisherman's wharf and the end of the cable cars lines! Rooms were big and clean and the breakfast was one of the best we had during our stay in the USA

Reviews.Title: “A great city hotel, highly reccommended!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We travelled from the U.K. and chose to stay at the Holiday Inn Express Fishermans Wharf for 4 nights at then end of October 05. If you are looking for a great location near the wharf and good value for money, you must try this hotel. We were allocated a ground floor room, which had a large king bed, all the expected room amenities and a modern bathroom with a powerful shower. The complimentary breakfast buffet catered for most tastes, providing pastries, muffins, cereals, toast, juice, hot drinks etc. The seating area was sufficient during our stay, but may be overcrowded at peak holiday periods. There was also complimentary internet access in the lobby, parking if required for a fee, pay phones, small gym etc. Location was great, minutes from Pier39 and a fab little deli in the Cannery. The Hyatt hotel's sports bar was also only across the road and a Denny's just at the corner. I couldn't fault this hotel, they have clearly thought about visitor needs and provided for them, I I would definetly stay at this hotel again. Highly reccommended!!

Reviews.Title: “Made Our Stay Special”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_Lady_2004
Reviews.Content: I made reservations at the Holiday Inn Express on Beach Street, beacuse my sister and I wanted to be in the Wharf Area and it was my sister's birthday. The hotel is in a great location.. across from the Hyatt Hotel. A block from public transportation, parking is expensive, but why bring a car if you are visiting the City and Wharf area.We used the Super Shuttle from the airport. Good service..cost was $15.00 one way. The hotel staff made us feel welcome even though we arrived early. The front desk personnel, I think his name is Joseph was just the kindness person when we checked in.. the hotel also had a bag of chocolates waiting for my sister after we checked into our room. Comp. breakfast is good, room is clean, and there is free internet service. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “If you like to sleep go elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: carolh198
Reviews.Content: Room was very nice but if you like to have a good night's sleep whilst you are travelling, make sure you don't end up with rooms overlooking the Denny's delivery bay at this hotel. Deliveries arriving at all hours of the night, ie we were awoken several nights in a row at 3:00 am by staff unloading and thumping boxes of cheese etc around the floor. The garbage truck arrived at 6:00 am. The paper delivery boy literally slapped the papers down outside each room early every morning, you could hear him all the way down the corridor as each bundle of papers hit the floor. A well known airline/holiday company regard this as their flagship hotel in San Francisco. I think not.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, High Parking Fee!”
Reviews.Author: yallaen
Reviews.Content: I am writing this while on my honeymoon, staying at the Holiday Inn Fisherman's Wharf location in San Francisco, CA. I have several great points to bring out, but one bad point... I read the reviews prior to going...after having booked the hotel thru my travel agent. I was concerned about the notes from previous travels about the concierge's lack of service (male concierge). Ok, I called on Wednesday to have flowers delivered to our room. The female concierge was VERY GREAT, got the flowers ordered. They weren't in the room when we arrived as I didn't have a room "blocked"..but she was great and got bellboy to get them to the room before my wife saw them!!! And very helpful! Must have corrected that problem... The rooms were great (we took reviewer's advice and upgraded to 5th floor). Great view out window of wharf area. Great location..staff very friendly!! Go eat across the street at Pergamino's for breakfast! EXCELLENT (and a LOT cheaper than the hotel's $18.00/person buffet!!) We've walked everywhere nearby..great location! Now..bad side..the parking is NOT FREE!!! It's $36.00 A DAY FOR PARKING!!! So, you're hosed if you rented a car...but you really don't need to rent a car if you are staying here for your stay.. AND, get the 1 or 3 day transit passes..allows unlimited rides on cable cars, buses, streetcars...all for $11/day!!!! One final note..take the Fire Engine tour..it's at the NE corner of the hotel property near the Cannery..great 75 minute tour of Presido, Golden Gate Bridge, downtown area..very friendly and great time!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Garry11
Reviews.Content: I had read a lot of reviews on this website to help decide where to stay in San Francisco so I thought I would offer some feedback of my own. My wife and I stayed at the Holiday Inn Express Sept 15-22 and thought it was a great place to stay. This was our first visit to San Francisco and we did lots of sightseeing and tourist stuff. We liked the hotel mainly because of the location, close to Fisherman's Wharf, cable cars, bus stops and shopping. The Hotel was very clean, modern, quiet at night and the continental breakfast was a great way to start the day. The staff were very friendly and helpful. We had booked 3 sightseeing tours with Super Sightseeing Tours and enjoyed them very much. Their office is less than 1/2 a block from the Hotel main entrance. There are lots of restaurants near the Hotel and we especially enjoyed Scoma's for great seafood. I would definetely recommend this Hotel. We felt very safe in the area and there is plenty to see and do within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “great location,”
Reviews.Author: Larry in Pittsburgh
Reviews.Content: Wife and I stayed 9/24/05, Clean,comfortable and within walking distance to wharf, cable cars and many local attractions. Very nice room,bed and free breakfeast that was better than other expresses we have stayed at. Staff was very helpful with directions and local ideas. Parking was expensive but very convenient. Got an early checkin time and a free upgrade!! I must be living right. Got a great price thru internet HI site. Would strongley recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean, quiet, new and close to Fisherman's Wharf”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 4 nights here while visiting San Francisco. I had read the reviews before we made our reservations. This is a very clean and much newer place than the other Holiday Inn down the street. The location is excellent with an easy walk to anything including cable cars and restaurants. The room was very nice and quiet. The complimentary breakfast was great and very filling. I would highly recommend this to anyone traveling to San Francisco and wanting to stay in a hotel near Fisherman's Wharf. Note --- read restaurant reviews before you try something new as we had a poor experience at one restaurant in the North Beach District. This may have been a fluke but who knows --- read on --- My wife and I visited San Francisco week of 9/12/05 and had a wonderful time. We decided to eat at Figaro's for dinner. This decision was based on nothing more than trying something new. We expected a decent and filling meal and ended up with the complete opposite. The restaurant did not have many patrons as the neighboring restaurants - that should have been our first indication - We ordered and while the service was ok - not many patrons to serve - the food was the absolute worse food I have ever had at an Italian restaurant. The bread basket was made up of dried bread on a used napkin (probably the same basket from another table). I ordered chicken parmisan. The chicken was one small piece that tasted like a dried out side of anything other than chicken and the pasta/sauce was cold. My wife's dinner wasn't any better. $40 later and very dissapointed. Ended up walking around to Fisherman's Wharf and stopped for a quick McDonald's. I would never recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay!”
Reviews.Author: nkMIA
Reviews.Content: This hotel was an excellent choice. The rooms were very clean and well kept, and cozy. It's very near to shopping and attractions. Staff were very friendly and the included continental breakfast was very good! I would definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for four nights 1st-4th September and it was OK! Great location just around the corner from all attractions the pier 39, the boats to Alcatraz all the resturants etc. The hotel was comfortable but not that nice, a bit grey and dismal looking no bar or resturant however the included breakfast was very good, slightly a bit of a free for all but very nice pastries and croissants etc. Not much elce to stay about the hotel really but it was clean and tidy and a great base for going around San Francisco. I hope this has been helpful but if you would like anymore info then plean email me ... carina.gordon@ntlworld.com.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: cindykay
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the first 2 nights of a 12 day vacation from San Francisco to LA. The location is excellent. We could walk to the cable cars, the wharf, Ghiradelli Square, Lombard St........pretty much anything we wanted to. Our room was on the inside of the hotel....we looked out to a "courtyard". No street noise, but it would have been nice to have the room with a view of Alcatraz! The shower was awesome. Nice bathroom, towels, lots of room. When we first got to our room, I asked a housekeeper for additional pillows and a blanket. He had it to us in less than 10 minutes! Many places we've stayed at take forever to get you these items, if they even have them. The only thing I would recommend here is new beds. They were small (full)....queens would be much nicer, and they were not very firm. Breakfast was included each morning which had been a deciding factor for us. One less meal to pay for in a pretty expensive town! It was very good, with lots of choices including hard boiled eggs, cereals, cinnamon rolls, etc.... Lobby and breakfast room was always full, but the staff kept up with refills and were very friendly. Such a treat to have a smiling face in the morning!! It was fun to be in the midst of so many other travelers each morning. In fact, we met up with someone from our hometown who just raved about the hotel also! Front desk staff was very helpful with questions and directions. No problems with checking in or out. We inquired about an upgrade to a suite and were told that none were available, but she quickly offered to supply us with a refrigerator or cot if needed. On another note, we would highly recommend the night tour of Alcatraz. It was awesome! Make sure to bring a warm jacket and if you go on the earlier of the 2 tours (6:20), you are allowed to stay later and take the last ferry back, giving you more time to take in the "extras" that are offered with only the night tours. Would stay again.....especially if they upgraded the beds!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value in the Wharf”
Reviews.Author: Jimforever
Reviews.Content: Good value for money - big comfortable rooms, friendly staff, free internet in the lobby and an ok breakfast. Full of tour parties but no noise from adjacent rooms. I had a room facing the road but the soundproofing was good, although I was moved from a room on the other side as the noise from the trolley/streetcar (aka tram to Europeans) was more than audible 4 floors up. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel that is Not the Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: Stephani
Reviews.Content: Some folks have posted their opinions of what I think may be the Holiday Inn. The Holiday Inn Express is directly next door to a building that is part of the Holiday Inn, but they are NOT the same hotel. The HI Express has 4 floors, not 5 and no pool. This was my second stay and it was just as nice as the first. Our room was very clean and the free breakfast was ample--unlike some other places they quickly replenish items if they start running out. We stayed in a minisuite facing Beach St. and it was very quiet--we could even see Alcatraz from our room. the hotel is safe, nicely decorated and clean. You can't beat the location if you want to be on Fisherman's Wharf. There are lots of public transportation options nearby and you can easily walk to North Beach or to Ghirardelli Square. Overall this is a good value particularly for the area. In the past I've found that the front desk staff can be somewhat unpleasant but did not have any issues with them this time. Actually the front desk clerk called a limousine for us to take to the airport--we had a private car with plenty of room for less than the cost of a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jj62
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights at the end of our family trip to the USA - 2 adults & 2 children. Location wise the hotel is great. Check in staff were very helpful and friendly. Room was clean and tidy, not huge but big enough for the four of us. On site parking, because we were with Virgin, was free (and very secure). Had read about the noise at night outside being an issue from other posts on here, but have to say we had no problems whatsoever. Two minutes from the hotel is the old 1940's tram system which will take you for a $1.25 fare all the way to downtown and back. Alternatively the cable car stop is also a couple of minutes away. Fisherman's Wharf itself is a little overrated, but the city has so many other things to see and do, that it is as good a base as anywhere to stay. Would I stay at the hotel again?...... Yes as it's safe, secure and in a good location

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently spent 5 days at the Holiday Inn Express Fishermans Wharf, and loved it. The room was a junior suite and was very comfortable , two double beds, a couch, bay window, desk and a spacious bathroom. Great shower, great big thick towels. and the suites come with a small fridge, microwave and wet bar. Complimentary continental breakfast every morning with fruit, doughnuts, bagels, cereal, sweet rolls, juices, coffee, teas, milk. They provide trays if you want to take the food up to your room. Great set-up. Front desk staff was everything you would want them to be. Knowledgable, professional, and really friendly. Only a couple of complaints during our stay. One time we returned to our room and it smelled strongly of cigarrette smoke, and one time we returned from a day out and about and our door was ajar. The maid hadn't closed it. But I guess that's a testament to the hotel and to San Francisco, because everything was in its place. The room above ours was a smoking room, so the smell must have come throught the venting system. Other than those two things, everything was perfect. Great location too, close to everything we wanted to do and see. We would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Express and Suites for 4 nights from 7/1/5 to 7/5/5. We were in a mini suite on the third floor with a view across to the Hyatt Hotel. There was very minimal noise from the road below. I spent a lot of time looking for a hotel in San Francisco and i wasnt disappointed with my pick at this hotel. The rooms were large and well set out. A new modern hotel. Quiet rooms. However, the air conditioning was loud and would turn on and off when it reached the temperature which was noisy at night. The bathroom was spacious and the daily complimentary breakfast was plentiful. The staff were also friendly. The location is great. Only a few minutes walk to Fishermans Wharf, any closer and you would get all the traffic and pedestrian noise from the Wharf. So the location was just right. I would recommend this hotel. We did several tours which i would also recommend: Alcatraz, Motorised Cable Car tour (2 1/2 hours), Cable Cars to Union Square, Pier 39 is great, but remember because of the location the restaurants are expensive. However there is great food, shopping and entertainment at Pier 39. The Holiday Inn is next door and we had a lovely buffet 4th of July dinner there, and if you miss out on the complimentary breakfast you can take a voucher over to the Holiday inn and get 50% off a full buffet breakfast which we took advantage of on one occasion when we slept in. A very nice hotel and we would defenitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: hinsan
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a driving holiday in California with San Francisco as the starting point. Found Holiday Inn Express through TripAdvisor and, based on the reviews, booked over the internet. Hotel is clean, comfortable and in great position, close to or within easy walking distance of everything, not only Fisherman's Wharf but also China Town and the large central shopping area in the City. Found staff at the hotel to be courteous and helpful. Apart from the obvious enjoyment of visiting Alcatraz and the other tourist attractions, one of the most pleasant memories will be of the gentleman who serenaded us and others waiting to board a morning Trolley at the Fisherman's Wharf terminus. A mellow personality with a wonderful voice that carried you back to the flower power days! Would happily recommend this Holiday Inn to anyone wanting a reasonable price, great location and the bonus of a good breakfast buffet to start the sightseeing day. Our stay provided a pleasant springboard for what proved to be a wonderful holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good location”
Reviews.Author: sandylands
Reviews.Content: Arrived late evening and were checked in by an incredibly surly member of staff. However all the other staff were extremely pleasant and very, very helpful indeed. Room was clean and comfortable but with no view. Free breakfast very substantial and items constantly replenished. Were only there for 3 nights but thoroughly enjoyed a 3 1/2 hour tour of the city with Tower Coach tours one day and also a memorable seaplane tour over San Francisco bay on the next. Would definitely return to this hotel because of it's good value and location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Pringles_Princess
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our first night arriving from England after a long flight. The rooms were great and the location was excellent. Nearby to Fisherman's Wharf and Pier 39. The staff were very friendly an helpful. Especially as my case had been left behind in Chicago by the airline! The free internet access was an added bonus, as we were able to email family and friends back home and do a little research on the other places we were visiting. The breakfast was very nice and constantly being replaced as items were eaten. The hotel has a very nice lobby and has an above average feel to the place. We would recommend this hotel if you want excellent value, great location and friendly service.

Reviews.Title: “OK for the price”
Reviews.Author: Blackcherry
Reviews.Content: This is an OK hotel if you're on a budget. It's very near Fisherman's Wharf which is great. The rooms are extremely basic and the staff are surly at best so the less time you spend in the hotel the better! If you're looking for a cheap place to rest your head I guess you could do worse.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff and great place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After booking the holiday inn for part of our honeymoon we were expecting middle of the road- but this particular one was amazing. The amenties provided were top class, the place was immaculate- but most of all the staff were amazing- particularly Brandy who worked on reception- she treated everyone like she was in a 5 star hotel. I dont think i have ever stayed anywhere that treated me so well-even 5 star hotels arent normally this friendly and polite!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price!”
Reviews.Author: honeyfox4
Reviews.Content: Within walking distance to wharf. Very economical considering prices of other hotels nearby. Continental breakfast is more than just donuts and coffee but cereal, fresh fruit, muffins, juice, etc..and is included in price. Front desk was very helpful w/directions and transportation. Rooms are cute & clean w/HBO. Only 2 flaws I could find was 1.)most rooms don't have a view. But, if you're not in your hotel, or don't mind walking 2 blocks to the wharf, it's not an issue and 2)any San Fran hotel is going to cost you $30/day in parking but you're so close to cable cars, wharf, & busses that we didn't need a car for our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for tourists”
Reviews.Author: Mad-Maz999
Reviews.Content: Great location for Fishermans Wharf, trolley bus terminus, pier 39 (Alcatraz trip) Ghiradelli square, and the Golden Gate bridge on a tour. Lots of seafood restaurants and shops. You can get anywhere from here, we even walked from Coit tower, so I would recommend staying here more than in the city itself. Watch out for the hotel of the same name 2 blocks down as we were sent to the wrong hotel and wasted time trying to explain which hotel we were staying in! The room was clean and comfortable, staff helpful. The free continental breakfast (no hot food) was good with lots of choice of cereals, toast, boiled eggs, fruit, and great donuts and muffins.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: sleepl8
Reviews.Content: Just returned from staying at the Holiday Inn Express (April 23-27/05). GREAT VALUE. Perfect location, clean & quiet rooms, comfy beds, and the free breakfast was plentiful (cinnamon buns are great!). The location is so convenient. Make sure you go to Scomas for seafood (the lobster bisque is the best EVER! ) and the Crab House at Pier 39. Also at the Pier 39 is a spa that has an 'aqua massage' ($15 for 10 mins) that is soooooooo good. Its up on the top level. And don't forget Buena Vista pub for an Irish Coffee before calling it a night.........sooo good! Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Three great days ”
Reviews.Author: KARENO
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights here from 11th April 2005. Had a corner room with 2 Queen beds - 2 adults and 2 children - was fine. Room was very clean and comfortable with good tv and bathroom facilities. Hotel itself was superior to adjoining Holiday Inn - and cheaper too. Ideally located for trams and all Fisherman's Wharf/Pier 39/Alcatraz facilities - within short walking distance. Plenty of restaurants nearby too. Inclusive continental breakfast plentiful and good quality. All in all a good hotel - with helpful staff and free internet access in lobby too. Would most definately recommend it and use again.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn Express Fisherman's Wharf just OK”
Reviews.Author: specht3
Reviews.Content: The 1 king-size bed room was small. Finding a space on the floor for my 13-year-old son was a challenge. (We originally ordered a roll-a-way. Forget it. No place to put it.) Clean. Complimentary Continental breakfast with many foods is a plus. Parking is $30/night, but instead we parked overnight at garage on Hyde, just south of North Point for $20. Very convenient to the cable-car to downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: OregonResident
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights during spring break (March 2005) in a junior suite which includes microwave and mini-frig. There is a Safeway close by so we packed our lunches everyday and toted around our own soda which saved money. The room was wonderful and quiet even though we had a room overlooking a street and a parking lot. The location is great being near the Wharf, plus near the cable cars and several buses. The biggest downside was the breakfast bar was packed to capacity every morning, probably because there were 170 kids in two groups on Spring Break trips. That meant we had often had to watch like hawks to get a table and many people didn't have a clue about how to clean up after themselves. However, the breakfasts were great with doughnuts, hard-boiled eggs, fresh fruit, hot cinnamon buns, cereal, and toast/English muffins. There also isn't a laundry facility onsite so we had to go next door to the Holiday Inn (not HI Express). That was awful since the room was dirty, one elevator was broken and they were out of laundry detergent. Gino's makes great pizzas which you can have delivered to your room.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: WE STAYED AT THE HOLIDAY INN EXPRESS ON A FREE ACCOMDATION PLAN PROVIDED BY OUR CARRIER, it was excellent though there was a strike going on it was so managable and the staff ever so polite and friendly, we had with us a two year old and the areas surrounding the hotel were very safe, on our entire 3 day trip we only saw one homeless person near the hotel, about 4 blocks down. other wise it was the best place on the pier to stay. walking distance to the pier, even with a baby stroller it was a beautiful stay. and walk.

Reviews.Title: “just great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: stayed at the hotel btw 06mar-12mar. it was just great,the location was really good.quiet and yet not far from the wharf area.the free breakfast with cereals,fruits,muffins and so on was an advantage, especially if u travel with kids.there were 2 pcs in the lobby with free internet and it was good to b in touch with home while miles away.the room was clean,there was a coffee machine in the room ,the whole staff were friendly and we were not disappointed by any means.cable car stop, safeway and walgreen's were nearby.i wld definitely recommend this hotel to everyone.the only negative point was that one of the elevators was out of order during our stay and it took ages to go up or down.by the way,sfo was just great.i hope i wld go there again sometime.i really left my heart there.

Reviews.Title: “Bring on the sticky buns!”
Reviews.Author: gwenniepigz
Reviews.Content: This hotel hit the spot. Free internet access in your room if you travel with a laptop like I do. Free Wi-fi in the lobby. Free breakfast....sticky buns, cereal, fruit, toast, coffee, juice. I was pleased. Killer showerhead. I wanted to stay in there all day long. Clean room. Friendly staff. EXCELLENT location and rates. And fairly quiet considering I was staying on the same floor as some traveling high school chorus students. My only complaint: One of the 2 elevators was down the entire stay. And they locked the stairwell so you could only walk down the stairs, not up. Oh well.

Reviews.Title: “watch if you get bumped to sister hotel”
Reviews.Author: henrik2005
Reviews.Content: Arrived at holiday inn on feb 14th to find some rooms closed due to renovations and was transferred to sister hotel round corner. This has 24hr denny's downstairs so this will give an idea of how good it was. The hotel room was fine, recently been done and size wise was fine. Had booked hotel as had pool and gym but this was at sister hotel only so no access there. Also no lobby staff at any time when I was there (5 days). Someone came at intervals to check in guests but no concierge or security which made me feel uneasy. Food in dennys was inedible. Spoke to hotel manager re this and was offered immed transfer but not worth moving as 2 teenagers had unpacked so much stuff. was offered complimentary breakfast and discounted limo airport ride. Original hotel looked very nice and had all facilities and breakfast buffet was nice. moral is to not move to sister hotel Other than that, loved san francisco. hotel location is very good as at end of 2 trolley runs so easy to get everywhere. also good restauarants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! Great decor and breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: TravHopper
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 3nts at this hotel. The decor was contemporary and delightful. The location was perfect for all of the fun along the Wharf and close to the trolley and bus lines. A Walgreen's is just a kiddie corner block away for anything you forgot. The Hyatt across the street has a Budget Rental Car desk you can rent or drop your car there. The hotel has the traditional fully stocked HI Express breakfast. They kept everything supplied during the whole breakfast serving hours. We were upgraded to a junior suite when we checked in and found the rooms to be nicely decorated, clean and comfortable. They have internet stations in the lobby if you don't have a laptop with you. Perfect for the online checkin before you get to the airport. The cost of parking is about $28 per day and a cab to/from the airport cost me about $45. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again at all.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Bright and Good Value”
Reviews.Author: little_jo_uk
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel to anyone going on a city break to San Fransicso. It is spotlessly clean, the rooms are pleasant and it is in what feels like a very safe area; walking to the hotel even late at night did not pose any problems. There is a coffee machine in the room and the lifts are reliable. There is no bar, porter or room service so you wil have to cope with your own luggage and to book trips you have to go to the bigger "sister" hotel up the street. These are minor niggles. There is a nice sportsbar across the street for that night-cap and being in Fisherman's Wharf the restuarants nearby are in abundance. As the lifts are reliable managing luggage is not a big problem as the airport pick-up is right outside the hotel. Not much to fault and plenty to praise. You can even use the Internet for free if you can't stay offline for a few days. Good for those e-postcards home.

HotelInfo.Name: Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites San Francisco Fisherman's Wharf
HotelInfo.Address: 550 North Point Street, San Francisco, CA 94133
